placeInfo/address: Shanthipuara Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: Beautiful hotel in tea plantation area. Everything about this place wreaked history, the building,its environment. However for us one night was enough and if we had to cut one location from our 3 week trip it would be this one. Monmouth time consuming journey for very little. Although beautiful it was cold, which we knew when we booked , but the hotel was freezing. For the only time in Sri Lanka we found the staff a little surly . In fact after our evening meal , which was ok not memorable, we went into the ‘lounge area’ to play cards. This was 8.30pm, unlit fire , no one came to offer drinks or a blanket , the staff walked straight passed us and at 9pm turned light of and disappeared, we had no choice but to go to bed at 9.20pm.
title: Beautiful but no

placeInfo/address: Shanthipuara Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Room 3 bathroom stinks without much ventilation
text:
A boutique villa suitable for a lunch date or overnight stay. Clean, warm and charming heritage place. The head supervisor Lakshman is an angel and is primarily responsible for all the good reviews of the place. He speaks multiple languages including Hindi and can try to adjust the meagre resources available at the isolated place to serve your needs.

 The location is far away at a hilltop with some steep bends and no street lights. The kitchen stocks up based on the guest and is a hit and miss experience. The toilets seems to be having trouble with plumbing and smell. This is a good place for a very short stay. More than that this get boring with lack of activities, remoteness, slow Internet and passable food. 

I would repeat the place only for a overnight stay and not more
title: Overnight Joy, More would be boring

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Be aware that water in your fridge is chargeable and is not complimentary!
text:
We arrived after dark due to a busy day and unfortunately although warmly welcomed, we were kept waiting for quite a long time for our room. 
The lodges are great with a camping feel and outdoor bathrooms. 
Dinner and breakfast were very good. 
Unfortunately there was a misunderstanding regarding a bottle of water that we had used which we had presumed was complimentary but was chargeable. The hotel made contact after we had left requesting payment. Their banking details did not match with our bank and so we paid at the next Jetwing hotel that we stayed in. A bit unnecessary for a bottle of water in our opinion but there you go. 
Would recommend making this clearer to guests. 
Would have been a higher score if not for this.
title: Unfortunate misunderstanding

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: No tv and little to do as quite remote from Ella.
text:
When we arrived at the hotel, we were met by friendly staff who showed us a video explaining the history of the site and support they gave to local farmers. The accommodation was in a wooden hut overlooking the paddy fields. The weather in the evening was not kind to us, we had torrential rain which meant it was too wet to walk over to the bar as there were no facilities close by. They do provide bikes but these were no good in heavy rain. The netting around the bed (which was to protect us against mosquitoes) had dead flies stuck in it and a large hole which meant we were batting off insects during the night. We did move rooms the next day but a hole in the netting gave us the same problem with the insects. Breakfast was lovely with friendly staff. 

I don’t think we would return as it was too far from Ella and we missed our creature comforts. They do need to invest in the bedrooms as they are looking tired.
title: Friendly Staff but needs updating!

Jetwing Kaduruketha
placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
text:
I have very mixed feelings about this hotel. The service is excellent and the concept of staying within the nature, among 40 acres of paddy fields, is great. We spent over 1 hour walking around the nature. Unfortunately, the price is steep (over 200 USD per night) and the hotel positions itself as a 5-star luxury resort, but it is far from the quality level you would expect from such price point.

The hotel brands itself as sustainable and eco-friendly and that seems to be a recurring theme to justify all sorts of cost savings and quality downgrades to guests. Some things like the absence of AC or re-use of slippers/shampoo bottles make sense, as it  saves a lot of energy/resources, but there are many other things where it just felt the hotel was trying to be cheap: rooms are not super clean, very low light, no sound isolation, not much hot water, dozens of bugs and spiders in the room because the houses are not well built, staff often getting a bit confused (though everyone is super nice and helpful) due to insufficient training.

Also note that the driver accommodation has over 15 people per room. So for a hotel that prides itself on providing good conditions for locals, I find that a bit disturbing. I'm not sure what the conditions for staff are, but I assume they are not much better.

We don't regret staying in the hotel as it was an interesting experience, but just don't come expecting true luxury
title: Good experience but not true luxury

text:
I used to love this place. I still like the place, but the quality has gone down. 

The welcome was nice, check-in was quick and easy. Love the paddy field facing chalets, it was the uttermost serenity.

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
text:
Arrived in the afternoon after a long drive, but there was no drinking water in the room. Had to call and get a couple of bottles. 
The room was full of cob webs, when you lay on the bed you could see a lot of cobwebs and dust on the roof. 
Dust and stains behind the blinds.
Overall cleanliness in room is poor.
Three pathway lights next to the room were not working, which we found difficult during night time.
Garden outside the chalet can be cleaned better. Grass was overgrown.  
Food was good, quality of desserts need to improve - too much of gelatin.
Biggest plus point is the friendly and attentive staff at the restaurant and bar.    
Amazing property that has a lot of potential.
title: Beautiful Location, Wonderful staff, But long way more to go .......

It is truly disheartening to read that your stay with us was not in par with your expectations and we sincerely apologize for all the inconveniences caused. 

The layout and design of the guest rooms are inspired by the architecture of traditional village homes in Sri Lanka, with modern equipment to make the guests' stay comfortable. placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at Jetwing as a family and facilities offered are not on par with a normal 5 star stay. 
The architecture of the rooms doesn’t cater for weather conditions at all. It was a rainy day and our bathroom was flooded. It was a massive health and safety hazard as anyone could slip and fall and injure themselves. There were no room ammenities to make it a five star hotel. 
Food was good. And staff were very friendly. 
But beyond that for over $480 a night, it’s really don’t give you the 5 star experience you pay for.

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
text:
Aesthetically pleasing resort hotel that misses a few notes user-experience wise. 

As a survivor of a mosquito-borne illness, I don’t get giddy or exoticizing over paddy fields in my backyard. Looks great but it’s a mosquito breeding ground! Got stung so many times despite having used insect repellent balm.

Another point to fault is dining area that is often out of sight of the waiter. This is primarily a design problem. Dining area is in roofed open area while the waiters were mostly in the walled off bar area. Every time, I had to walk over to call the waiter just to make an order.

Now the room. The mosquito netting over the bed has big holes which defeats its purpose. The mesh of the door to the open bathroom also has big holes, thus offering little barrier to the mosquitoes for a feasty visit!

So despite the stunning view and aesthetic designs, and friendly staff, I’d have to advise anyone against staying at this place.
title: Amazing looking place...but that’s it

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here for 2 nights and it was one of the most interesting experiences in tour of Sri Lanka. On our first night, we were greeted by torrential rain but we were warmly received and taken to our lodge. I have never seen a room as bad (106). It was not clean, the netting around the beds were completely torn and as a result of the rain, many insects had someone managed to get into the lodge. Moreover, the bathroom was outdoors and infested with ants, slugs, mosquitos and god knows what else. I called the management immediately to ask for the bed to be cleaned and for a new net to be put up. Unfortunately, I had to call a second time as none of the staff came to inspect the room. Eventually, two men came to look at the problem and understood my concerns. They said they did not have another net or any other rooms so we would have to just put the lights out and get some sleep. Not ideal! The next morning, whilst we were searching for another hotel as I had no intention of going through another night of being eaten alive, one of the staff approached to inform me that they were changing our room and had the decency the apologise for the previous night. This was very much appreciated and we decided to give the hotel another chance and stay for a second night. Again, it rained heavily on our second night, but the lodge was much better with netting that actually worked and an indoor bathroom. 

Other points, the views of the paddy fields are fantastic and the service is generally quite good. The staff are friendly and helpful. The food is mixed. I thought the breakfast was poor but the dinner was quite good, especially the Sri Lankan dishes.
title: Managed to redeem the worst hotel experience in my life...

placeInfo/address: Kotikambokka 91200 Sri Lanka
text:
The highlight of the hotel was the food... the menu is limited to mainly Sri Lankan dishes and they do the Sri Lankan food very well. The bread basket of fish buns, kimbula banis etc given as a starter for breakfast is awesome and so if the chef who takes a lot of care for the gusts. If you could get the table overlooking the pool you can enjoy your meal with great views of the pool and paddy fields

We really enjoyed the dip in the pool overlooking the paddy fields.

The rooms are spread out chalets and very average. The biggest issue was that the rooms were not air-conditioned! The only airconditioned area in the hotel was the library which could seat 4 persons and is your rescue on a hot day. Also there were bugs in the rooms. The bathroom has a 3/4 wall from the room and made us a bit uncomfortable as we were sharing a room 

The front desk needs to have better coordination with the head office and be updated on the booked rates of the guests. We were charged almost 30% more and had to show the confirmation from head office and get the bill corrected. Also it maybe worthwhile checking online (such as booking.com) for better rates

The hotel is about 5-6hrs drive from Colombo
title: Good food , average rooms

text:
This is a decent hotel made up of a series of lodges set in huge grounds so often it's a bit of a walk to find your way to the pool or to breakfast. The surrounding land is paddy fields so most of the lodges have views over a rural landscape - very peaceful and calming.
Rooms are well furnished and spacious.
A few things let to hotel down, like the dogeared state of the menus - it's no great advertisment for the meal you are about to order if the menu card has long since seen better days.
One or two areas seem to be left half finished particularly around the (otherwise excelent) pool.
Staff and management are keen to help and most seem to be on the ball.
title: Well situated but could do better.

text:
We had a visit Dec 2016. We enjoyed ourselves the environment very much. The pool is good place to relax and the staff was very helpful. The surrounding was very attractive , calm and relaxed also well maintained. The rooms were cleaned and comfortable but the room keys were not unlocking properly .
The food quality was very good but we had to order several times because the portions were too small. The food verity was not enough for this type of hotel. Felt like not enough staff too and the existing staff members were trying to do their best.

We enjoyed the cycle ride . Also there is a natural water way one can have a bath , but unfortunately this season not enough water due to lack of rain. 
The staff were friendly and very helpful.
title: Family trip

ownerResponse/text:

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We appreciate your compliments on our staff friendliness and the beautiful balcony views. However, we're sorry to hear about the issues you encountered with the condition of your room, including worn furnishings and a malfunctioning minibar/fridge. Please accept our apologies for any inconvenience caused. We have taken note of your concerns and will address them with our team to ensure improvements are made. placeInfo/address: Wella Devala Road, Yaddehimulla, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
Room 226 (King Wave Room)

This hotel looks fancy and the rooms look very tasteful in photos. So we were a bit taken aback when we saw how worn the room was. The colours are still nice – just very worn. Some of the furnishings were simply too worn to be acceptable. The minibar/fridge literally fell apart when we opened it. We pointed this out and got a replacement fridge the next day which was also worn, albeit a little bit better. The bathroom door locked itself from the inside because it touched against the shower wall so we had to keep the bathroom door open to stop it from happening.

The room itself was spacious and the balcony super. We were very lucky with the location of the room – on the second floor and directly overlooking the pool and sea. So this was a very big plus.

The staff were all very friendly – another big plus.

The location in Unawatuna is a bit removed from the worst hustle and bustle and thus a bit quieter. The hotel put on loud outdoor music one of the evenings and we felt like complaining as we wanted to go to bed around 10 PM (for an early start the next morning), but they did stop the music at 10:30 – I suppose that's OK for most people but not everyone likes the loud boom-boom but prefers peace and quiet.

On the whole, we had an OK experience – we enjoyed the balcony and the views and the friendly staff. But the room and furnishings were unfortunately too worn for more than a 3-star rating.
title: Great views but very worn

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Greetings from Thaproban Pavilion Waves!

Thank you for your stay with us and for sharing your experience with us. We were pleased to read you liked the Food was good ,generally quick service ,high quality breakfast buffet and excellent view from pool to private rocks but were sorry to hear there were some issues with few things mentioned in review . Once again Thank you very much for sharing your valuable feedback and looking forward in welcoming you back at Thaproban Pavilion!

Thaproban Pavilion Waves Manager
placeInfo/address: Wella Devala Road, Yaddehimulla, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
Overall, the hotel leaves a lot to be desired  - it's out of Unawatuna town, prices are way too high for service you get, and some  just 'not quite right' things. Probably better  to save some cash and downgrade, or pay more.. because what you get here is 5 star prices with a 4 star hotel. Nice view (from some rooms). 

The positives: Food was good. Chef came out to explain how he cooled things. Generally quick service. Small selection but high quality breakfast buffet. Excellent view from pool to private rocks (that photo you see on their website).

The negative: Prices are about 30%+ relative to other equivalent places. Pool has no shade and by 1030 is near unbearable -  Only 3 poolside seats have umbrellas, so you can sit inside restaurant or bake. The room we booked had views of solar panels, so we downgraded from the suite / family room to a king size with a view - no reimbursement of price difference because according to them "they were being flexible". Bathrooms not great standard. Guests at 5am getting home from beach parties playing loud music (two out of two nights). Twice placed food order and ha things not delivered. Gym is small, but also was busy.

Other things: At sign in, "we have a tuk tuk to our private beach", later "sorry no tuk tuk is available but you can walk". At sign in, "just ask at reception for pool towels", later "sorry we only have 1 towel left, can you use your room towel?".  Free WiFi, "connected, no internet available".
title: 3 Stars on value for money, 4 on actual service, 5 is what they think they are..

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for your comments. We are happy that you found the décor, rooms and pools “brilliant” – a point noted by many visitors. Our concept of blending in with nature and allowing the visitor to enjoy the glory of the Sri Lankan Southern shores have struck a chord with many of our guests who return year after year. 

In our zest to accommodate our guests, we are sometimes compelled to allow them to use the pools after or before hours as they are highly enjoyable – with a choice of salt water and fresh water to plunge in. however we request all guests to be considerate and abide by the pool times mentioned clearly as 8a.m. – 7p.m. 

It is unfortunate that you had to endure irritations as those you mentioned, but if you had brought these to the notice of the hotel manager, we could have minimized them by taking some action to ensure your comfort and peace.

placeInfo/address: Wella Devala Road, Yaddehimulla, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed in 7 hotels on our Sri Lanka tour and sadly, this is the one we enjoyed the least and i not usually one for a 'bad review'. 
The Hotel itself in terms of decor is brilliant, the rooms are great and the pools are brilliant. However... we had a poolside room and although the pool opening times state 8am - 8pm there were guests in the pool from 7am on one occasion and until 11pm in the evening which made it very noisy in our room. When i asked a member off staff about the times he just said you can use the pool any hour of the day. 
The restaurant also plays quite annoying 'pipe style' music from about 7am which is really noisy for the rooms next to the pool. 
My last point is that the staff are constantly trying to sell you the Spa services and to force you to eat in the restaurant that evening... The food in the restaurant is average and way more expensive than that of the brilliant restaurants nearby (Sea waves for example). 
All in all, it was an expensive stay and left us feeling like we were ready to leave.
title: We felt let down...

text: The hotel is nice and the rooms are spacious. It is generally quiet which is nice. The staff are friendly. However, the service is inconsistent. Everything takes quite a long time, whether you ask for food, or a drink or a towel. There always only seems to be one waiter around and it is not really clear whether they understand what you are asking for. For the price of accommodation I would expect more. The staff also spend a lot of time trying to peddle other services to you during breakfast, which is unnecessary. If I want to do something, I will come and ask you.
title: Mixed feelings

placeInfo/address: Wella Devala Road, Yaddehimulla, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The rooms on ground floor have very little privacy being close to the pool and restaurant.
text: I was hoping to give a better review, but due to my experience I have to mark it average. The positives were that the restaurant staff were very friendly and helpful and the location was central making it easy to go to the attractions we had planned to visit. The restaurant was really modern and well laid out as is the reception area. The food was a hit and miss - we had both breakfasts and dinners at the hotel. Breakfasts were typical buffet style with enough of a variety to please most pallets. Dinner was a set four course menu of which I would say 30% of the food was below average (for example, a creme brulee that consistent of a very basic custard with completely un-bruleed sugar on top - it was probably the worst dessert I have ever had). The barbecue dinner was much better. The room we stayed in was mediocre. Bathroom was dated with very few amenities ( 1 small bar of soap, refilled bottles of body wash, shampoo and conditioner, 1 loofah and a small bottle of body lotion. Also, no hotel slippers, only very large flip flops to be worn at the hotel only. The towels did not always smell fresh (like they had not dried properly) although they were replaced daily and they were very average. At a hotel, especially a "fancy" hotel I expect high quality towels and preferably white knowing that they have probably been bleached before use. The towels were beige and grey and very small, and the only other set were very very small hand towels so I had to dry my hair with my wet body towel. The bedding was a bit thick and heavy for the climate - a unfitted sheet option would have made it more comfortable. My pillow also had multiples stains on it (both mold and saliva stains) which I addressed with staff and they provided me slightly less stained pillows. The spare set of pillows were in a musky cupboard and had pillow cases that were slightly too small for the pillows exposing stains on them too and were unacceptable to use. The balcony was spacious and the salt water pool was really nice. I, however, left feeling slightly disappointing with this being the final leg of our journey and higher expectations relative to the cost, I do not see myself returning soon to this hotel.
title: Did not live up to expectations

placeInfo/address: Wella Devala Road, Yaddehimulla, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
We finished our honeymoon with 3 nights here. The bar staff and restaurant staff were attentive, breakfast quite good and the wave suite had a nice big balcony with ocean view.

We were a bit disappointed with the bathroom as it seemed unclean, very tired and in need of maintenance in the shower and tiles missing. We also noticed stains on beach towels, bath towels, sheets and quilt cover.

Although it was an enjoyable stay, we would probably not return to this hotel.
title: Nice views, big room but a tired hotel and stains on everything

placeInfo/address: Wella Devala Road, Yaddehimulla, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Some rooms open directly to pool which is cool!
text: This hotel is right ON a rocky seashore where waves crash spectacularly on the rocks, making for a wonderful view and sound.  The natural view is spectacular.  We loved being ON the pool as well - we could walk out of our room and straight into the pool, which with its infinity edge towards the ocean looks as if it leads straight into the rocks!  The setting was definitely cool, and the staff was generally good but needs more training (when we asked for towels for the pool, rather than say "it's my pleasure I will have them brought to you" the staff told us to go to housekeeping, wherever that might be....they did bring them upon our third request).  The three star is because the room was somewhat dirty and had gnats/bugs...with some housekeeping work and some staff training this could be a really cool place.  (Also, there was a "Jungle Beach" nearby that we found on our own - no one told us about this very cool place.  Would be great for the hotel to provide info on what's nearby!  The cool narrow streets of Unawatuna with shops and restaurants are a little bit far to walk - so you might want to stay closer if you want to be "where the action is")
title: Great View of Rocky Shore

ownerResponse/text:

We recognize the importance of maintaining these details to enhance our guests’ experience, and we will be taking corrective actions to ensure that these areas receive the attention they need. On a brighter note, it’s fantastic to hear that you enjoyed the food served at our restaurant, particularly the à la carte options for lunch and dinner. placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
Unfortunately, in my opinion, this hotel did not live up to all of the 5* the reviews. In contrast to every other hotel we visited in Sri Lanka (we had stayed in 6 prior to this hotel) the management at this hotel was absent! The junior suite was very spacious and the beds were comfortable but like the hotel, the room lacked any type of character. The AC unit in the room was it working when we arrived and neither were several of the power sockets.  Once reported, the management promptly sent out an engineer who managed to fix everything. The AC went off again the next night due to a powercut but the back up generator did not kick in for several hours as we were woken up at 5am by the heat! 
The bathroom was rather dated and the towels were not white and fluffy but an off white colour and fraying at the edges (and one had holes).  The pathway to the rooms were also in need of repair with cracked tiles in  several places. 
The pool is a good size but the sunbeds are old and quite rickety.   
Breakfast was ok and buffet style with a mixture of both Sri Lankan and western options. Lunch and dinner however were al la carte and they were both very good, serving some of the best food we had during our stay in Sri Lanka. If you are in the area it’s worth popping in for lunch/dinner, you won’t be disappointed!
title: Ok hotel but they do serve lovely food

placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
We’ve just spent two nights at the Amaranthe Bay Hotel where nothing is as it seems. On arrival the hotel looks OK and the prices would suggest it is of 4 star standard however this is actually not the case. We paid US$158 per night for what we thought was a mini suite room however turned out to be the adjacent room to the executive suite. We were under the impression that the room contained a king size bed however it was a queen and my husband who is 6’1” was too long and his legs hung over the end.

Nothing in the room worked properly. The power pads control numerous lights, fans, etc however some didn’t work and others controlled things they shouldn’t. For example, when you turned off the light above the mirror it also turned off the fan and AC. The second AC unit turned itself off at night and so the bedroom was unbearably hot at night necessitating the fan being switched to high. We advised reception and to their credit they contacted maintenance who came to fix it however it stopped again.

We purchased B&B and breakfast was quite the experience. The poached eggs were precooked and sitting in a Bain Marie which meant they were hard and rubbery. There was carrots vichy, garlic spinach and cooked zucchini together with a multitude of sweets aimed at the children.

The pool area is quite nice however there are insufficient loungers for the number of guests.

The hotel is not on a beach and is about a 10 minute walk from Upavilla Beach. The beach is lovely. 

The problem is there are only two high end hotels so there is no competition.
title: Sri Lankan Fawlty Towers

placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text: We had a relaxing couple of days at Amaranthe Bay. The junior suite is a very big room, which was great and has a nice balcony on the upper floor with views over the lagoon. The best feature of our stay was a highly comfortable bed and we slept soundly. The negatives of the property were the grounds and pool area which were dated and in need of maintenance. The pool sun loungers were rickety and in pretty poor condition. If the hotel is serious about its desire to keep customers happy these should have been replaced long ago. The breakfast offering was poor both in quality and choice. As a result we chose not to dine in the hotel for lunch/ dinners or for breakfast on the 2nd morning (the "Cafe on the 18th" is awesome with the best coffee and breakfast dishes of our two week trip).  Our stay at the Amaranthe Bay can best be described as average and not sure we would recommend to others.
title: Amaranthe Bay - pretty average and needing some care and attention

placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
Having been to Sri Lanka five times over the last 23 years this was a Nice hotel and grounds on the backwater so not on the beach but peaceful and quiet. Nice large rooms with backwater views but the decorator should have been sacked as he certainly didn’t know where walls started and finished. Staff friendly but need some serious hospitality/waiter training as mealtimes where very haphazard and disorganised. Lots of little annoying things that showed they really didn’t know what they were doing. We also had a safety worry as throughout our stay the pool lights were hanging from wires out of the pool while staff were working on them!
It appeared that the staff had very mixed roles but nobody seemed to take ownership of specific roles. This could well be down to the owner/manager who walked about but not interested in engaging with his clients. The most helpful and responsible staff member seemed to be the accountant who helped to resolve some of our issues.
Our thoughts are they need to employ a good hotel manager with experience. Having said that it was the nicest hotel in the area.
title: Nice hotel but...

placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
The amaranthe bay is beautifully situated on a river arm.  We had booked the hotel for two days as part of a round trip.  We were warmly welcomed.  The rooms are modern and beautifully furnished.  The pool is also good.  But the reception area and the dining room somehow fell out of time (reminds strongly of the 70s) and they don't match the rest of the hotel. 
 
The food in the restaurant (buffet) was good.  The breakfast was not very good.  We had to search for a long time to find something that appealed to us. 
 
What bothered us the most was the service in the restaurant and bar area.  Either slowly (30 minutes until somebody serves us at the bar) and then the ice for the cocktails was missing (it happens that you need it at a bar) or inattentively.  According to the motto, always friendly but rarely available.  This unfortunately draws down the good impression that the hotel made in the area of the rooms.
title: Nice room but the service is wasn't good

Leslie and the team
placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text: The suite that we stayed in was nice and updated (very large top floor room). It included a large tub and great views. The wall was wet and it appeared that there was a water leak somewhere which was reported. The pool was nice but the furniture around the pool and the pool itself was well used/worn looking. The food at the restaurant was okay (buffet style in the morning) but the hotel itself is not that close to the beach. We walked to the beach (15 mins) but the actual location of the assigned beach area is much further away. The best thing about our stay here was the balinese massage. Ria was AMAZING!!!!!!!!!! I would most def recommend anyone to go there for a massage esp with her. The massage/spa area could use nicer furniture in the entry area and it was very cold in the massage room with only towels to cover ( I would recommend using sheets instead of towels). Overall our stay was nice but we were slightly disappointed that the hotel was not nearly as nice as shown in its pictures on the website.
title: Nice suite with view but pictures are not an accurate reflection of current state of resort

placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
We booked the standard suite through Agoda, as the pictures were exactly the same as for the junior suite. We expected a nice, clean, 4 star room as advertised. 

The room we were given was awful. It smelled, had no windows, was grubby and poorly maintained. Felt more like a roadside motel and I immediately regretted the booking. You will find much better rooms in trinco for the price of the standard suite. 

Luckily we were able to upgrade to the junior suite which was just beautiful. Spatious, clean, gorgeous jacuzzi with views over the river. The service was very friendly and they were happy to show us other rooms when we said that the standard suite was not acceptable for us. 

I find it strange that a hotel can have such a huge variation in quality between the two room types. Photos attached are from the standard suite.
title: Watch out for standard suites

placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
We enjoyed our 1 night very much. The rooms were amazing for their size and being a recent build very well appointed with spa, quite modern electrics, safe, etc. The rooms are very clean, new beds are very comfortable, the food and service are both good.  Overall this place is wonderful to stay at but it’s a solid 3 star hotel, not extraordinary - except for the room size.

Having river frontage and a slightly smaller pool, with water a little on cool side, are factors in my thinking.
title: Super spacious rooms, seemingly each with own spa

placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
First up we have to remember that  Trincomalee spent a huge amount of time being isolated away from 'developing' southern Sri Lanka due to the war hence the title of this review. They are trying to get it right but there are things that need attending to. If I could do a 3.5 rating that's where this rating would be.
What's good.......the staff are super friendly and will go out of their to help you with anything. This included front office, housekeeping, bar and restaurant. Management need to support them in their enthusiasm and channel it accordingly. They really do want the hotel to be successful and it will get better as the destination becomes more frequently visited.
What's not so good.....slippery surfaces. We upgraded to a suite for a reasonable price which allowed us a large room fully renovated downstairs with direct garden and pool access which was lovely. The decor was good, clean and modern but the tiles in the bathroom were deadly when wet and by deadly I mean deadly. We ended up using towels on the shower floor while showering to make sure we didn't lose our footing or slip and fall. Even wearing thongs didn't help.
The other slippery surface was that around the pool coping tile.....again the tiles looked great but once you step on that wet surface they are slippery and could be dangerous.
I did speak to the staff about this and sincerely hope management have taken notice and applied non-slip material to avoid any what could be nasty accidents.
The restaurant has a nice aspect but with the constant opening and closing of doors the flying insects just loved to make their way to the buffet breakfast bar. No more to be said about that. The breakfast buffet was ok but there could be some improvement. 
Overall the stay was good and made all the better by the staff and excellent massage at the spa.
title: They are trying.....3.5 rating

placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text: I came to Trincomalee with my wife for our third wedding anniversary.  The accommodations met our expectations, but the music in the restaurant needs to change!  Club music every morning at a couples resort ruined the romantic mood during breakfast.  They either need to get rid of the music in the restaurant all together, or change it to some slow, quiet relaxing music.
title: Music Needs To Change!

placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Negotiate with prices - it is overpriced but they will come down.
text: We stayed here for three nights on our honeymoon, and we had a junior suite. The room itself was impressive at first glance - lovely hot tub overlooking river, spacious room and well-designed. But on closer inspection it wasn't very clean, door into jacuzzi bath broken, mould in the bathroom. For the price it didn't seem good enough. We ate there on the first night, it was a 'Mongolian' themed night - not really! The food was pre-cooked and then vaguely heated on a BBQ outside, nothing seemed to have been cooked fresh and it was really average. We had much better meals outside the hotel in Uppuveli, for a better price. The staff seemed tired and overworked - we saw the same five faces all day every day, which seemed very strange for such a big, apparently top-class hotel, and no one seemed to have a specific role. The 'cocktails' were milkshakes with alcohol in them, made in a blender. We appreciate cocktails aren't Sri Lankan, but don't offer them if you can't make them. The pool area was very nice though, and it's in a lovely spot over the river and it's very close to Uppuveli restaurants etc. Overall it could be a great hotel but if they want to charge top price they need to offer something better.
title: Overpriced and lacking attention to detail

ownerResponse/text:
Hi JJ1701, and thanks for your candid review.  I’m sorry that you had a less than perfect experience while staying with uss, but it’s unfortunate that you’ve chosen such a title for your review.  It seems like you're attempting to discredit our hotel by targetting all the good effort and time that our past guests have invested when writing their own personal reviews for TripAdvisor.  Claiming that their posted  photos and reviews are deceptive is surely not a productive and fair way to engage in a critique of our establishment. I would have much preferred if you had addressed the conversation between you and my team without blaming our guests for an experience regarding a perception you felt was untrue.  I’m very happy though you round our rooms satisfyingly spacious however, and our sri lankan cuisine good.  But am unhappy that we disappointed you and your group in regards to service delays and a burnt steak.  Pleased however to hear they were able to cook it properly to your satisfaction upon indication, and I’ve actually reviewed our menu regarding this item upon our menu. We always look to improve :)  Regarding charging for the beach, my manager states that we don’t charge and never have charged for boating our guests down to the neighboring beach, and any charges would be to rent their umbrellas.  The aqua-taxi is a service we provide free of charge to guests wanting a day at the surf.  It’s free, and so is the five minute walk to it from our own hotel :)  I want to apologize once again for your experience, but I’m reviewing everything that you’ve stated was a sore point and am looking to make changes that will improve our guest experience.  I’m hoping that you’ll one day come visit us again and see if we can show you what so many other guests have seen in Amaranthe Bay as a small and exclusive getaway upon our little lagoon.  Thank you for taking your time to write us!
With kindest regards and best wishes
Loyola & The Team :)
placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Rooms with the pool view and on the ground floor are the best.
text:
The approach to the hotel does not have a wow factor.
The rooms are very spacious and that I think is the only plus point.  
We were 11 of us and the F&B service staff were not equipped to provide a seamless service.  Many things requested for had to be asked again and were delayed.  
The Sri Lankan cusine was good compared to the other items on the menu e.g. the ordered steak had to be sent back as it was so tough and not edible.
The hotel does not have a beach but offers a boat ride to the beach for which the guest has to pay and this should not be the case, since they do not have a beach.
title: Photos of the Hotel and reviews are somewhat deceptive

I’m disheartened however with your feedback regarding the staff not being warm enough.  We've had terrific reviews in Tripadvisor since we first opened, and our staff has been consistently praised as being insightful, generous and kind.  I’m hoping that there wasn’t a singular incident or some other reason at our hotel that we perhaps could have changed that letft you with this impression? Loyola & The Team  :)
placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text: We moved to this hotel after staying in Trinco Blu for 2 nights. The landscaping of this hotel was perfect with nice swimming pool facing the lagoon. However the room where we stayed in (standard room) was not tastefully done. The staff was nice, but not very warm like we experienced elsewhere. I wanted to give 3.5 Stars, but chose 3 in the meter.
title: Expensive Taste But The Rooms were OK..

ownerResponse/text:
Thanks Will for your candid review!  I’m glad you got to visit us, had a friendly time with our staff, finding them helpful and kind :)  Also really glad you liked the pool, as it’s one of my favorite places to be at the hotel.  Center stage, lagoon-facing, and sprawled out in front of the suites so that everyone can feel they’re seeing and being a part of  the action.  I’m really sorry however that you did not find your time with us as satisfying as if there had been a beach.  When we built Amaranthe Bay, we actually had to choose between the type of character or ambiance we wanted to create for our guests.  We knew that if we went beach, it would impact our vision of a secluded, private, tucked away retreat. So we instead opted for going lagoon.  After making this choice, we then instituted a free Aqua Taxi service which floats guests down the lagoon to the beach with their belongings, or they just mosey on down the path to the beach. It’s only five minute away :)  I also read your feedback on the rooms you selected, and I’m sorry if you didn’t get the ones you had wanted.  We only offer two basic types of rooms here on site, the Standard Twin and the Junior Suites.  If you look at Agoda, Trip Advisor,  or even our own web site, you can see from the photos a very clear difference in characteristics such as floors and furniture that distinguish one from another. The Standard rooms though are thankfully easier on the budget with no luxury amenities, but do come well equipped with air conditioning, bar fridge, a safe and other amenities. They of course don't share the luxury (and highly talked about) features of the Junior Suites which feature indoor jacuzzi, balcony views, high ceilings and teak floors. I can understand how disappointing it must have felt to be thinking of one thing and getting another, but I hope your experience with us this time doesn't discourage you from visiting us again.  If you’re looking for a place to zen out, do some kayaking, watch eagles swoop about, or just sit back and sip icy cocktails with me and the team, we’d love to have you over again!  Thank you for writing us.
With respect and kindest wishes!
Loyola  & The Team :)
placeInfo/address: No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here after staying a night at Cinnamon Trinco Blu which is just up the street The first thing, Amaranthe isn't on the beach, it is on a tidal waterway that leads to the ocean, so after staying right on the beach it was a bit of a disappointment.  

The hotel is known for its large and well decorated rooms. Unfortunately that was not our experience. We booked via Agoda and it's pretty clear that the hotel has certain rooms for travelers that book via travel sites and not directly with the property.  One of the desk people confirmed as much when I asked him point blank.  Kind of disappointing there as well. I would recommend putting realistic photos on those travel site listings so guests aren't misled. 

The staff was very helpful and all incredibly kind.  They're all locals and the hotel was built by aid donated after the tsunami struck in 2004, so that was a nice feature of the place. 

All in all, I think the hotel is OK.  The pool is nice, but the lack of a beach or close beach access was kind of a bummer for us.   It's also just kind of boring to be honest - not much going on or interaction with other guests. There is a pool bar, but nobody really inhabited it.  We ended up spending two nights and going back to Trinco Blu for more energy and the beach vibe.
title: Nice Hotel - Not on the Beach

placeInfo/address: St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
My wife, our four-years-old daughter, and I recently had a relatively good three-nights stay at this large beachfront hotel. The hotel’s design, facilities, and amenities are incredibly luxurious and modern, but the staff tends to be more formal than friendly.
A very serious issue at the hotel is the presence of mosquitoes and other insects, both in public areas and in the rooms. Although the hotel provides a modern device to repel mosquitoes inside the room but the lobby, a large part of the main restaurant, and the pool area are full of them. I found it surprising that despite the hotel's generosity in providing high-quality amenities for guests, they don’t offer a simple or inexpensive insect repellent spray, nor do they sell it in their on-site shops. Unfortunately, even the staff could not properly guide me on where to purchase one. (However, I must express my deep gratitude to Mr. Suranda, who was very kind and lent us his personal spray on the first night so we could use it for our four-year-old daughter.)
In general, don't put too much trust in the promises made at the hotel. For example, they took my WhatsApp contact to coordinate water sports activities, but as of writing this review, my message hasn’t even been seen! They also promised to email me the final bill, but that never happened. And there were several other similar cases...
We didn’t try the Asian or Italian restaurants (which have additional charges), but the main restaurant (we had half-board service) wasn’t particularly enjoyable. We almost always had to search for an empty indoor table (to avoid mosquitoes and the high humidity). The variety and quality of local food were acceptable, but the drink service—water, tea, and coffee—was terrible. Despite multiple reminders to different staff members, drinks were either not served, served very late, or not refilled.
The hotel's oceanfront beach is good, but not as stunning as the beaches in Bentota. The hotel has two main pools—one of which does not allow children (?). The other pool is excellent, with great temperature and views, but even there, the service wasn’t up to five-star standards. I had to fetch towels myself from the designated area.
Unfortunately, I noticed some behaviors that made me feel like certain nationalities received better service than others. I sincerely hope my impression was wrong.
The kids’ club, however, was amazing—professional, well-organized, and run by kind and talented staff. A special thanks to all three staff members there!
Despite all my criticisms, the staff kindly allowed us a late check-out for six hours for $50. However, on our last morning, they moved us to another room that didn’t even have towels, and we ended up spending time chasing a lizard out of the new room!
The hotel offers currency exchange services too, but they provide very low rates and only accept extremely new bills—any small stain or stamp on the note means they won’t take it. 
Their transfer services are also priced at three to five times the cost of Uber or local taxis (though this is common in most luxury hotels).
Overall, my stay wasn’t bad, but it was far from what I had imagined...
title: Not bad

placeInfo/address: St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text: This is a 5* hotel in name only. In this respect it is very pretentious. Whilst the room was good and comfortable it ws not madecup until mid afternoon. Not 5* service. The restaurent food and service was poor. Buffet dinner in the evening was a tired affair with cold soup and luke warm main dishes. Ordering drinks was frustrating 30 minutes to get a glass of wine. Dirty plates were not cleared promptly. Staff were friendly and tried to help but were not well trained and had no leadership. Not 5*. My booking for the Italian restaurent was cancelled by management because of a group booking taking over the whole restaurent.  The dinner at 'The Spice' restaurent  went well but they ran out of the wine I was drinking. Not 5* Breakfast  buffets were reasonable but only 2 of the 3 I had were acceptable. Again getting coffee took forever and staff were not sure what to do. Swimming pools  were good. Noisy trains through the night and the call to prayer at 4.30am each morning disturbed sleep. This hotel is 3* level charging 5* prices. Look for alternatives.  Very disappointed.

placeInfo/address: St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
Possibly one of the best hotels we have stayed in throughout the world.
Luxurious, spectacular views, some of the best food ever with lovely, if untrained staff who lacked proper management (we have been told salaries of staff in Sri Lankan hotels are low).
We had a 3 night stay at the end of a busy and excellent group tour of Sri Lanka.
A day and a half of rest, we thought!

Baggage handling, as it had been throughout Sri Lanka was superb. Our room comfortable and spotless but lacking towels etc. one pair  of flip floor had been worn and some of the toiletries opened. It took 3 visits to resolve.
Our ground floor verandah overlooked pleasant enough greenery.

We ate in the Italian restaurant, one of the best Italian meals we have ever had.
Our first breakfast surpassed our expectations. We spoke to a restaurant manager to praise the eggs chef. We were introduced to him.

We decided to book the Italian Restaurant again for our final holiday meal. We were told they had a Valentines Day tasting menu at (I think)99$pp. We declined and booked the Spice Restaurant; again superb food.
Some of our fellow tour friends had booked the Italian but had not been told the change of menu. They cancelled their booking.

On our only full day of relaxation we went to the idyllic beach cove where we happily ensconced ourselves until!!!
The Hotel had decided to have a special St Valentines Day dine on the beach at, 200$ pp? (The figures may be wrong). By midday staff were erecting dining areas effecting the views which the hotel is famous  for.
We retired to the adults only swimming pool to find a similar situation ‘dine at the pool and at a similar cost?). People moving chairs and tables in front of us. We returned to our veranda for a restful afternoon but had been denied the facilities we had paid substantially for.

I am sure the evening meal experiences would have been superb but at that price they had to be.

I wonder how many of the hotel residents could be catered for and, indeed how many paid to attend these events. None of our group did.

What was the justification to ruin the pleasure and facilities of the majority to enable the hotel to further increase its revenue stream in addition to the substantial charges it makes for residency.

In describing our glorious holiday we emphasise the general Sri Lankan hotel excellence. Sadly for this hotel it is their disregard for its paying clients that we remember first, despite the food quality etc.

If booking check what ‘experiences’ they are running!
title: It should have been the most idyllic!

placeInfo/address: St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Allow time to navigate the hotel and deal with reception
text:
Unfortunately we arrived late at the hotel, which meant it was not a good start. Everyone was tired and wanted to get to their rooms and then have dinner. The check in process was protracted and when I arrived for dinner the restaurant were unaware of our group and had to reconfigure the room to accommodate us, displacing guests already dining! I as advised to collect my food from the buffet. However, when I retuned to the table I had no cutlery and nobody was interested in my requirements. IN the end the manger came over and asked it I was OK, I asked again for cutlery and a drink, which he then proceeded to get. So not a good start. The food though was delicious and plentiful.
The room was amazing and the outlook great. Some noise from the nearby railway woke me early next day, but no complaints on accommodation.
The hotel is poorly deigned. No idea what the architect was on but space planning was not one of their strengths. There is no direct route form the reception to the ground floor rooms, requiring the sue of stairs or lift to the first floor to cross over the admin area before going down to the ground floor again. Not good for the elderly or infirm. The alternative was a long walk going through the bar and restaurant. Signage was not good and many in our party struggled to navigate the hotel. The adult pool was not easy to find and when I did I thought it very strange. It felt like it was 3ft wide and 2 miles long! Not conducive to swimming really. There were few sun loungers there for the size of hotel, though the adjacent beach provide plenty.
Another delicious meal followed to end our tour, but this was spoilt by a protracted settling of accounts as they had managed to put the wrong bar bills on the room accounts. It was far more time consuming and complicated than necessary, taking nearly half and hour. I had to calculate what i owed them as their system did not allow. They were more interested in the system issues than ensuring the customer was satisfied and paid the correct amount. There were a number of us who had issues with the accounts. Again I had to renew my acquaintance with the manager!
The hotel should have had a higher score, but the layout and administrative issues tainted my stay.
title: Nice hotel but be patient!

placeInfo/address: St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Ask for the topfloor if you have booked seaview as the ground and first floor views are blocked by trees. Poolview rooms are ok
text:
Positives
- the Anantara Kalutara has the friendliest staff we have ever encountered. And we have been to Hyatt’s, Sofitel’s, Shangri La’s, Intercontinentals and Four Seasons. From reception to villa butler to the cooks to the pool boys and the gents who cleaned our rooms: they all do their utmost to make you happy. Special shout out to Shalindra and Lashan, the headchef of Olu, the maitre d of Olu (thanks for the seafood platter) and ‘my brother from another mother’ at the pool. 
- they recognize loyalty (we got upgraded to a seaview suite) and threw in a bottle of wine as well plus a welcome fruit bowl
- the gardens are beautiful and the gym is well equipped. 
Negatives
- the main pool is small and in high season there will not be enough sunloungers. Plus it is so shallow that the temperature equals that of the air. The view is of a river/lagoon but not the beach. 
- the rooms are a bit dated and in need of refurbishment. Our suite’s A/C did not work properly (despite engineering working on it for 6 hours) and the roll down curtains do not fully block out all the light. Cupboards and the bed make creaking noises. But because of the ac issue we did get complimentary massages and dinner at Olu. 
- the adult pool is tiny and has no view to speak off (seaview is blocked by trees) and cannot accommodate more than 20 people comfortably
- the breakfast choices are fine. Some western options (eggs, yoghurt, asian fruit) but it is mainly Asian
- dinner options are poor as Aqualina (the Italian restaurant at the adult pool) and Spice traders (the Asian restaurant) were closed most days leaving only Olu as an option. The a la carte choice at Olu is fine and they will cook pasta carbonara even if it is not on the menu (thanks guys!) but the quality could be better. And the buffet at $51 is overpriced and not international (few western options)
- the location is remote. There are no restaurants worthy of a visit near the hotel and there is a road splitting the hotel in 2 which is public. That means locals can address you whenever you walk between your room and all other facilities of the hotel. 
- the hotel allows locals, if they have made reservations for the seafood lunch (once a week), to use the pool facilities. A negative surprise.
title: Staff 10 out 10, Facilities/Location 5 out of 10

ownerResponse/text:

However, we deeply regret that certain aspects of your stay did not meet your expectations. Please accept our sincere apologies for all  inconvenience caused from pre-arrival communication, courtesy call during night, restaurant service.

placeInfo/address: St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
The good aspects of the hotel: 1) Lovely architecture 2) beautiful rooms 3) fabulous gym 4) wonderful kids club with fun activities 5) good food

Some areas for improvement: 
1) Before arriving you get several surveys asking for preferences check in times etc (you get the sent the same email several times even after filling it out which was frustrating and eventually had to send to spam). In spite of this I still got a call during my work day asking me the same information that i had just filled out in the survey including check in time. I would suggest choosing either or, if you are going to send a survey, don't also call, also sending the survey just once is sufficient. It was both overwhelming and time consuming. 
2) Was traveling with a toddler which is a challenge, one evening I had just managed to put him to bed, and then the front desk called at 8 pm with a 'courtesy call' the phone was incredibly loud and it woke up my child after I had just managed to put him to bed, starting the whole cycle of trying to get him to sleep all over again which took another 2 hours. It was a terrible night, I would suggest that staff not call the room after 6 pm, particularly if they know there is a child in the room. 
3) Accessibility, I was using a pram and there is no way to get to the restaurant or pool coming from the boardwalk without going up stairs. I am heavily pregnant so trying to get my toddler, and pram up the stairs with no help proved a challenge throughout the stay. I would suggest having a ramp to the pool area and restaurant for wheelchair users and pram users. 
4) The restaurant staff seemed really inexperienced and it was challenging with a toddler. It was off season so there were just a couple of other people staying at the hotel, in spite of this, it felt like every time we went to the restaurant it was like we were coming in for the first time. The staff seemed surprised we needed a high chair each time (and it always took ages to come) and in the end we would just grab one from the outside area where we knew they were kept which would fluster the staff, but when trying to wrangle a toddler, time is of the essence. They also always seem surprised that we wanted water and had to explain each time that we didn't want bottled water, just normal filtered water which always came really late and was surprisingly difficult to communicate. 
In the end we left early because we didn't feel relaxed.
title: Beautiful hotel but not five star

Шикарные номера, территория и отношение персонала к гостям … это пожалуй все плюсы( 
Еда перченая, выбираем с трудом что поесть без лишних приправ. Выбор скудный . Включены были завтрак и ужин. 
На пляже и у бассейнов всегда свободные лежаки и вороны!!! Орут, как оголтелые .

По приезду нам предложили бесплатно как комплимент, номер на лагуну (речка, впадающая в океан) . А там видимо мечеть по соседству и раз в час молитвы на всю округу раздаются эхом. Ранний подьём с рассветом обеспечен ( 
Мы долго выбирали отель и подкупили просторные номера и сервисность…. Но такие нюансы как недосып смазывают всё удовольствие от отдыха(

text:
Это худшая Анантара из всех, где я была. Ситуацию спасал только русскоговорящий менеджер Канишка всегда спешащий на помощь и решающий все вопросы! Открытый, приветливый с постоянной улыбкой на лице! И конечно же менеджер Lashan! Он решал все проблемы без промедления, не жалея своего времени! Он нашел для нас более удобные и спокойные номера. Собирал все службы, если случались какие заморочки. А они случались! 
Завтраки на 4. Голодным не останешься, но и выбора большого нет. Ужины хорошие в итальянском ресторане и а ля карт. 
На пляже часто были очень несвежие полотенца. У нас возникло ощущение, что их просто сушат без стирки. Нужно очень долго ждать воду, которую не всегда приносили. 
Уборка в номере ужасная! Пол не вымыли ни разу! Холодильник гремел, кондиционер шумел, в мечети молились, собаки лаяли, мотоциклисты ездили. 
Спасибо сотрудникам за то, что пытались решить все проблемы!
title: Худшая Анантара из всех!

I stayed as part of a tour  
This was the end " beach 5 star luxury hotel " for 3 nights. 
Start with positive 
Lovely welcome by dancers and drummers. 
Room fabulous  347  quiet and nice bathroom , shower and bath. 
Not so great 
Hotel is very isolated  and not great for a solo person
 It's huge and we were spread across a massive hotel with dark, badly lit and floored walk ways back to rooms.
Service was average.... staff trying to please, however often lack of understanding  and took at least 10 mins every day at breakfast to get a coffee. 
Not normally an issue but on tour , with early coach pick ups , it was fustrating.

Food was average but expensive.  
A coke was 1350  rupees     270 in supermarket  and about 800 in a better 5 star hotel in Colombo. 
You are kind of stuck in this hotel  
So we hired a driver for day and had an absolutely  fabulous  day in Colombo 🙂 
View from pool was sadly a JCB😔 
Adult only pool had kids in it, and not managed

We found the hotel to be a "ghost house". We were here in early February and there were hardly any guests except us.
We initially had a room overlooking the compost heap, but (probably because there were so few guests) got a free upgrade to a nice big suite.
The hotel is way too expensive for Sri Lanka.
Advertised as having a 360 degree beach (sea and lagoon), but the lagoon is a puddle. The beach is located between rocks and looks quite good (we did not use it because we were here only for one night).
The breakfast buffet is simple, with no particular highlights.
Dinner at the Asian restaurant fell short of expectations (e.g. a Pad Thai with soft-boiled noodles and a ready-made sauce).
title: Certainly not five stars

text:
Took a much needed vacation with the family earlier this week. The pictures on the gallery looked great, and we were supposedly getting a ‘deal’ on a credit card offer. I was a bit apprehensive as it was only on BB terms with no options to upgrade to even HB. Nevertheless, we booked for 2 nights.

We were warmly welcomed, and the property is truly beautiful, with the pool overlooking the lagoon. As were the rooms, which were extremely comfortable. However, I nearly fell off my chair looking at the in-room dining menu. The prices were simply ridiculous. One example being; rice and curry (the meal that cuts across all economic classes in this country) was priced at SLR 4K, and even more depending on what meat you chose. We then inquired as to how much the dinner buffet was - it worked out to SLR8K+ PER HEAD. And let me tell you it was no gala spread!

It seems as if the Anantara group is intent on single handedly saving the Sri Lankan economy. In this case, much to my detriment, with having a family of 5 to see to.

It’s a great place, with quite a few activities on offer (archery, boat rides, abseiling to name a few). However, this hotel (and group) is for a certain group of Foreign tourists, earning good dollars. If you are living and working here, best look elsewhere.
title: A luxurious rip-off

text: Stayed there 3 weeks mid September/early October 2014 after 3 previous visits 2006,2010,2014.This has been a much appreciated venue over the past 10 years - original and secure, but one wonders whether it is now reaching its 'sell-by' date, and whether the owner may be reaching the same conclusion - for whatever reason. Off season, but several other previous customers were staying during this period. Traditionally the hotel has been more or less inoperative during the summer monsoon months, allowing time for management vacations and any necessary repairs and renovations. So it was surprising to find various noisy and disruptive building works in the garden and front entrance area continuing into October.Two guests had to move rooms because of defective A/C units which are part of the original installations and should already have been replaced. The hot water failed 4 times in 2 weeks, twice because of failed solar heating panels. Active CCTV cameras were being installed as a consequence of recent property losses, but guests would be well advised to make full use of their room safes even for minor items; I wasn't impressed to find that one of the room boys had borrowed my tablet charger to recharge his mobile without my permission. It is always reassuring to find familiar faces when revisiting a hotel, and there had been no significant staff changes since my last visit, but one sensed that services are now on autopilot. One staff member is an obvious passenger who should be replaced, and this may be having a knock-on effect on other attitudes. It would have been helpful to discuss this with the owner, but surprisingly he had chosen to absent himself abroad for two weeks at the beginning of the season so there was no opportunity. Potential clients for whom his presence is a significant factor might make appropriate enquiries if they are planning any visits between mid October and mid December. One other issue needs to be addressed urgently, namely the malign practice of the owners of the adjacent property of burning rubber and other detritus right against the party wall behind the pool. There were several mornings when this threatened to make the pool and breakfast area  unusable. These comments may seem heavy, but this hotel charges premium rates, and guests are entitled to a premium experience for their money. Price is what you pay, but value depends on what you actually get. It might be useful if they entered the 21st century and provided departing guests with a customer satisfaction survey so that minor matters could be dealt with before they become major. Incidentally, the hotel's traditional clientele should not be discountenanced by the appearance of short stay mixed gender couples - this is entirely consonant with modern inclusivity culture.
title: Dickman Resort Negombo

ownerResponse/text:
It is not so chic to make comments on hotels where you not stay Mr. Stephen. We love our security men he is very popular among Dickmans guests they feel save there he take care for the closed door policy of the house and no strangers without invitation knocking on guest doors. We like to thank you about the positive part of your comment on Tripadvisor even never stay with us and it's very rare  that people walk in and out to check rooms asking for discount and later write comment like yours. Small secret: there are no cameras in the hotel only the sign of CCTV and that helps already a lot we feel. Thanks for that too Mr. Stephen . Wish you great time in the price range you looking for.

text: I was staying locally close to Dickman Resort & decided to call in to checkout of the room rates, I'm shown a room & given a rate for 6 nights, also given a discount of 10- euro per night for being a member of Utopia, however I didn't feel comfortable staying in a resort with so much security with CCTV & 24/7 security guy on the front gate with very a very high wall around the resort, I felt like every move I made was being watched by many !!!! Therefore decided not to stay & felt it was expensive, considering the place I was staying in close by was half the price & had more freedom to come & go. The room i'm shown looked very nice & the staff member on the front desk was very polite.

text: stayed at several negombo hotels. dickman always seems to be rated high and its promotion is outstanding so finally visited. but for such a comparative expensive room rate i thought it to be somewhat of a letdown in ambience. the rooms were large with double beds and sizeable bathrooms. Staff is great but in sri lanka staff is great many places. if you just want to be in an exclusive gay hotel with aging guests and some good looking staff (playful but mostly straight) and away from the beach and nice ocean beaches, then i guess it's okay, if the price is no concern to you.
title: letdown

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for your stay with us and for taking the time to review Dickman Resort.  We are always grateful for feedback and we appreciate all your good compliments you give to us in the beginning of your mail and happy to inform you that we have made some changes based upon your comments. 

All mattresses in the Luxury Rooms and Suites have been renewed with Higher and Quality Softer Mattresses and the middle of this King Size Bed is hurt proof. We have also replaced all pillows with new ones made by the Number One Pillow maker Celcius.  Every bed is fitted out with Two High Soft Pillows and Two Low Stronger Pillow for the guest own choice. We hope you will check them one day in the near future.

About the sound of doors slamming, we found two doors needed to be soundproofed and this has been done.  We also ask staff to inform the new guests  with "check in and check outs" to take care for the guests in the house. Our staff is special trained not to speak in front of the Guest Rooms before 12 Noon to not disturbing the naturel mornings.  

After 5 o'clock PM the boys enjoy playing snooker or swimming for a few hours and most guests enjoy this friendly ambiance with them. About the music in the rooms, the English Speaking Room Boy who show the Room to arriving guest will never forget to show the button to turn the music on or of.  Thanks for that comment too.

About the Air Con on in the empty rooms.  Dickman Resort was awarded with the Green Boutique Villa award from Sri Lanka Tourist Board for our  "Eco friendly Pool" our 100% Solar Hot Water use and our Door Card Energy Saving System and we where very proud on this Originall Boutique Award.

This Door Card System is same as most Luxury Hotels where you leave the room and take the card out of the Energy holder and  automatically all electricity is switched off easy and safe. Officially it take 3 minutes to cool the rooms when the card is entered and it saves energy by nearly 40 % and it is one of our House rules to tell the guest at arrival.
Sri Lanka has a Power Problem and we help by reducing electricity usage. Our cleaning boys are responsible for keep the rooms "very clean"  and the  "empty energy rooms policy"  they do both with love for guest and for their country.  

Finally I want to thank you for your latest comments that you believe that our property with this upgrades could be rated much higher. We happy to see you one day in the near future to Sri lanka again  to double check  your self and your very welcome at Dickman Resort too. 

Finest Regards D D and The Crew
placeInfo/address: 26/7 Poruthata Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Choose the room outside the main house for a quiet stay
text:
Airport pickup perfect with a 15 minute ride to the hotel.   Check in a breeze with a friendly attentive staff.  The grounds and pool are lovely and the large staff keeps the public areas impeccable.  The owner and staff far exceed most properties in their dedication to making guest welcome.
Wi-Fi is free if you settle your bill in cash otherwise there is a small fee.
Breakfast is served until noon which was wonderful for those coming in from different time zones. The chef was attentive and served a giant fruit plate referred to as fruit bread and egg’s to order.   Breakfast is included in the room rate along with juice, coffee or tea. The only downside is the constant barrage of flies, no seeum’s and mosquitos.  They do use inventive methods to reduce the problem and in fairness the problem is not restricted to Dickman’s but because of the table location and tree’s it was worse than at beach properties.
Lunch is available and how nice it is that they will accommodate guest until 6pm they serve a great choice of sandwiches, salad’s etc. at a very reasonable price. 
Room overview: They provided a beautiful floral and Mango fruit plate.
The bath products were Ayurveda Spa which were lovely.  The room has a min bar with enough room for personal items.
Concrete floors: This was only the second time in my life I have had concrete floors and the only real downside is concrete combined with 14 foot ceilings means sounds echo and exacerbates the noise issues I will address later.
If you enjoy a hard mattresses and don’t cuddle then you’ll enjoy the twin mattresses on a king platform.  To make it just a bit more challenging the sheets were twin.  So it is not only uncomfortable with the hard edges and split in the mattress but then you have a gap between the sheets.  At the very least they should use King Sheets. Pillows are a bit softer than sandbags .The linens are rough to the skin, same with the towels.   When I first used the towels they were stiff and rough.   Really they are not up to hotel standards.
The veranda doors have 1/4'” spacing between panels so there were a few mosquitos in the room.  Bring your replant and put up the netting they provide.     
One issue that was horrible, the room doors and the noise they make.  Every time a guest comes and goes you hear the slamming of doors. Some guests were just inconsiderate.  I would recommend the hotel weather strip the door jams to mitigate the noise.  Maybe also a kind word at check in about closing doors as you would like others to do for you if you were sleeping.  From that standpoint it seemed like we were staying in upscale youth hostel.  This is like a big house where you hear the music from other rooms where doors might be open or rooms being cleaned with the ever present music at different levels.  Yes there are number speakers in the rooms which I didn’t notice when I checked in the first night. My first morning when the house music was turned on the speakers blasted me awake.  That combined with no knowledge of how to turn the music off ruined the first morning.  I jumped up and scoured the room for the source and remote or switch and finally found a dial on the wall to turn it off.  The volume was so high that I suspect the room attendant had cranked it up while cleaning and never turned it down.  Another noise issue is the pool table in the lobby.  A poor concept with the high ceilings and cement floors.  You can hear every crack of the balls.  If you happen to be napping when someone decides to play your nap is over.
A/C and high vaulted ceiling are a great combination as long as you can run the a/c continuously. Unfortunately the hotel requested guest to turn off the a/c when you leave the room. Problem with that is when you return and are sweating from the heat you have to wait for the room to cool down.  If you leave the a/c on the staff enters your room and turns it off.  This is unacceptable and I would rather pay a higher room rate and enjoy a welcome respite from the heat when I enter my room.  The hotel is approx.  Two blocks from the beach and minimal local nightlife.
This is a property that with a few upgrades could be rated much higher.  At this point I could not recommend it until the bedding and linens are upgraded.
title: Needs some basic improvements

ownerResponse/text: We charged you the correct amount that was invoiced, from Agoda, we don`t rip people off or over charge as your saying, your issue was with the agent not us, so feel this is a very nasty review, when you enjoyed your stay
placeInfo/address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
Unfortunately we were overcharged by this hotel on the last day of our visit despite showing the owner our booking confirmation via Agoda. It took over a month and numerous emails and phonecalls to get a refund from Agoda once we returned from our holiday. Very unprofessional service from Agoda and the owner of this hotel...so poor I reported Agoda to the regulator for ripping off customers. 

Other than that this is a lovely hotel perched on Birdlake, great food and a 40 minute walk to Hikkaduwa beach.
title: Lovely hotel but overcharged on last day! :/

ownerResponse/text: Hi many thanks for your review, we are glad you enjoyed the food and service, we do however apologise for the cock roach and ants, we are in the tropics and all hotels have septic tanks as there are no sewers in Sri Lanka, we have a pest control that treats the hotel grounds for vermin, but sometimes it is unavoidable, in this country as much as you try, but once you let us know we dealt with the problem. Again we are sorry for the problem best regards the Asian Jewel team

text:

title: So Nice people and food

ownerResponse/text:
Hi thanks for your review, we are sorry you did`nt like the hotel room, I know you stated to me many times that you usually stay in the Marriot hotels, we have the most expensive mattress available, i know you said you have a memory soft mattress but its difficult to please all people`s different preferences, but as soon as you let us know we gave you a softer mattress that you were happy with on the 2nd night. The other problem you had for 1 day was a water blockage in a pipe, the water is fed by natural wells with a pressure pump so you get the pressure in your shower once we cleared that it was not a problem it was not  a constant problem and Im sure these problems happen in all establishments world wide.
The venue across the lake did have weddings as it was wedding season but I think it is an exaggeration that you said from morning to night, they were finished by 4pm. I understand this can be a pain Has it is for me as an owner, but beyond my control and this happens on the beach till 6am but i can understand your complaint.
We are happy you liked the staff and was happy with the food and setting, and we are sorry the lagoon views were not available, i hope this didnt spoil your stay in Sri Lanka
