placeInfo/address: 89 Upper Lake Road Havelock Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at the Galway Heights Hotel between the 13th and 15th January for 2 nights. Check in was very good and our room was very nice. 

All the staff were very helpful and pleasant. 

Breakfast was a buffet style and was good with a nice range of options all well prepared and presented. The eving meal was also a buffet on the first evening and a set menu on the second. Unfortunately there was no vegetarian option on the set menu but after speaking with the staff we were told that the chef would prepare us something. That evening we went on dinner and had a lovely spring roll start followed by some soup. The main course of a Sri Lankan curry arrived and as I started to eat this I felt very unwell very rapidly. After a visit to the bathroom I had to retired to my room.feeling sick all evening until the next morning. I had not been unwell on this trip until.this time and had not eaten anywhere but the hotel. It is worth noting that my wife was not unwell at the time but had a bad stomach the following day.

To be fair the staff were genuinely concerned but the experience was unfortunate and clouded our experience of this hotel.
title: Galway Heights Hotel

placeInfo/address: 89 Upper Lake Road Havelock Drive, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
The property is old. There’s no lift, so we had to climb the stairs.  The location is inconvenient, situated in the middle of nowhere on a one-direction road. Even our driver hesitated to drop us off at the front porch because parking was such a challenge.

The lack of air conditioning meant we had to keep the windows open, leading to numerous mosquito bites. Breakfast service was slow and disorganized. When we requested a mug, the server said they would check but never returned, leaving us without an answer or alternative. Overall, the experience could have been better.
title: No elevator , No aircon.

roomTip: No lifts
text:
The location was good but staying just the one night didn't get to explore the hotel itself as we had a very early start next morning as well

Staff very friendly and room spacious and in good order. 

Strangest thing though given the hotel is less than 20 years old - no lifts in the hotel so stairs only - fortunately we were on the first floor and the porter had to manhandle the suitcases for us!

Couple of issues that are easily fixed but if that is the case shouldn't have occured in the first place : 

Evening meal was a buffet - staff insist on dishing out the food meaning you have to keep asking them to add more or accept the small portions they put on your plate - probably just as well as the food was cold! - staff had to microwave ours to heat it up after we raised this with them.

Second issue was the live entertianment - vocally for non-local songs they were awfully lame and vague, the volume they played at in the bar was far too loud and indeed we could clearly hear it in our room after we retired  to bed.

If they ditch the live act and instead had some nice background jazz or lounge music as well as igniting the heaters under the food would easily sort this lot out!
title: Good hotel but need to work on a num,ber of issues spoiling what could be a great hotel

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at Belmont Boutique Hotel. Your feedback is invaluable in our constant endeavor to provide an exceptional stay for all our guests.

We are thrilled to hear that our concept of being a technical stopover for Westerners near the airport resonated well with you. Our strategic location and complimentary shuttle service are indeed designed to cater to travelers seeking convenience and efficiency in their transit. It is gratifying to know that our efforts in ensuring clean and well-equipped rooms have been appreciated. We understand how crucial these aspects are for a comfortable stay, especially when one is in transit and time is of the essence.

Regarding your observation about the noise levels, we truly empathize with your experience. Providing a peaceful and relaxing environment is a priority for us, and it seems we fell short of this goal during your stay. We are constantly working on ways to minimize external noise and improve sound insulation in our rooms. Rest assured, your feedback will be discussed with our team to explore further improvements in this area.

Your comment about the shuttle service is particularly concerning. While we strive to provide efficient transportation to the airport, it is paramount that this is done safely and comfortably. Your feedback about the driving style of our shuttle driver is being taken very seriously. We will address this with our transportation team to ensure that our drivers adhere to the highest standards of safety and sensitivity towards our guests' comfort.

We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience caused and would like to assure you that your concerns are being addressed with the utmost seriousness. We are committed to not only meeting but exceeding the expectations of our guests.

It is feedback like yours that enables us to fine-tune our services. We hope that despite these issues, you will consider Belmont Boutique Hotel for your future travels, giving us the opportunity to provide you with a better experience.

Thank you once again for your valuable feedback.

Warm regards,

Belmont Boutique Hotel
placeInfo/address: 82/5, Cemetery Road Ettukala, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
The hotel's owner has implemented a very effective concept to make this place a technical stopover for Westerners close to the airport.
The rooms are very clean and nicely equipped, and the free shuttle service is very efficient, making it possible to catch a plane in less than 30 minutes.
On the other hand, the place is noisy and the night is trying. The shuttle driver could drive more carefully and sensitively.
title: Useful concept for the airport

text:

Schande für das Land des Tees. Zimmer waren schön nd ansprechend.
Der riesige Pool ist wunderbar, leider voll wechselweise von lärmenden Spaniern oder kreischenden holländischen Kindern. Wenig Ruhe, mit Handtüchern belegte und unbenutzte Liegen … Hotelalltag eben.

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa 21120 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Eat somewhere else
text:
You couldn’t ask for a better setting, beautiful views right on the edge of the national park. Absolutely stunning. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, nothing was too much for them.

As for the hotel itself a bit of maintenance is required. Our air conditioning had one speed, flat out and the remote control was obviously not matched to the unit, or the unit was faulty. Hot water came and went and I have now decided to deduct 1* for every hotel I visit that doesn’t have thermostatic shower valves. There is no excuse for having a shower that is too cold one minute and too hot the next. I have given 3* but it would have been 2 had the guy who cleaned our room not entertained us so much with the towel origami every day. Great customer service.

The food!  So disappointing.  Main dishes were often cold even though kept on warmers but nothing was what you could have called tasty and well cooked. Very mediocre at best. Even the Sri Lankan dishes were not particularly tasty.  Certainly, our experience in Colombo was much better. Be warned drinks are very very expensive compared to other places we stayed at.
title: Staff were brilliant. Hotel and food definitely below par..

placeInfo/address: Avudangawa 21120 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The main restaurant gets really busy and the kitchen can’t cope with the volume. Service mixed.
text:
This is a beautiful hotel but it’s really let down by its main restaurant both in service and quality of the food.
We are surprised Kuoni use this hotel for its guest’s especially having visited the Cinnamon Hotel and the food and service we had there was second to none.
We have found the service at the restaurant here quite poor especially at breakfast, for two consecutive mornings we had to ask for tea and on the second morning 5 times.  No toast the second morning as the toaster was broken.  We mentioned this to our rep and the hotel did apologise and offered us a complimentary meal.
Last night the restaurant was extremely busy with large tables and it was evident the kitchen and staff could not cope with the high volume.  The choices of food run out and there wasn’t any more of certain items especially in the dessert section.
I guess Kuoni use this hotel because of the stunning views and lovely pool, it is very tranquil.
However at 6.45am today we were woken by a constant knocking on metal I opened the door to find a young man brushing steps which was knocking on metal railings. He did stop when asked and apologised.
The hotel is a good base for the local sites and trips and the pool is lovely with stunning views but the ‘whole package’ lets this lovely hotel down.
Sadly we would choose another hotel if we came back to Sri Lanka.
title: Is stunning views enough?

A very beautiful place to stay and well positioned for sightseeing .
However 
Restaurant-menu not varied enough and food often not well cooked

Suggesting that we gave him a tip and also gave him another tip for the rest of the staff which he would distribute-completly unacceptable and of course we didn't. Even though we are old we are aware and astute -knowing more about "the world than our young butler. He should know that people like us aren't gullible

placeInfo/name: Jetwing Vil Uyana, A Luxury Reserve
roomTip: Call ahead to get any special requests handled. Email will not cut it. Avoid going here as a large group.
text:
I picked Jetwing Vil Uyana for a family trip based on a recommendation. The last time I was in the area we stayed at Uga Ullagala and given the similar pricing I had similar expectations. 

Check-in: experience was terrible. We arrived in a bus and sat in the parking lot while the staff figured out what to do with us and our luggage. It took a long time for us to get settled. When I booked I had notified Jetwing staff via email that I made two bookings but they even up to the day prior to arrival there was confusion. I was as disappointed that we were placed in rooms so far away from each other. When we arrived at our room they were still doing some construction work and we sat around waiting for the workers to leave so we could have some privacy. 

Food: breakfast and dinner service was slow. For our party size we had to commit 2 hours to a meal. There was also a bunch of confusion as the wait staff needed help knowing which seat to serve the food / drink orders. Quality of food was mixed. Some items were very good while others were poorly cooked and/or poorly plated. Again for the price paid, it did not meet expectations. Our guide also mentioned the food in their quarters was not good and that the hotel was experiencing chef issues. At this price point it should never happen. 

Drinks: the quality of drinks at the bar were poor. I have traveled extensively in Sri Lanka. We ordered every signature cocktail. Except for the 114 (which was phenomenal) everything else was terrible. So we had to resort to beer orders. 

Rooms: The rooms are very large, we stayed in one with a pool and had a great time overall despite the challenges. We enjoyed the morning view and hosting our family for pool parties. It was great. That said there were many rough edges - shoddy construction, termite droppings, unstable floors and railings;  all expected for a dwelling in the forest, but at this price point if Uga can figure it out, not sure why Jetwing cannot. 

Common areas: setting, lobby and main areas were just gorgeous. Spent hours watching the sun go up and down, the lake flora and fauna as well as the daily crocodile sighting. This is truly a special place to disconnect  

Staff: these hardworking folks are the saving grace of the hotel. If not for them it would be a 1 star rating. Saman is a standout. I had a last minute request to make an anniversary special, not only did he create a bouquet himself, but he also made the turndown service special and tried his very best to get a cake ordered from the kitchen. Nandhana was also very helpful as he tried to speed up food service and manage our experience given the limitations he had to work with. 

Unfortunately we will not be staying at this hotel or any other Jetwing property again.
title: Disappointed by Jetwing’s best hotel in SL

placeInfo/address: Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Vil Uyana, A Luxury Reserve
roomTip: Avoid Room 135
text: We were booked into this hotel by a tour company. We stayed 2 nights in Forest Dwelling Room 133 and several days later returned for another two nights in Forest Dwelling Room 135. The rooms were identical except the second room was missing the flashlight, the mosquito net around the bed, and the safe never worked despite alerting our "butler" to that fact. The pool had leaves in it when we arrived and more when we left two days later. Our first night in the second stay in Room 135 upon returning from dinner we found two piles of excrement on the floor of the downstairs bathroom space. We called housekeeping who came to clean the floor. He said bats came in because we had turned off the lights, however, when you go to dinner you take the keys with you which causes the lights to go off. We never had this unfortunate experience in Room 133. It felt like the staff had simply forgotten about Room 135 and us. The hotel restaurant has many choices for breakfast, lunch, and dinner and the restaurant staff were always helpful and pleasant. The hotel's site and landscaping is lovely.
title: Two different rooms and two different experiences

text:
Overall its a wonderful stay. Stayed only for one night at Paddy Dwelling and kids loved the set up and pools. Ideal get away for a relaxing and luxury time. Property was kept nice and clean with a nice isolated feeling from the rest of the world. Food was served as a set menu with a decent choice with generous portions. Excellent SPA with very reasonable pricing.

On a negative note: Room 155 had a issue with rats running which felt under the bed and in AC ducts. This was very disturbing and when complained in the morning to the staff and GM it was played down with no action at all. The noisy pests can ruin your stay. This was experienced only in one room out of the 7 we occupied.

placeInfo/address: Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Vil Uyana, A Luxury Reserve
text:
The luxurious 'forest dwelling' and the sounds of nature lulled us into an absolute state of  relaxation. Udaya who coordinated our reservation and Nishanka our butler provided us with excellent service. A near perfect mix of attentiveness and privacy was provided.

It was a long awaited visit to Vil Uyana and overall a good weekend was had by all. I was, however, terribly dissapointed with the food. I expected better than undercooked 'milk rice', pastry baskets consisting of tea buns and inconsistency between the menu & actual plate of food served (eg instead of cousous & slow cooked pork we were served rice & a pork chop of sorts that was not exactly slow cooked with of course no reason provided as to why we were not served what we requested). A little attention to detail would have been appreciated in this regard.

Considering the focus on animals and the wild life in the vicinity, I would also kindly request that you pay a little more kind attention to "mans' best friend"...the dogs on the property & those having access to the property. They seemed to be lacking TLC, food and the puppies were extremely timid. I wonder if the collaboration with Embark is still active and ongoing.   
Thank you!
title: Relaxed in tranquil surroundings

ownerResponse/text:

General Manager
placeInfo/address: Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Vil Uyana, A Luxury Reserve
text:
Me and husband stayed for one night at a forest dwelling room, which was the most expensive available. Therefore we did expect  more personalised welcome and a experience. Which was not provided. We have stayed at similar star hotels at similar price ranges in Sri Lanka where this was provided. There was no enthusiasm at the reception. The  person who spoke to us with most enthusiasm was our buggy driver Nilantha,  he seems to be very dedicated and has to be commended. 

Hotel is located at a very unique environment and the architecture is breathtaking. We were very happy with the ambiance. 

We stayed in the room 134 and when we walked in to the room there was a Grass snake near the pond. Even though this is a nonpoisonous species, it did give us a scare!. 

Then only I noticed how the living room and the bed room was not swept completely and some sand and dust was still visible. It was difficult not to notice how the pond inside the living room needs cleaning. 
Our balcony light was not functioning, which we found out after dinner when we wanted to spend some time on the balcony. We did inform this to the receptionist and was attended to by the maintenance however they could not fix it and said they will look into it in the morning, however, this never happened!. 

Food was average or bellow average. My husband especially found the quantity and the variety very little. Most of the guests were Sri Lankan and we were provided with simple rice and curry as the Sri Lankan section and simple milk rice and pol roti ... we felt that if they had provided least some of hoppers or kottu for dinner.

I was especially disappointed with the dinner, we were provided with stale cold bread, I am sure the bread was brought before the covid time..... it was that old..  Could have least warmed up the bread, as expected from a five star hotel!......  also the ambiance was ruined by the singing heard from the kitchen staff!. Not professional at all.

We wanted to relax after the stressful covid times since both of us are frontline doctors. We did enjoy, however we did expect a better service.
title: Good with room for improvement

Outside patio table but no chairs to sit on

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for sharing your experience following your stay with us.

You will be pleased to know that the hotel is built on a man-made wetland reserve, which was inspired by the London Wetland Centre. 12 years since inception, we are thrilled to see that the environment has worked well for bird life and elusive creatures such as the Grey slender loris, fishing cat and otters, who have trusted us with their presence. Our property has now become a prime location for nature lovers. We also have a loris conservation site to protect this elusive, endangered species. 

We hope you will visit us again and take up a night trail with our environmentalist for a glimpse of this wildlife at work. Look forward to welcoming you again. 

Ayubowan (May you live long)

Kingsley Paul 
General Manager

text: This hotel definitely has the “wow factor”. Traditional thatched wooden houses, surrounded by water, fabulous views (huge tree with thousands of nesting giant bats in our case), peacocks strutting their stuff, crocodiles in the lake, rooms well appointed - what’s not to like? In one word: the food. Really disappointing, tough meat, spicy when billed as mild. Just not what most discerning travellers expect at this price level.  Some of the waiters seemed pretty clueless, too. I was told I couldn’t get a whisky sour because it wasn’t on the (very long) cocktail menu.  After protesting and explaining how to make one, I did eventually get my drink, but this was further evidence that the standard of food and service lags far behind other hotels at this price.

text: The rooms over the water are amazing, and vast. The staff need some training - we had empty glasses for a while in the bar area until a staff member, who wasn't doing anything else, noticed. ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to post a constructive review on TripAdvisor following your stay with us. 

While appreciating your compliments we are of course most concerned to hear of your dissatisfaction. You were upgraded to the highest dwelling category in our property which includes a private lap pool, an extensive bathroom with an indoor garden and pond as well as an outdoor sitting area. We are quite surprised to hear your description of this dwelling which otherwise is highly regarded by our other guests. 

However we have noted your comments on poor lighting and insufficient storage facilities in the room and would like to extend our sincere apologies for these inconveniences.  

Also the hotel is not built on a swamp. It is built on a man-made wetland inspired by the London Wetland Center and is our own proud contribution to mother nature.

Considering the above information, we do hope you will visit us again and we look forward to welcome you again.

Ayubowan (May you live long)

Kingsley Paul 
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Vil Uyana, A Luxury Reserve
text: So many good things about this hotel but a number of drawbacks that seriously interfere with one’s comfort. I should say that one of us didn’t mind at all but one of us found it uncomfortable. We had booked a water bungalow but were “upgraded“ to a forest dwelling, which as it indicates is in the heart of the forest with no view. It has a small plunge pool that is in shade most of the day. The dwelling is huge but the downstairs is entirely occupied by a vast gloomy concrete bathroom, including a loo with no door, exceedingly poor lighting, and unusable bath. There was insufficient light to shave or make up by. There is one living room upstairs with nowhere to sit except a wooden bench or outside. There was absolutely nowhere to store clothes so we were obliged to live out of cases for two days amongst piles of stuff. On the plus side, we found the staff helpful and charming and the evening menu was interesting fusion cooking, we both enjoyed our meals. Our advice would be to check very carefully what facilities you are being offered before deciding on the type of villa. And by the way, the hotel is constructed in a swamp and you will need high percentage deet spray.
title: Very ambivalent about this hotel

placeInfo/name: Jetwing Vil Uyana, A Luxury Reserve
text:
We spent 4 nights here in March and whilst we enjoyed our time in the region we were happy to leave. The hotel is in a lovely location and ideal for watching the local wildlife.

The room, a forest dwelling, was definitely a case of form over function. This is a two storey accommodation. The ground floor has a huge bathroom area which is open to the elements - and insects! I do not appreciate sharing my bathroom with bats and mosquitoes. The toilet here does not have a door and again this is something I can do without. The bedroom upstairs was huge and had a large bed with mosquito net and another toilet and washbasin. This was over-run with ants. The management were quick to come and spray when we reported it, but the ants just returned and used another route. 

The food and service was variable  but not the price!
title: Form over function

placeInfo/address: Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
roomTip: great hotel, but let down by the restaurant staff
text: We came here to have some food because it was nearby.  Its a hotel restaurant, so we were expecting some standards after hearing that the hotel is one of the best inn the area.  We were offered a set menu for dinner at USD$40 per person.  We asked for an All-Day menu because we were not that hungry and didn’t want a 3-course meal.  The waiter said there is no other menu.  So we had to choose from the set menu (3-course meal). We chose Thai fish cakes, Thai red curry and choc brownie.  The starter was tiny portion and we thought..that’s not a good start.  The Thai red curry was mediocre- rubbery chicken and dessert was nothing to shout about.  About half way through our meal, another couple sat next to us and they were given the same set menu.  They had to ask 3 times for the All-day menu.  We were quite shocked when they’ve got the All-day menu, which was more selection of food and obviously a lot cheaper.  It’s not about the price that we were worried about, it’s the fact that we were lied to about the menu.  We didn’t say  anything to the staff because we didn’t want to cause any hassle.  We just want to finish our dinner and leave.  Never again.  The food was overly priced (we had better quality, Michelin standard food for cheaper and tastier), we were lied to and we never going to come again.  We were thinking of staying at other KK sister hotels but after that experience, not anymore. I’m sure KK Beach can do a lot better than this.
title: Hotel restaurant

ownerResponse/text:
Dear KentAngelfish

Thank you for your review and naturally I am very sorry that you were disappointed with the food you were served.

I have already had a meeting this morning with our Executive Chef about this, and he is going to talk to the staff in the kitchen at KK Beach, and also speak to the supplier of the beef, to try and ascertain why the meat was tough - and why the dessert was so sweet.

Clearly this is very disappointing and I can only apologize to you all for what was clearly a poor meal. Perhaps you were too kind in your "gentle" comments about the toughness of the beef to the staff hence they failed to take it as a complaint and offer you a discount etc . I will have a meeting with them myself and explain how they should deal with such situations.

Since you clearly know KK, I would ask that you write to me direct - george@kkcollection.com - and I will be more than happy to offer you a complimentary dinner when you are next in Sri Lanka - by way of apology.

Thank you again for your feedback and I look forward to having the opportunity to rectify a wrong.

With best wishes for the New Year,

Geore Cooper
placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
text:
We had looked forward to eating at the KK beach restaurant, given fabulous experiences over the years at its sister, the KK Hotel.

The beach side setting is superb, impressive views, a lovely setting and wonderful to watch the sun go down with a  drink.

Welcoming and friendly staff. 

We had the three course set menu (circa £21)  which was billed on the website as  “Thai fusion”.  

The starters were good: superb soup, tuna and avocado tasty and pineapple and onion appetising.

The filet of beef was ordered by three of our party and all found it tough and disappointing. The veg was predominantly flavoured with cumin, Thai flavours not coming through.  The Mahi Mahi was nicely cooked with turmeric and was on a bed of beetroot relish, this too powerfully flavoured by cumin in my opinion. 

Gentle feedback about the beef was given. No offer of a discount to the bill applied.

The dessert  of lime and passion fruit tart was expected to be refreshingly tart but it was too sweet,  compounded further by its strawberry drizzle.

KK, you can do better than this, we know.......
title: Lovely location, disappointing food.

placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
text:
Did a lot of reading before our trip and KK was one of the names that kept popping up. Seemed like a comfy place to set base in for the remaining half of our stay in Sri Lanka. We'd settled on it as we wanted to be somewhere quiet and not too far from the beach or places of interest. KK didn't fail us on these factors. It's situated next to a busy road, but only occasionally can you hear the traffic beyond the wall or the train coming from/going to Habaraduwa station which is about 10 mins walk. 

The only constant you'll hear are the waves. But during our stay, we did hear thumping of music on some evenings from downstairs (we were on the 2nd level). Because the hotel's small with only a few units, conversations along the corridor can also get amplified if one's not mindful of their volume. We heard on two occasions other guests talking along the corridor. Made us a bit more conscious of ourselves as well when were in the corridor.

Pros:
● Transport isn't a problem here as most drivers know KK. The boys at front desk can help you get a tuk tuk or you can go out as there're always one or two waiting across the road. Just let the hotel's guard know and he'll flag one for you. 

For our stay, we were lucky to flag an honest driver called Lalith. He didn't try to hard sell tourist traps to us. He'd suggest them to us just once and knew how to respect our wishes when declined, never pushing it to us again. (Unlike some drivers we'd come across). Because of this, we used his services for the rest of our days at KK. 

● Hotel location. It's not too far from places of interest such as Galle Fort (20 mins in good traffic) and Koggala lake. Weligama is also a few mins away. Unawatuna's tourist beach area's a short drive. 

● Amenities such as supermarket (Cargills) and Habaraduwa village centre with some shops are within walking distance. (About 10 mins.) There's also a provision shop across the road from the hotel, few doors down on your right from the furniture shop. Good for when it's dark and you can't walk to Cargills. (Not recommended to walk to Cargills at dusk as the streetlights aren't that bright and the bus and lorry drivers here are reckless. We tried and it was terrifying.) This shop isn't fully stocked though and has only items such as drinks, instant noodles, biscuits and traveler basics such as shampoo and detergent sachets. The shop's kind of like a village store. It's a bit run down so some might find it a turn off. It's also easy to miss if you're not looking out for it.
 
Sadly, despite these factors, there isn't much else to rave about KK. There were a few lapses and the service quality we received wasn't on par with the price we paid for our stay. I know tourism is something relatively new to the country and thus levels of service generally isn't something to shout about at most places. But coming from a place that's highly regarded locally as KK, standards should be better. 

Cons: 
● Front desk staff are mostly in their office. Everytime we needed something, I'd to knock on their door which was a bit awkward. Felt as if I was bothering them each time they'd to come out. Don't quite know what the reception table outside's for if it's never manned. Should consider having a bell on the table so that we can ring for them or at least have a staff on rotation at the desk. At one of the hotels we stayed in during our trip, they didn't have a reception desk but the front office managers were always visible and approachable to guests. KK should look into this.

Their night shift front desk staff (small sized fella), always looked dazed. (Maybe because it was at the end of his shift both times I encountered him.) He didn't seem to understand English very well. On two occasions another staff had to translate what I was saying to him. For a front desk staff, he should have some minimum if not basic grasp of the language like his other colleagues.

● Staff seems dispirited. Except for the gardeners and guards, almost everybody seemed to just be going through the motions of their jobs. There was no sense of eartnestness and warmth in their service. I felt this with the front desk staff who brought us to our room on check in day as well. Not too sure if he just wanted to be done quickly so as to give us space and privacy. If so, it wasn't being conveyed well.

This was felt even more with the restaurant staff. Smiles were hard to come by when it came to them. You do get it, but it isn't a regular thing. Maybe because it's early morning or low season so they feel less motivated. But their faces are the first ones we see at the start of our day over breakfast, it does make a difference to guests. When I was in the service industry, we were always told that the moment we put on our uniforms, regardless of the bad day/problems we've, we need to put them aside and be 'actors' for our customers to make their experience/interaction with us a pleasant one. 

The only two smiling faces we encountered was a wait staff whose name we didn't get (unfortunately as they didn't seem to wear name tags). But he's easy to spot as he has really thick, curly hair. (Most of the boys we saw had short, crew cuts.) The other was Dinesh, a front desk staff with the day shift. He always seems to know if we're at the lobby and would come out to make conversation. Not just about our stay but sharing his experiences as a local and a resident of the town we were in as well. That was nice of him and a good insight into life there. 

● Food was a let down. I ordered a Sri Lankan breakfast and the yolk in my hopper wasn't runny, but fully cooked. Not too sure if this is how it's also done as the ones I've tried elsewhere always had runny yolks. I'd the same with my eggs benedict another morning. Other than the menu items, the hotel also offered a small breakfast spread which was made up of muffins, local fruits, muesli, milk and another thing or two I can't remember. But the spread was quite uninspiring and minimal in variety. If breakfast was any indication of the quality of food the restaurant served, we were quite disappointed and turned off by it overall. We didn't know of anywhere else to go for breakfast, so that couldn't be helped, but we ate our lunches and dinners out most days during sightseeing as we didn't want to relive the disappointment at the hotel.

● Service is really bad at the restaurant. They usually seemed reluctant or often had this terrified look on their face when they'd to interact with us. At times, they don't seem to know how to handle guests. One morning, the pad on my chair was soaked. I brought it to attention to one of the wait staff. He didn't seem to know what to do. I then took a replacement from another chair. Even as I gave him my damp chair pad, he was expecting me to place it on the other chair. I told him again that it was damp. I couldn't possibly put it there for someone else to sit on. Only then did it register on him that he should take and put it out to dry. Made me wonder as to how they could've not noticed the wet chair pad. Doesn't the restaurant do checks before starting service each day and how did the chair pad even get soaked when it wasn't raining? 

On another occasion, the staff came with our orders. It was a Sri Lankan breakfast so there were a few dishes that they'd to place on our table. Before I could've even move a bag to make space, the staff took the liberty to remove it from the table for us. He should've at least ask if he or we could move the bag for him. (His colleague did so on another morning.) It contained my husband's camera lenses, which were heavy and expensive, thus careful handling was needed. This was also one of the factors which turned us off from eating our other meals there. The staff just made dining such a frustrating experience, sadly.

In all, KK Beach is nice and peaceful. It has a good seaview. But unfortunately, that's all that's wonderful. A pity because it seems that the hotel is highly spoken of. Almost everywhere in Sri Lanka, whenever they know we were staying/stayed at KK, everyone had something to say. The owner of one of the hotels we stayed in during our trip raved about KK. (And this hotel was in another town.) So did a friend of ours who is a hotelier (who was based in the capital) and even our tuk tuk driver. On another occasion, the jeweler whom I bought gems from wanted to waive off my delivery fee when he heard we were at KK. He spoke highly of its owner and the hotel. Such was the reputation of the place. Sadly, it didn't seem to live up to it for us. 

Somehow, we seemed to have missed out on the quality food and service that the good reviews were raving about. Maybe we were here at the wrong time, since it was low season and hence so was staff morale. Regardless, they should not let it show through. It can really make or break someone's stay, like it did for us. Truly a waste for such a beautiful hotel to be dragged down by things as basic as customer service and food. 

Would we come back here? Unfortunately, no. But we would consider their other property Kahanda Kanda next time. Hopefully it'd be better than this and just as excellent as the reviews say it is.
title: Beautiful Location, Disappointing Service

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Yu

Firstly may I apologise for the fact that you were woken by the noise from the building works next door. It is no excuse, but a new sub contractor had started work that morning, and he was unaware that we had stipulated no noise to be made until 8.30am out of consideration to our guests. The site foreman had not passed on this information, but ultimately it was our responsibility,  and for that I am very sorry. We did upgrade you, by way of a gesture of compensation, and we have greatly reduced our rates for the duration of the construction, and have ensured that guests are aware of this when booking. In fact we have worked hard to minimise any inconvenience to guests, and even though the works started on May 1st, yours is the first complaint from a guest.

With regards to the tuk tuk drivers outside, this is genuinely something that it out of our control. We do have a tuk tuk and driver for guests if they wish to use our services, otherwise we would call for a reputable driver from outside. However complaints against tuk tuk drivers are not an uncommon occurrence throughout Sri Lanka, and there is absolutely nothing we can do about it. We cannot be held accountable for their behaviour.

Finally, I am saddened that you feel the staff could smile more - Sri Lankans by nature are extremely friendly and smiley, and even the latest review here comments on how smiley all the staff were, so I am at a loss to understand why you felt this way.

With best wishes, 
George Cooper
placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
text:
KK beach is a beautiful boutique hotel near Thalpe. The suite which we were upgraded to was spacious and artfully decorated. The ocean view from our room was stunning especially during sunset. 

However, there was construction going on literally across the wall because the hotel is expanding. We were initially told that there would be some noise from 8:30am to about 5pm. Unfortunately, we were woken up at 7am the next morning from loud hammering. The hotel manager Sanjeewa offered to move us to a suite further away from the construction and it was much quieter. 

Another incident we encountered during our stay was the tuk tuk driver waiting/camping outside the hotel. His charges were high and was very possessive. We took his number because he told us he could show us turtle hatching on the beach but somehow he got the idea that he would be controlling our trip. He got upset when we took other tuk tuk and came to confront us at the hotel beach area and called us bad people and told us he knew all the places we went to. That was so out of line and creepy. The hotel should do more to prevent such people from coming in contact with its guests. 

Overall, the management team had a good problem solving attitude. The service team could use a little more smile. Not sure if the chef has changed, the food was okay but not spectacular.
title: Beware of construction and tuk tuk

placeInfo/address: No. 17 Udupussellawa Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
we chose this place as we wanted a cozy villa experience and the whole palace theme was inviting.

the pros
the manager mohan is very good.
the billiards room is well made.
the spa rooms are very nicely made. 
the hot water swimming pool is nice.
the chef is trying his best to do what he can. he made some onion fritters which were amazing.
the palace theme is nicely done with a nice dining room.
mohan went out of the way to help us with everything including finding 2 sisters to sing some Christmas songs on Christmas eve. also having one of the staff accompany us to a local temple and another one to take us trekking.
the rooms have very comfortable beds and linen and nice Jacuzzis in the bathroom.

the cons
there is no tea plantation view. there is a junk yard that can be seen from the garden and our bedrooms had the view of some sort of a factory in the back or the villa. the rooms on the first floor have front facing views which is better than the second floor villa where we were. we chose nuwariyaeliya for its serene tea plantations.
the place is overpriced to pay 500 usd a night for 300 sq ft rooms is too much. the rooms are small.
the food was mediocre the chef tried to do his best but maybe our vegeterian dietary requirements were tough for him to meet. he did try making dosa which were good but the chutney was sour. they did give us some amazing vurgin mojitos on Christmas eve. for the price we paid we expected much better quality food.
the butler did not have basic skills in laying out a table. the food would come but there would not be any cutlery. they are trying to do their best but they need to be properly trained.
usually have to wait 20 to 30 mins before dinner or breakfast is laid out.
ther is not enough channels to watch as they had to pay for hbo etc if we payinh 500 usd a night the most basic thing to buy is to buy a smart TV so we can link up our phone to the tv than.
everything is imported from China including the jacuzzi and furniture and some places the crappy Chinese quality can be seen. our buttons on jacuzzi were not working. the door handle came off. the paint on the edge of the dining table was scraping off.
overall the intentions of creating a palace is appreciated but staff needs to be better trained and they can't do anything about the view so if u want to enjoy the indoors it is great but don't expect much from the outdoors.
title: overpriced villa which has no tea plantation view.

The hotel is lovely and exclusive in Sri Lankan standards. Room is great, people are very friendly, pool area and beach nice, food very tasty.

placeInfo/address: Passikudah Kalkudah, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
The rooms in this modern hotel are nice and comfortable with great bathrooms which for our room were in a huge private outdoor courtyard. The beds are comfy and the swimming pool is small but perfect for a morning dip. It's right on the beach but sadly not the best beach which is about ten minutes down the road at the marina or where the locals go swimming at the public beach. 

The food is fine but not great - after one meal we decided to abandon the hotel restaurant and try other local places instead - go to Vasuki it's a short tuktuk ride but provides some of the best traditional food anywhere on Sri Lanka. 

The staff are very pleasant but we had to ask them two days in a row to tidy our room up. 

The a/c broke and was repaired quickly but a whole host of dead flies was left on the floor after the workman left. The large double bathtub was also broken when we arrived this was also kind of fixed but it took so long to fill you'd just never bother using it. The television was fuzzy and pretty much unusable and the wifi took me back to the days of dial up it was so slow. 

Culturally there's very little to do around Pasikudah. There are watersports in the area which are fun - we jet skied because the snorkling and diving were unavailable due to poor water clarity - and if that's you're thing there enough choice to keep you busy for a couple of days.

Overall it's still a slice of tropical paradise and if you're just a sun worshipping beach lover then you'll have a perfectly nice time. We just felt we'd had far better service in much more slickly run hotels around the island. If you were backpacking around Asia staying in small b&bs and decided to treat yourself for a night this place would seem like heaven. If however you were spending a little more on a luxurious trip you might well be sadly disappointed by the lack of attention to detail.
title: Not bad but not that great...

placeInfo/address: Passikudah Kalkudah, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
Booking a 5 Star hotel, I had certain expectations that were not met:
* Service in the restaurant and at the pool/beach: very often we had almost finished our meal when the ordered drinks were finally arriving at our table. No proactive service at all at the pool or beach.
* Food variety not great (we had half board). Sri Lanka has such a big variety of fruits. We only found the standard 3 fruits (wateremelon, pineapple, papaya) each day. Other hotels that were cheaper with less stars had much bigger choice for breakfast as well as for dinner. No variations for the desserts, also no big choice and variations for the main dishes. We had much better food for example in the Cinnamon Citadel in Kandy!
* WLAN speed was unacceptable. Loading of every page took hours or was interrrupted before loading was complete. In some rare occasions, I was able to watch a video on Youtube. We mentioned the slow connection to the staff. They told us they would try to do something about it. Only the last day, they specifically asked for our IP adress. This helped to speed the connection up for the given device. 
* The beach is not good for swimming in the ocean as the water is far too shallow, even during highest water.
* there is nothing offered concerning watersport or anything to entertain the kids. No stand up paddling or anything.
* All excursions offered are incredibly expensive. So that we did not book anything.
* The water in the black pool turns too hot. I guess that the water temperature was 40°C or above. Almost like a Thermal Water Spa. 

To mention on the positive side:
* very good room service. Very clean. Staff very polite.
* very nice style and size of the rooms
* staff at the reception was very polite and helpful
title: Our expectations were not fully met

placeInfo/address: Passikudah Kalkudah, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed for one night and took a beach suite 102. But was given a suite with other room views! Had to walk good 20 yards from the room to get a beach view. The beach was nice but the pool was horrible. Pitch black pool but advertised as a turquoise pool. My son is 2.5 years old and was afraid to get in to the pool because of the color.even the baby pool was black. We had a jacuzzi that did not work. We had a minibar which was completely empty and did not cool anything we put in there. The AC takes forever to cool the room. No bath slippers or beach slippers, it's a suite after all! The rooms and the hotel in general are not very safe for toddlers and small children, take a look at the pictures wires hanging out in the open and the room has split levels. Bathroom is huge and pointless because the shower cubicle is small compared to the space. Front Patio is a complete waste of space. I don't know if anyone ever use it? Veranda at the back leading to the beach is good if you have a good view only.generally the housekeeping and f&b staff were very polite and helpful. Front staff ok but need improvement on knowledge. I told them I want to omit the buffet and get a sandwich instead. They at once said NO! I had to tell them to contact f&b manager and ask and the f&b manager was kind enough to honor my request.
We also wanted to change the room because of split levels and wanted to speak to the FOM, front staff said they don't have a FOM and their supervisor arrives only after 2.30!
Overall it's ok but nothing special about the place.
title: Wasted space!
