placeInfo/address: Passikudah Kalkudah, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed for 4 nights at Sun Aqua, along with our 3 kids (14,12 and 10).

Having seen the "family villa" on the website, it sounded perfect for us: 2 rooms in one building, the implication that the kids could enjoy the upstairs while we took the room downstairs. However if your kids are small, take note: the rooms are not connected and both have an outside door, accessible to anyone passing by. Further, you can't see or hear from downstairs what's going on upstairs. Wholly unsuitable if you want to keep an eye on your children. Ours are a bit older now, but we weren't really prepared to "leave them to it".

On the plus side, when we expressed that the villa was unsuitable, we were upgraded straight away, which we very much appreciated. What we got was a single-storey pair of rooms with an interconnecting door and a private plunge pool. It opened directly onto the beach and we were absolutely delighted.

The rooms themselves were stylish, impeccably clean, spacious and comfortable. The hotel pool was excellent and there were plenty of sun loungers.

The food was variable. The website talks up its restaurant offerings - but they were not as wide-ranging as it makes out. The buffet wasn't amazing, though when we ordered from the menu the food was very good.

We thought the hotel let itself down a bit the service. The people were very friendly but not really on the ball. For example, we asked for drinks at the pool bar that just didn't appear, and got laundry done that we had to chase up as it went several hours past the deadline promised. I think things could have been a lot better organised.

In summary: lovely hotel, friendly people, in our opinion probably not the 5 star quality it claims, but has potential to be if it gets slicker with service.
title: Lovely hotel, friendly people but could tighten up on service

ownerResponse/text:
Dear rbright2016,

Thank you for your review. We hear you on your comments and we will strive to correct the shortcomings that you have highlighted on our reservations and of the resort in general.
placeInfo/address: Passikudah Kalkudah, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text:
We booked Sun Aqua through Booking.com without realising that it was both non-refundable and that the (very) small print added an extra 40% of costs making it a ridiculously expensive seven days. So please be very careful about hidden costs when using booking.com. The hotel was completely unhelpful in trying to rectify the situation and basically offered no other option but to stay for the seven nights at full costs.  When we arrived, the villas were also unsuitable for families as they consist of two separate apartments meaning we couldn't leave our children alone. Again, hotel completely unhelpful in providing alternatives.  The food is also extremely expensive - we were quoted  at $50 per day for half board which in the general context of Sri Lanka is an awful lot of cash.

Having said all that, the hotel aspires to be a luxury resort and generally succeeds in its ambition.  The rooms are spacious although [prone to things going wrong - we had to call out the handy man a few times to fix doors, electricity and AC. The pool is lovely, and position on the beach is good.  Passikudah beach is a bit soulless though - just a strip of luxury hotel followed by luxury hotel.  We much preferred Kalkuddah beach which was deserted and magnificent. Because of the prohibitive cost we opted to eat out - we jumped in a Tuk Tuk and visited the excellent Nandawanam Guest House which was a fraction of the cost of the hotel.

General feeling is that this is a generally decent luxury beachside hotel but not worth the money.
title: Watch Our fof Hidden Costs!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Haeadie,

Thank you for your comments, we do mosquito fogging very regularly but its a battle with mother nature. We hear you on the bathroom and food and we will put a plan to update pricing.
placeInfo/address: Passikudah Kalkudah, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: we had 101 and it had lots of problems!
text:
Just a really average stay - but at a fairly high price. 

The good things:
- the beach and pool - beautiful, pool is always warm, beach clean with plenty of loungers. As you are essentially doing a beach trip to here the importance of this cannot be underestimated! 
- the A la carte menu - really good food

What we didn't like:
- we had big problems with the AC. It barley worked and made a really loud clicking noise all night. We complained the next morning and it was fixed but started again late that night. The staff knew immediately what we were talking about so clearly not a new issue. 
- The buffet. Just not to our tastes - a wide selection but slightly cold, good mix of local and international - just all tasted a bit bland. Some people seemed to be really enjoying it - but prob not for foodies (the a la carte was fab though!)
- The bathrooms. Really dated look about them - old style fixtures, things not finished that well. Outside so high mozzie risk. 
- Mosquitoes - now I know this is a tropical country, and i was obviously expecting to get munched upon by mozzies.. however we stayed in top end hotels and usually they spray for mozzies regularly and the number of bites is reduced. This is the only place we stayed in sri lanka where I got bitten. 
- Attention from the staff.. people were clearly keen to try to please but a few things upset us. We asked for help removing a frog - which the staff then killed in front of us (we just wanted it moved!), the AC problem was dealt with quickly but re-occurred and no compensation was offered, the team spoke to us personally and had a long chat at dinner - the next day the same team member introduced himself again. If you are going to chat to guests you have to actually remember them! 

We didn't overall hate it! Just felt it was a lot of money for what we got. The pool and beach were good though. I think it just needs a price drop or a room overhaul!
title: Really Average

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Jessica J,

Thank you for your review, we are indeed happy to note that you enjoyed your stay with us. Please do not hesitate to contact us if you need any further assistance.
placeInfo/address: Passikudah Kalkudah, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Beach Suite
text:
Such an amazing hotel and beach!  All rooms are villas and the washrooms are huge! All villas are beautifully furnished and the staff extremely welcoming. The pool overlooks a private beach. The food is excellent and has a lot of choices. I'm so happy we made time to visit passikudah. We had a very nice time in sun Aqua!!
Thank you so much Sun Aqua for a beautiful stay!
title: Amazing Hotel and Beach!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Chathuraanuranga1971,

Thank you for your review. We take note on the lack of shelters for walkways, we do provide umbrella's in the rooms and you can also call the concierge for assistance on your next visit. We acknowledge the issue on training and we are happy to note that we equip our staff with specific on the job training on a on going basis.
placeInfo/address: Passikudah Kalkudah, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Rooms are dark & need to have more lighting
text: After traveling from Dambulla we checked in to Sun Aqua, That was a rainy day for Passikudah, rooms are average & clean, no roof or shelters for walkways, it was terrible when raining, me and my son took a bath from pool, that was a huge pool with nice see view, there was a very good movie collection in there DVD library. most of the service staff from local area, they are hospitable but they need to have bit more training, There are few up coming hotels and dining options in Passikudah
title: Grate stay but not a comfortable one

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Nilushanw

Many thanks for your support and for taking the time to write this review.
We have duly noted on the shortcomings from your comments and will work hard to ensure that we improve our performance. We take every single comment very seriously as they help us gauge what is required of us in delivering great customer service.

Once again, thank you for the review and I hope you will still have us as your preferred  get together holiday destination in Pasikudah. In the meantime, if we can be of any assistance at all, please do reach out to us.

Yours Sincerely,

S.Sivanesan
Resident Manager
placeInfo/address: Passikudah Kalkudah, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
roomTip: ocean view rooms are good but make sure you have written proof with you after the booking
text:
There were several issues we had to deal during our stay, a lady (apparently the head of house keeping) had an unacceptable rude attitude when we were dealing with an issue with our room. And the tidiness and preparation were below average. The rooms were not very clean and we had to ask several times to clean the room, even the sink wasn't draining properly and it was disgusting. So we had to wait quite a long time for our rooms to be ready.The location on the other hand was a bit of a disappointment due to the beach being inaccessible with sharp coral pieces

Rest of the staff was brilliant and tried their best to deliver us the best service possible though they seems to be relatively new and confused. Upgraded our room and always attentive. The food was good and the room facilities were satisfying.
title: Can do much better!

placeInfo/address: Passikudah Kalkudah, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka
text: We had a bag of washing done and it cost $74 dollars Australian. They didn't warn us. Insanely expensive. More expensive than a dry cleaner in Australia. Staff were friendly but it left a sour taste in my mouth. Beautiful grounds. Be careful with costs.
title: Most expensive laundry ever

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text:
We had a 3 night stay at the Reef Villas & Spa, it’s worth noting there is no spa and we probably would not have booked had we known (though in fairness the website doesn’t feature it).

We were in Sri Lanka and stayed in 10 hotels, the Villas at the Reef are really  nice, really large colonial style, with lovely furniture and comfortable beds with mosquito nets. Worth the price of the of the rooms. 

The food in the restaurant was also good, particularly at breakfast. Perhaps not quite as high as the expectation we had from other reviews. The main complaint was the relatively small menu didn’t change for the 3 nights we were there.

Our main beef was the prices of the drinks (in particular), and the food. There is limited choice locally for food, but beer was the most expensive we paid in our whole time there, so unsurprisingly we didn’t tend to drink in the hotel restaurant or at the pool, a shame. 

The beach is lovely and the service was great, particularly Dino who was always so keen to please, and had a nice sense of humour.

The manager Mike and the rest of the team on site were helpful and again keen to please.

Lastly it’s only a smallish place and doesn’t run anywhere near capacity so you can guarantee a very peaceful place.
title: Lovely but a little beef with the reef!

ownerResponse/text:
I am sorry you didn’t enjoy your stay with us and I would like to address the issues you raised.

The building is not old, in fact it was built in 2008.  We incorporated antique architectural features and wonderful artefacts into the design which you may not have realised.

I personally greeted you on arrival and walked you into the hotel which I do with all guests.  I made every effort to introduce to you the property but you showed no interest and walked off mid sentence.  I didn’t blame your children for anything whatsoever, that is completely disingenuous?

I feel you have over played issues on your stay and the real issue for your negative review is the issue with take away pizza which you never mentioned.  

You called our office and asked if it was OK to bring in take away pizzas and you were informed that outside food was not allowed to be brought in or consumed in the hotel.  You gave an angry response to that person and demanded that I speak with you.

I immediately called you and you didn’t take my call but your husband did and I informed him the same.

You nevertheless ordered pizzas and ferreted them into your suite disregarding our hotel policy.

While we encourage our guests to treat the hotel like their home, our suites are antique laden with fine silk fabrics and I was extremely unhappy that you left leftover pizza and pizza boxes in our beautiful suite. 

The bathrooms lights are not at fault.  When you stayed it was the beginning of the monsoon rains and so there were frequent power cuts.  We have a full back up generator that takes over in the event of a power cut and takes under 10 seconds to take over.

The coffee machine developed a fault on your first day at breakfast and was repaired for the following mornings breakfast, so it wasn’t broken for two days.  We have and had filter coffee available in the restaurant and in your room we have freshly ground filter coffee in your room with a cafetière.

We offer tremendous value for money, the suite you stayed in is 130 square metres with two large sea facing verandas, directly on the beach on three acres of land with a tennis court, tropical gardens and ponds, a wonderful seafood restaurant and two spas and all this with only seven suites so privacy is guaranteed.
placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text:
The building is old, the lights in the bathroom are on timer and mid-shower I found myself in pitch black.
The owner is eccentric and blamed my children’s behavior as a reason for not providing us with information about the resort... I could not believe it!!!
The coffee machine was spoiled and we could not get the coffee we wanted for the first 2 days.
However my kids enjoyed the pool and the beach and the staff and especially the hotel Manager Malith were attentive and tried their best to let us feel welcome although we had so many hurdles for a VERY expensive stay.
We felt we did not get money for value at all.
Our last night a ceiling tile fell middle of the night on the floor waking me up, lucky it fell midroom and not our kids heads, management response was that they are sorry but it could have happened to anyone...
Overall I felt it was over priced for what we got. Good if you don’t have much expectations for the price you pay.
title: Disappointed!

ownerResponse/text:
I am sorry you didn’t like our beautiful puppies – they just wanted to meet you!

The adorable puppies are our golden retrievers Fred and Wilma and our guests love them.

Yes they are bouncy but they are fun loving puppies.

You raised a few issues, which I would like to respond to:

Electricity. In Sri Lanka there is often a problem with power, so we have a full back up generator, which immediately and automatically takes over in the event of a power cut.

If you remember the night you stayed there was a big storm and a mains power cut from time to time and so our generator took over automatically and you were never without power for more than 10 seconds.  This also affects the WiFi as the provider relies on the local electricity supply.

You mentioned this when you were leaving and I explained this to you.

Regarding toiletries, we replenish our toiletries daily and our housekeeping records confirm this.  There were four of you staying in one suite and our record also confirmed additional items such as additional dressing gowns placed in the room.

With all due respect I think you may be mistaken as four of you were occupying the suite and one of the party may have entered the bathroom and opened a bottle.

We have a two-part housekeeping process before handing over a suite to a guest.  After the suite is serviced, the housekeeping manager signs it off and the general manager does a final inspection.

All our suites have a comprehensive range of luxurious toiletries by Kama Ayurveda.  We are the only hotel in Sri Lanka using this exclusive Indian brand and we just love share them with our guests!
placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text:
We were looking for a nice place to stay at the last night prior to our departure that is a bit close to the airport, and we ended up booking at the Reef Villa & Spa.

The positive things about the Reef in my opinion are the following: 1* room is really big and has a unique style and specious bathroom, 2* food is SO delicious, 3* surroundings are peaceful, 4* there is a chance to experience riding an elephant (Monica, the village elephant), 5* owner and his staff are extremely friendly.

On the other hand, some of the things that bothered us were as follows: 1* as soon as we arrived and opened the car door to step out, two dogs jumped on us -- turned out to be the owner's dogs (what a reception!), 2* some of the toiletries provided were used as you can see from the attached picture, 3* no tissues were provided in the room (and when ordered, they brought a torn off box filled with wrinkled tissues as you can see from the attached picture), 4* room had lots of insects, 5* electricity went off several times at night, 6* poor wifi connection, 7* no one was at the reception at night when we needed to request something (we rang the bell, as instructed, and waited for so long without any luck -- fortunately, we saw one of the staff passing outside and we went to talk to him.)

We were really expecting a 5 star kind of place and service given the expensive price, but unfortunately, we were disappointed in the end!
title: Expected More!

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text: An exquisite, elegant, luxurious little hotel, our suite and the main building filled with tasteful and beautiful artefacts which have been carefully collected and displayed.  The entrance area was enchanting, paths weaving through flowering shrubs and past tranquil fish ponds.  All very zen.  Our suite on the first floor of the main house has to be one of the finest we have ever stayed in, and we have been lucky enough to stay in some very fine places.  We stayed in an Ocean Suite the first night and it was basically the same style of room but without a view and darker inside. The food was excellent, we enjoyed all our meals and there was a large choice on the menu which didn't change.  The Sri Lankan breakfast which has to be ordered the day before was particularly good.  The hotel should only be graded excellent but the service is not at all up to scratch for a very expensive, luxury hotel and that drags it down to average.  The restaurant staff don't speak much English at all and this made for a frustrating time for everyone (staff included) when ordering.  We were frequently given the wrong dish which became tedious especially as the food is expensive and the service slow.   The suite was kept immaculately but again very slow in servicing, a couple of times they were still there at lunch time when I wanted to tidy up before lunch after swimming.  For evening turndown you fill in on a card which time you would like it done and hang it outside the door, an arrangement I haven't seen before and that worked well.  Most of our days were cloudy and as the hot water is solar powered it ran out.  There is an auxiliary method of heating but this plainly wasn't turned on until we remarked that we had had no hot water for 24 hours.  Again, no hot water is not acceptable in an expensive hotel.  The manager is very helpful and very hands on, as he is the only person who speaks good English he has to sort out all problems himself.  The beach is very long but very narrow so there is no space for loungers on the beach.  We were advised only to swim in the sea during the morning, it wasn't deep enough for swimming as such but gorgeous warm water and rolling waves which were fun.  We felt there was a lack of anywhere to sit to enjoy a drink before dinner, or indeed any time.  A couple of tables by the pool but that is not a change of scene and if they were occupied the only option was to go into the restaurant and not have a drink first.  Sitting in the main house didn't seem to be encouraged which is a shame as it would have been delightful to sit there but it was too warm even by the evening anyway.  A terrace area with tables, chairs and parasols at the end of the garden looking  out to sea would be extremely pleasant.  It would be helpful to say on the website under the excursions how much each one costs and how long they last.  We went on the one to Richmond Castle which was very interesting.
title: Disappointing for the price.

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here for 4 days during a 3-week vacation in Sri Lanka.  It is a beautifully designed facility with very interesting rooms and big bathrooms (at least ours was big).  It was so peaceful and lovely and a great way to start and relax into our vacation and get over our jet lag.  The food was also quite good -- a nice mixture of Sri Lankan and Western Food available.  (You must order the Sri Lankan breakfast in advance, however, as it takes longer to make.)

The main downside to this property was the service.  Compared to the other places we stayed during our trip, the service was particularly lackluster here.  It was quite lethargic and to be honest, they could have made a lot more money out of us had they tried a bit harder. (I sat by the pool most days and was only asked once if I'd like anything to drink.  Because it is the Monsoon and not high tourist time here, there were only 4 of us staying at the resort so this could have been because they were short staffed.)  Also, the most irritating thing is that unlike every other hotel we stayed in here, they didn't include service or taxes in their prices a BIG surprise at the end.  And their prices were high.  A 30-minute head drip in their spa was $85.  That is significantly more than we paid in any other hotel here (and we were in luxury hotels across Sri Lanka -- all to the standard of this one) and even more than we pay at home in New York City!  We were quite shocked by this... 

So, although we did relax and enjoy our time here, it was definitely not a highlight.
title: Beautiful Facility, Service could use some work...

ownerResponse/text:
We thank you for your superb review in our guest book and greatly appreciate your many compliments reminding us how much you loved Reef, how amazing our staff are and how you are planning on returning with your families next year to book Reef exclusively.

As you were fully aware, breakfast is included in your suite rate.  If you wish to order room service, which you did several times, this is chargeable and this was clear from the menus in your suite, which you agreed to and signed for.

A honeymoon breakfast in your suite, is available as part of one of our honeymoon packages.  However you did not select this concierge option.

When you stayed with us it was the Monsoon season and therefore off-season. Although the weather was sunny and without rain for the duration of your stay, the seas can be rough and we quite rightly advised against swimming in the sea.  As you know have a beautiful swimming pool. 

From November to April, the sea is wonderful, and superb for swimming, all of which we told you about when you booked and arrived in September.  

Bernadette Barker
Director
placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text:
I recently spent 10 nights at Reef for my honeymoon. the place is lovely, the food is delicious and the staff,extemely attentive but at times felt to me too attentive!(nice for the first few days but got a bit oppresive after a while) My husband chose reef as it sounded the perfect romantic getaway, we wanted some private quiet time (it as our honeymoon after all!) But we were constantly phoned by the staff if we had not put our dinner order in at lunch time and it felt like our every move was being monitored, the turn down service, although good, was always done whilst we were still in our room getting ready for dinner or just trying to have some private time, as was the cleaning in the morning, I couldn't quite understand why this was as we were mostly the only guests at the resort so the staff could easily have serviced the room whilst we were not in it!  My husband also took exception to being charged £15 each for having breakfast in the room one morning instead of the restaurant (which was approx 50 yds from our room!) He felt that,as we had already paid for breakfast in the room rate, we should be allowed to have it in our room if we wished, after all, it was our honeymoon, a once in a lifetime occasion so we felt that perhaps
(being that we we were the only guests at the time) we would be granted this request gratis, little touches like this,go a long way to making the perfect trip for me. 
I also felt very uncomfortable when the staff were apologising about us having to pay and were themselves uncomfortable that they had to ask for payment, they clearly felt it was an un-necessary added expense. 
The manager was excellent at arranging trips for us, I would recommend a driver they use called Supan, nothing was too much trouble, he really was wonderful.

I loved Sri Lanka and overall,my stay at Reef was a pleasant one, I do hope I am not going to get a telling off by the owners for my review (as others on here have),it is just my personal opinion and hopefully will be taken as it is meant, as constructive not destructive.

One last thing though, the complaint by a reviewer that you cannot swim in the sea is a valid one, we were in fact told by the owner when we arrived NOT to swim in the sea due to the dangerous under current so he should be honest about this as if people are expecting to relax on the beach and swim in the sea,(like I was expecting) they will be disappointed, I think it is important for the owners to not take the crticism personally and feel they have to defend every point, it isn't their fault that the sea is not swimmable and the beach is far from perfect,these things are out of their control, perhaps what they could focus on is areas that they do have control over and not take constructive criticism as a personal slight. I wish Reef the very best for the future. Kind regards  MRS Hayes
title: peaceful honeymoon?

ownerResponse/text:
You have got it completely right.  Reef is not a “beach resort” and nor have we ever claimed to be.  We don’t offer banana boats, buffets, disco balls or candy floss.  

Your claim that the beach is a dirty strip of land is simply ridiculous and utter nonsense; with respect you obviously didn’t set foot on it.  The golden sandy beach stretches for miles with leaning palm trees reminiscent of a Bounty Bar ad along with Monica the village elephant strolling lazily along the beach with her mahout.  This beats any donkey ride.  Contrary to your claim that the sea is not swimmable this is simply nonsense; it is the Indian Ocean with beautiful warm temperatures all year round. 

Take a look at the images of our beach on Trip Advisor.

Reef is a high end luxury property with only seven exclusive palatial suites set in three acres of tropical gardens with a 65 metre beach frontage.

And whilst we don’t offer karaoke we do offer a luxury private and intimate spa, yoga tuition, an all weather tennis court, table tennis, and romantic dinners on your private terrace, and private excursions none of which you chose to use.

Our attendant pool boy will ensure that your sun bed is facing in the right direction and your towel laid out without a crease, all appealing to the discerning traveller who is seeking total privacy and exclusivity. 

From your comments and from discussions relayed from our staff, perhaps you would have made a better choice by travelling in an organized group or package tour and staying at an all-inclusive property where compulsory entertainment would have been laid on for you.

What Reef is not is a home stay or house party where you will dine with and be entertained by the owners.

We have a staff of over 38 wonderful people who, together with our impeccable manager Malith Perera, will pamper and spoil you and ensure that your every need is catered for with their non-intrusive service. Our overflowing guest book with its highly complimentary comments and our repeat guests is testament to the success of Reef.

We frequently have requests for Reef on an exclusive basis and recently had one guest who booked Reef for exclusive use for over a month but beware, for this we do charge a premium. Most guests would relish having Reef all to themselves.  Our aim is quality not quantity at Reef. 

I glanced at your other comments and you complained about all the other lovely properties you stayed at and again you added nothing constructive or positive.  Perhaps you were out of your comfort zone.  I fail to see the purpose of your review, beware indeed.
placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text:
Reef Villa is indeed a beautifully designed and appointed property, but by the second week in  March there were very few visitors. Apart from ourselves there were 6 people to start with, but three days later we were the only ones.
Perhaps this was why the owners were on holiday at this time . In their absence their excellent staff worked very hard to make our stay as good as possible, but being alone and eating in an empty restaurant was a dispiriting affair. It was like taking a cruise on the Marie Celeste - first choice of the deck chairs but there has to be more to it than that!
The villa is beautifully furnished and the grounds immaculate, but be aware that it isn't really a beach resort. There is a very dirty strip of beach in front with no facilities and a beach that's unsafe for bathing.

If solitude is for you then so is Reef Villa. Otherwise try and check occupancy and if less that full try alternatives.
title: beautiful but beware

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text:
The initial welcome, with garlands and drinks and no standing at a reception desk promised a lot.  However we were shown to our room to be told that the toilet was constantly leaking (but not that the jacuzzi was broken) and that were we sure that we wanted to stay in it?  We were then offered an upgrade to another villa in the morning.

Throughout our three night stay we felt that we were being slotted into a very specific schedule for meals, and that the place was being run to suit the staff rather than the guests.  For instance we had to choose our evening meal when we chose our lunch, and on the one time we didn't we were rung several times in our villa about it.  The turn down service was also carried out before meals started - this was unbelievable at this price level, as it meant that we were disturbed every night when getting ready for dinner.  On one occassion I put "Do not disturb" on the door only to be told off by the housekeeping staff both that night and the following day.

This led to the Reef having a very odd atmosphere, as it felt as if the staff were in charge while the owners were absent.  The lack of management also meant that on occasion it took forty minutes to find a member of staff or get an answer on the room service number - and when successful it took over three quarters of an hour, and a personal visit by my husband to the kitchen, to get a small plate of sandwiches made in the afternoon.

Altough these may sound petty the website, and the correspondence prior to our arrival, coupled with the price, set our expectations high.  The things that were missing, and the inconsistent service, were the small things that spoil holidays.  Had we been able to sort some of these things out while we were there we would have.  However the owner was due to arrive the day after we did but never materialised, and although the staff spoke good English it was difficult to articulate these concerns when a manager wasn't obvious among them.
title: A beautiful place but they need to get the service right

ownerResponse/text:
How silly!  You were requested to vacate your suite on time as we had incoming guests.  As you know from check in, and as clearly stated on the guest registration form, which you duly completed, our check out time is 11am.  We regularly have late check outs by prior agreement but in this case it was not possible as we had guests arriving and we need time to prepare the suite.
By 11:50 I went to your suite to personally request that you please vacate your suite as you had ignored our housekeeping staff’s request to do so.
Your response to me was that checkout was 12:30pm.
I informed you that the check in/out time was clearly printed on the Guest Arrival form, which you had completed and then you accused me of being rude.
I really don’t know how this can be seen to be rude?
Thank you however for your kind comments about Reef.
We do note that on each of your TripAdvisor reviews you have made derogatory comments about all the other hotels you also stayed in.
On your next visit to us, with suitable notice we would be pleased to arrange a late check out for you, subject to availability.
placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text:
Absolutely a beautiful place with very kind Sri Lankan staff. Nicely designed hotel with nature environment. Good space, nice pool, Good food. 

But don’t except Sri Lankan hospitality from Management especially from rude owner. Be careful when you use hotel furniture and you might get hurt.

Anyhow it is a perfect place to enjoy
title: Beautiful Place with Rude owner .

placeInfo/address: 78 Samanthara Rd, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka
text:
We booked in October 2008 for arrival 30/12/08. The on line information states that the Spa would be open later in the year. There is no sign of the spa. There was to be a daily A La Carte menu...which didn't change and was the same for lunch and dinner and included hamburgers, fish and chips and [tinned] tuna salad. According to their web site we could eat from their Tandoori oven or try their delicious BBQ or their fresh catch of the day. None existed, neither did the espresso machine. 
We were the only two guests over New Year. The couple who own the hotel looked horrified when I suggested upon arrival, after discovering we were the only guests, that perhaps they could join us for dinner one night. The owners didn't even come near us to wish us a Happy New Year and actually walked passed me on New Years Day rather than look up and say hello, although I said Hello Brendon. I actually asked that, as we were the only guests, could we please order what we would like and then have it prepared.  This was later discribed as complaining.

Any complaint we made regarding, for instance, the lack of hot water on 3 of our 5 nights, the sliced, stale white bread and golden syrup served up as honey for breakfast, was all noted and used as part of the abuse we recieved on departing. We were told we did nothing but complain and they put themselves out to accomodate us!
 
We believe that as architects, they have built a beautiful facility and would recommend not visiting until Brendon O'Donnell and Bernadette Barker face the fact that they are NOT suitable owners for a 5 star boutique hotel. They love the property they built, but paying guests should be seen and not heard! We would recommend that you check it out and only stay there after they sell the property. The owners suggested that no hotel in the world would possible want us as their guests! Our life has been spent in the service industry and we have had to spend most of our time working with owners and operators of hotels as well as with guests.
title: The Basil and Sybil Fawlty Experience

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Peter,

Thank you for taking the time to share such a detailed and thoughtful review of your recent stay with us at Hilton Yala Resort. It was truly a pleasure meeting you, and I sincerely appreciate your candid feedback.

I regret that aspects of your experience, particularly regarding the all-inclusive offering, did not meet your expectations. Your concerns were completely understandable, and I appreciate the opportunity you gave us to address them during your stay. As you noted, we have since updated our website to ensure greater clarity in our offerings, and I truly value your insights in helping us improve.

On a more positive note, I’m delighted to hear that you enjoyed the exceptional quality of our villas, food, and safaris. It means a lot to know that you found the Premium Pool Villa to be one of the best suites you’ve stayed in and that your experience with Sam on safari was so enjoyable. I will personally share your kind words with Hashini, Vishmi, Shamal, and the rest of the team, who will be thrilled to know they made a positive impression.

Your feedback is invaluable, and we take it to heart as we continue refining our guest experience. It was a pleasure having you with us, and I truly hope we will have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future for an even more seamless and memorable stay. Please don’t hesitate to reach out to me directly should you ever decide to return—I would be more than happy to personally assist with your arrangements.

Wishing you all the best and safe travels ahead.

Warm regards,
placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 95000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Double Check the fine print and significant restrictions - the advertised All Inclusive rate is certainly NOT All Inclusive.
text:
We stayed two nights in a Premium Pool Villa on the Safari All Inclusive Rate which was advertised 'Safari All inclusive. Experience Yala with a daily safari and all-inclusive dining and free flow alcohol'. After checking in we were taken to our villa and advised that the free flow alcohol was only available during lunch and dinner service and did not include any items from the villa mini-bar which were all chargeable. We requested that this be checked as the room rate was extremely high (more than we payed at nearby Uga Chena Huts which was an incredible all inclusive stay). The staff member left our villa and called us about 10 minutes later reaffirming what she had told us earlier. 

We were in the foyer when General Manager Gitanjali approached us. We had a conversation regarding the advertised all inclusive rate and the restrictions we were now advised of (which were certainly not advertised anywhere), showing her the Yala Hilton website, and requested whether we could cancel our booking and return to Uga Chena Huts. Gitanjali was very understanding, checked the advertised rate on the website and listened to our concerns. She agreed that the website did not advise of any of the restrictions, and agreed that the alcohol menu from the all inclusive lunch and dinner service would be made available to us for the duration of our stay (by the main pool, pre and after dinner drinks etc).  Unfortunately this is an extremely limited menu that consists mainly of soft drinks, milkshakes and juices with a choice of one red or white wine and limited cocktail or spirits. 

On our last day we were informed that there were a number of mini-bar items available free of charge daily in our villa (beer and soft drink) that we were previously advised were all chargeable, this was disappointing. 

We experienced a number of ongoing service issues during the stay, where the all inclusive alcohol menu was refused, which required this issue to be unfortunately addressed a number of times each day. Fortunately it was resolved satisfactorily on each occasion with the assistance of Gitanjali or Front Office Manager Vino. We found both Gitanjali and Vino to be excellent; they were both friendly, intuitive and professional. 

The Hilton Yala Resort is one of the most luxurious and high quality resorts that we have stayed in anywhere in the world. The small number of suites and villas means that the large resort never fills too busy or overcrowded. The main pool is absolutely spectactular and one of the best resort pools you will come across. 

The food was of an exceptional quality and we had a number of great meals, with the chef happy to make variations for dietary requirements. The breakfast, lunch and dinner meals were all exceptional. The Hopper X Benny was the absolute standout breakfast meal! 

Service was exceptional and the staff at Hilton Yala Resort are well trained, we received amazing service from Hashini, Vishmi and Shamal during our meals. 

We did two safari drives with Sam the Ranger / Guide and they were great. The quality of vehicles and drivers used were excellent, Sam was very informative and passionate and made the experience very enjoyable. 

The Premium Pool Villa was exceptional! One of the best hotel suites that we have ever stayed in! Extremely spacious, well appointed and very modern with the latest technology and high class linen and fittings. The bed was extremely comfortable and the linen and towels of the highest quality. The pool was phenomenal and we spent loads of time in it. 

It it wasn't for the service issues and advertising issue regarding the all inclusive rate, this would have been easily a five star review and stay. Having to deal with this a number of times a day slightly ruined what would have otherwise been an incredible experience. The price Hilton charges for an all inclusive rate where alcohol is only served during lunch and dinner is not all inclusive and does not represent value when compared to nearby Uga Chena Huts or Wild Coast Tented Lodge which both have exceptional all inclusive offerings. 

I note after our stay, Hilton Yala Resort has corrected their website which now states 'Safari all inclusive. Experience Yala with a daily safari incl dining, free flow alcohol during meals.'
title: All Inclusive is NOT an All Inclusive rate with significant restrictions and availability

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Jeff, 

Thank you for taking the time to share such a detailed review of your stay with us. We're pleased to hear that you enjoyed your upgraded pool villa and appreciated the privacy, spaciousness, and amenities it provided. It's also wonderful to know that you found our team welcoming and the ambiance of our restaurant appealing.

We sincerely regret that the dining experience did not meet your expectations, especially the vegan options, and we appreciate your candid feedback. We'll review this with our culinary team to ensure improvements are made to better cater to all dietary preferences.

We understand the limitations you experienced with the setting of our property due to our proximity to the National Park. The safety and well-being of our guests, as well as the protection of wildlife, are paramount, which is why certain restrictions are in place. We apologize if this detracted from the enjoyment of your stay, and we recognize that this type of setting may not be ideal for all travelers.

We appreciate your valuable insights and will continue to work on enhancing the experience for our guests while balancing the unique environment we're situated in. Thank you again for choosing to stay with us, and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future with an improved experience.

Best Regards
placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 95000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here for 4 nights after spending three weeks traveling around Sri Lanka.  Because we are Hilton members, we were upgraded to a pool villa, which was a delightful, spacious suite with a small pool and very nice outside sitting area.  There were plenty of electrical outlets and USB ports.  While these villas don’t have a view, we were nicely screened from neighboring villas, so it felt very private.  This suite was one of the best we have ever seen.

There is a nice view from the restaurant, and it has a pleasant atmosphere.  The servers are pleasant and attentive.  Unfortunately, the quality of the food was disappointing.  Possibly they do better with the meat dishes, but the vegan food did not live up to the very high prices charged.  We had far better food for a 1/4 of the price at a local restaurant we found 20 minutes away by car. 

It is also important to know that the hotel is in the national park’s buffer zone.  It’s great to be so close to the park, but that does limit the ability to enjoy the setting.  Because of the wild animals, we were only allowed to visit the beach area during the scheduled 1-hour Ranger Walks at 5 am and 5 pm – and ocean swimming is not allowed.  After 6 pm, you cannot use the pool area and cannot walk between your room and the restaurant or spa; the hotel provides a buggy service instead.  You are not allowed to bring food to your room or eat in the sitting area outside your room.  

The pool has some nice sitting areas, but it is shallow and more of a wading pool than a swimming pool.  We didn’t use the pool or ever see anyone else using it.  

As already stated, the rooms here are great, and the grounds look beautiful.  Unfortunately, we didn’t enjoy ourselves as much as we expected.  The food was uninspired and overpriced.  We also felt trapped in our room because of the limitations on walking around and the lack of beach access.  After being visited by a large troop of aggressive monkeys, we didn’t even feel comfortable enjoying our outside plunge pool and seating area.  While it sounds romantic to be right on the ocean in a national park, and watching monkeys play is fun for awhile, the reality is that you can’t really enjoy the location.  If you tend to spend your hotel time inside, this may be a good choice for you.  Since we prefer to spend more time outside, it wasn’t a good choice for us.
title: Excellent rooms, but overall disappointing

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Ayesha,

Thank you for sharing your feedback regarding your recent stay with us. We sincerely apologize that certain aspects of your experience did not meet your expectations. We also appreciate your positive remarks about our rooms and the top-notch service provided by our staff.

I would like to clarify that our second restaurant is not closed due to low occupancy. Rather, we have decided to offer the same menu at our all-day dining restaurant due to the high temperature and humidity, ensuring a more comfortable dining experience for our guests.

Our pricing for activities such as safaris and bush walks reflects the unique and enriching experiences we provide. These activities are conducted by our FGASA-qualified rangers, who offer exceptional and informative journeys through the natural beauty of our surroundings. Numerous positive reviews attest to the value of these experiences.

Given our location within a national park, we are subject to restrictions on entertainment to preserve the natural environment and ensure the safety of our guests and wildlife. As your safety is our utmost priority, we accompany guests to the beach to ensure a secure and enjoyable visit.

We appreciate your understanding and thank you for your valuable feedback. Should you have any further concerns or questions, please feel free to reach out to us directly.

Best regards,
placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 95000 Sri Lanka
text: I had high expectations for this place and my stay did not live up to them. Although the room was great and the service provided by staff was top notch, the hotel didn't really offer anything to justify the price tag, its second restaurant was closed due to low occupancy so guests only had access to one restaurant and the activities offered by the hotel i.e safari and bush walks were massively overpriced. There's not much going on in the hotel in the evenings by way of entertainment and the beach is not accessible privately.
title: Unsatisfactory stay

Pour plus de 100€, l'hôtel nous a proposé à l'arrivée une chambre sans vue, vitre occultée sans lumière du jour. Nous sommes en vacances et pas venu être dans une chambre de prison !!!

Nous venons dans cet établissement depuis plus de 10 ans (notre pieds à terre à Colombo) je trouve que c'est une honte de commercialier ce type de chambre et demander 26€ pour avoir une vue par la fenêtre !!!

Pour notre retour, on voulait revenir à Marino beach mais après la mauvaise expérience, on a testé Jetwing Colombo, un hôtel excellent avec vue dégagée, belle piscine et une cuisine exceptionnelle et moins cher !!!

Cette fois ci on nous explique que notre chambre sera avec vitre occultees en raison de travaux en vis à vis! Une chambre sans fenêtre en fait! Qu'un hôtel de ce niveau de prix puisse louer des chambres sans fenêtres me semble hors de toute imagination... durant les 4 nuits de notre séjour, l'un des 3 ascenseurs restera en panne, sans être réparé, occasionnant des temps d'attente bien penibles! Peut être faudrait il louer des chambres moins chères aux gens sui acceptent de monter les 10 étages par les escaliers???
Nous avions prévu de revenir à marino beach en fin de séjour... mais incapables de savoir si on allait à nouveau nous attribuer une chambre sans fenêtres, nous avons annulé et nous sommes décides à aller à jetwing colombo 7. Et c'est un super choix à tarif équivalent! Pas du tout certain qu'on revienne un jour à marino beach!

placeInfo/address: 590 Marine Drive, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
We are currently staying at this hotel for 13 nights and whilst the hotel looks reasonable there are many flaws. 

First of all housekeeping needs an overhaul. The rooms are serviced daily however not very well. We have been here now for eight nights and our quilt cover has never been replaced. We know this as there is a biro mark I made on the day of arrival that is still on the bed. The cleaners carry a mop but no bucket and yesterday our room had a strong smell of urine after it had been cleaned. 

We asked twice for our room to be serviced however after returning from a trip 4 hours later it still hadn’t been. I went down to reception and complained following which it was serviced but we had the awful smell. 

We also had to ring three times, and wait 40 minutes before our laundry was collected.

The breakfast buffet is the same every morning with no variation which is Ok if you’re only here a day or two.

If this hotel is to market itself as a five star experience it seriously needs to lift its game.
title: Management at this Hotel Needs an Overhaul

roomTip: Use Uber instead of hotel taxi.
text:
It seems to me this hotel is overhyped. Rooms are fine and clean, however I paid extra for signature room plus with sun beds. Totally not worth it, the view is fine but the sun beds are terrible and not comfy. They could put at least some greens on the balcony to make it feel better. We were 2 + 1 and I paid for 2 + 1, but still towels were provided just for 2 of us. No extra bed for kid or whatsoever. 

The onsite restaurant seems to be overpriced, even for tourist place. Food quality is fine but also nothing really special - for sure not worth the money asked. 

The roof pool is great and provide fantastic view, but number of sun beds is very limited. Provided city bus tour is great and I highly recommend using it - it is free of charge and it goes to 5 places around Colombo and entire trip takes around 3 hours.   There is also bus going every hour to the beach side. Not tried it, but pictures looked great. 

As such, I recommend this hotel on arrival / departure from Sri Lanka as this is not far away from the airport (Transfer takes around 45 minutes, charged 50 USD for individual bus).  There is taxi offered, the price asked 1 USD per 2 kilometers. I recommend to get UBER and pay for tuc tuc as locals. 

Overall I would not pick this hotel again.
title: Overhyped hotel.

A corporate style hotel offering functional rooms. Designed for airport transfers/overnights and business meetings. 

Breakfast was good with a large choice. The rooms were clean.

However, the airport transfer that was arranged was poor.
A performative display at the taxi counter in the hotel was put on before being told that the normal transfer service was fully booked out and a BMW would have to be specially arranged for 15000 LKR/$50/£39. This would have been tolerable had the seatbelts in the car worked. Not a good position to be in given some of the drivers in Colombo. 
They rely on the difficulty that non Sinhalese/Tamil speakers would have in pre-arranging reliable, sensible transfers themselves.
title: Nothing to write home about.

Nice room, well fitted. Really delightful. 
The name Marino Beach is a little misleading as you are not on a beach. It faces a road, railway track and rocks. It is a 10 minute drive to the one per hour shuttle. Our room was right at the end of a passage, floor 3. I think this was one of the  worst rooms here. We overlooked a construction site. The balcony was very exposed, all balconies in a row. I went outside and the balcony door locked behind me. Thankfully my husband was still in the room. No idea what we would have done otherwise. The adjacent shopping centre was unremarkable but worth a wander. 
The buffets - dinner and breakfast were both very good. We were one of the first for dinner, drinks order taken but not delivered until after our meal. A lot of the wait staff didn’t seem to know what to do…maybe more training?  
So overall ok but disappointing.

placeInfo/address: 590 Marine Drive, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Bring a 1st aid kit; my sister in law fell down a drain on the street at night and the hotel could offer no assistance whatsoever.
text:
We really liked the 10th floor or rooftop level. This has a lovely pool, a bar (the waiter Anura was very friendly), a garden area with jacuzzi’s and sun loungers.
We found the staff friendly and helpful, especially waiters Ramesh, Prasadh and Thushara.
However I am only giving a rating of 3 stars because the rest of the hotel was not very good; the lifts are a headache, the food is unremarkable (which is amazing when you consider that Sri Lankan food is so excellent!), the bathrooms had a small step into them designed to break a toe, and the toilet itself had a needless glass door which could easily lead to a comedic accident. Also, the bedrooms need better soundproofing.

But I should add that the hotel did include a free tour of the sights of Colombo, which my wife and sister in law enjoyed immensely!
title: No first aid available

text: My first stay was in December 2021 and was very pleasant. The duty manager even kindly upgraded my room as well. However, my stay in December 2022 was not very pleasant as there was construction ( heavy drilling at the upper floors) going on and I couldn’t stay in the room during the daytime in regard. I complained during checked out and hope my thoughts were taken into consideration for future guests. Despite my subpar experience last visit, I still like this hotel so much and I will consider booking again in the future.

placeInfo/address: 590 Marine Drive, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
I'm a regular customer of this hotel since it was built. The location is great as it has all facilities which helps me and sometimes my family too. But when an issue arise even i speak to the higher authorities nothing has been done or feedback hasn't been given. The Operators get all the blame as i personally know it's not the case. 
The lobby has so many different mangers but not a GM. I also felt there's no team work among them. I genuinely hope who ever has invested in this beautiful hotel need to address people like me already in management role in London. I have given constant support last 4yrs to address issues. Without a good management team no business will survive long term especially considering SriLankan government management issues.
The staff needs professional skills to address issues in the restaurant too. I was surprised to hear from the restaurant manager next day a serious complaint was not being log in from another frustrated customer as I had to interfere to calm the customer down. I agree the customer had all the right to get upset as he was insulted by member of a staffs 2days in a row. 
Hope my feedback will be addressed and respected not ignored by the higher management team e.g.assstant G.M. and CEO.
MR.Prasanna whom I have met and spoken to.
title: Needs improvement on professional skills

Lasith) about late check out but they refused to give even though they failed to give us the room on time . Totally disappointed.

placeInfo/address: 590 Marine Drive, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
I spent a week with my family at this hotel for a leisure trip.

Advantages:
Very friendly staff
Very clean hotel
Attached to a nice shopping mall that could provide some entertainment especially for kids
Rooms are spacious and modern
They have very nice jacuzzies at the roof

Disadvantages:

The hotel needs a facelift as it does not look as luxurious as the photos that hotel's management posted. I am comparing it to other hotel like Cinnamon, for example.
The breakfast is varied, but of not a very good quality especially the coffee and tea they are offering; the coffee they offer is made using a cheap machine.
The hotel is not a walking distance from the center of Colombo; you must take a tuk-tuk
The shuttle service they offer is very expensive
The swimming pool is not heated
title: A good hotel, but there is room for improvement

placeInfo/address: Mahamudali Mawatha, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: We booked Jetwing Kurulubedda in order to celebrate our wedding anniversary, we traveled during Feb 2019. The staff was very pleasant and they give a very good service to the guests. We booked one of the Villa's with the plunge pool which was expensive than the normal rooms. The plunge pool was located downstairs of the room, which lacks privacy as it is not covered and anyone walking by can have a peek at the pool. The plunge pool as many guests have complained was not pleasing and it required cleaning as well as IMMEDIATE maintenance. The pool requires heaters as the water is too cold to get in most of the time, so we could not use the pool. Even the main pool lacked cleanliness and required immediate cleaning. There was a mini fridge inside the room which was not cleaned for years I guess, it was a very old fridge and it had patches with required to be cleaned. We were given the option to use a boat ride to go to the Jetwing Lighthouse which was nearby for the buffet. However, the food at the Lighthouse was below standard. Frankly, for the price they charge us it is not worth with the provided accommodation.
title: Relaxing Place, Friendly Staff, Needs Maintenance!

placeInfo/address: Mahamudali Mawatha, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Chalets with plunge pool offer better privacy. However, the rest have better views of paddy field, pool, and the mangrove.
text:
Revisited this wonderful property after 2 years as we loved the way it blended with nature. 
The new chalets and the swimming pool are quite attractive but unfortunately many things were missing. With new establishments, the foresty feeling you get at this location has disappeared to a greater extent. 
On top of that, the service you get for the price you pay is way below the average. Would you expect an EMPTY MINI BAR with NO Wi-Fi in rooms, in a luxury property like this...? Especially for the price you pay...? Being a privileged member of the 'Aradhana' club, it's so disappointing to mention our experience at a Jetwing hotel in this manner....  However, the failures continued with NO HOT WATER until late night during our first day.
The menus are very limited here. They were better with more options during our previous stay. The food tasty and quality also not up to the standards. Once we complained the staff on POOR QUALITY OF FOOD with visible evidence on a dish served. Meal preparation time was over 1 hour on all occasions even for a Club Sandwich, other than the breakfast ordered previous night. However, thanks for larger portions offered. For meals, the in-house staff always encourage the guests to go to their sister hotel 'Light House' at our own cost, which is about 1Km away. They didn't even have cakes or cookies in-house for an evening tea. The chef had to rush to 'Lighthouse' to cater our need.  
The property seems like neglected by the management as there were just the chef and a service person during our 2 nights of stay, other than the person introduced himself as the 'Chief Butler' who was there for few hours on the day we arrived.
The Check-in & Check-out chaos remain the same from our previous visit as we were advised to go to 'Light House' hotel on both occasions. 
The courteous and flexible service offered by the helpful staff in these conditions should be appreciated. I still love this wonderful set of chalets hidden in a mangrove but the services and facilities issues must be addressed by the management without disappointing guests any further.
Highly recommended for couples. Families with kids, better avoid.
title: Relaxing Paradise let down by Poor Management

placeInfo/address: Mahamudali Mawatha, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
This small boutique hotel is located in Galle quite close to Jetwing Lighthouse. We took the complementary boat ride to Kurulubaddha which was a nice experience. My husband and I stayed 2 nights and while we found the service good and the staff pleasant we felt the hotel itself was rather a let down. 

First of all there are homes situated quite close to the villas and you can hear loud noises and people speaking/shouting which is quite a nuisance. The neighboring homes were burning garbage and we could smell the smoke from our room!!! Secondly our room AC sensor was disfunctional and we couldnt regulate the temperature. It was stuck at 20 degrees which was quite cold for us. Even though the staff tried to fix it we were told that the part needed to be replaced. To be fair they did offer us another villa on the second night but we were too lazy to move by then. The  villa was comfortable if a little under maintained. 

Having said that we must say the food served was well prepared and the staff very courteous and friendly. They took good care of us. 

So all in all this holiday wasnt quite what we hoped for which was disappointing since we had been looking forward to this since seening all the photos on the Jetwing site! 

We give this property 3 stars since we compare it to other Jetwing properties we've been to and found this place wanting.
title: Good service...not so great location

placeInfo/address: Mahamudali Mawatha, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: request a room in upper floor
text: This is a small boutique hotel located near jetwing lighthouse ... we checked in to the hotel at jetwing lighthouse ..they offer complementary boat ride to kurulubaddha from lighthouse .. we stay there only for one day in villa 5 which is located in the ground floor.. rooms are not sound proof ..you can listen to your noisy neighbors .you can choose continental(which is not up to stranded ) or srilankan breakfast ..

Ayubowan
 
 
Priyanthika Wijenaike
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Mahamudali Mawatha, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
After seeing the beautiful photos on their website I have been wanting to go to kurulubedda forever. Finally was able to make it with my husband and boy was it a disappointment! We made the booking via the official hotel website. As the villas with the plunge pool were already booked on the 2nd day we opted to staying in the villa on our 1st day and the normal room on our 2nd day. Apart from the payment confirmation email received no other correspondence from the hotel. My husband and I drove straight to the hotel and noticed that the staff were surprised to see us "drive" straight to the location. They asked us if we went to jetwing lighthouse, we said no and the staff said generally check in happens at lighthouse and that after checking in the guests are brought to kurulubedda by boat. We were so upset and sad at hearing that we had missed such a lovely opportunity that I kept checking my email over and over wondering if I had missed a mail with all this info. Even checked back their website but no such thing is mentioned. I think the reservation team should do a better job of keeping their valued guests informed.
Apart from that the staff was very accommodating and checked us in with no fuss.
Villa with the pool was just like the pictures and so was the normal room. In Fact normal room was better than expected. 
Ambience of the hotel was ok and sadly had experienced all of their in-house crop to die off due to the hotel pool. Land area of the hotel is very small but the overall concept is good if only in a bigger area. Dinesh and the staff were lovely and the food was ok. Nothing much to do or see in the premises itself.
We were very excited by the plunge pool in the villa and couldn't wait to try it out. As it was located below the villa my husband took an extra precaution of locking our room while we were at the plunge pool. Once done with the pool and my husband tried to open the door the key broke inside the lock. It was such an instantaneous thing that we both were shocked. It was not like he had tried to unlock it with such force and my husband is not the Hulk! And the door was still locked. Now wondering what to do and cold and shivering after the pool we were able to get the attention of the staff to help us back to the room. Anyway it took awhile but we managed to get back in the room and the staff were very jovial about it.
Next day to check out we were told we need to head to Lighthouse. Upon closer inspection of the checkout receipt I noticed a clause called damages. And it mentioned a lost key. And they had charged 5000 LKR. Double the shock! I immediately knew this was due to our little incident and I was very upset. It was not like we purposely did something to the key! Not wanting to cause a scene I quietly paid my dues and left. Overall I am very unhappy and disappointed with my kurulubedda experience.
title: Disappointment

placeInfo/address: Mahamudali Mawatha, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Villa 2 is further away from the entrance and construction site.
text:
Having read some of the reviews published here, i was a little apprehensive but went ahead with our stay at this property. The check-in at Jetwing Lighthouse was actually quite painless and turned out that Kurulubedda is only a 5 minute drive from the Lighthouse hotel. 
As described by earlier guests, parking is at your risk at a neighbour's house and the entrance is cluttered a little by construction work at present. However, it does not obstruct guests if they do watch where they step! We were ushered into Villa 2 which is a little away from the entrance by helpful staff and pretty must left to ourselves the whole time. 
The room is not very large but comfortable and make sure to use the nets supplied both in the room and on the deck. Take insect repellent but just be open to the fact that your in lush green surroundings which would obviously mean some insects like mosquitoes would be there. Personally we were not so bothered about it.
The bathrooms are spacious. We noticed however that the wooden sink area needed some maintenance as did some of the floorboards. 
Had a dip in the plunge pool which was a little cold and thought they could have thought about the little things such as some flowers or candle light by the ledge just to make it inviting. 
The close proximity to Galle town meant that we could take a short drive to the fort or Unawatuna any time we wished to. We travelled as a couple and would not recommend the property for very small kids given the deck is high up, stairways etc.
Did not have meals at this property,instead we opted for the breakfast buffet at the Lighthouse hotel.
We noticed that the construction would expand the property and they were also building the rooms to overlook paddy fields, no doubt it would be lovely when completed. You would probably need to re-look at expanding on parking options as well as the continuous upkeep of the property. Would recommend this if your a nature buff!
title: The perfect hideaway - some maintenance needed.

It was my pleasure meeting you in the evening prior to your departure, on your last night and hope you had a safe journey back. I only wished that you had brought this up in our conversation and I would have looked in to it and discussed it with you both immediately as normally we only get very positive feedback from guests that stay in Jetwing Kurulubedda.

I would like to apologize again for your bad experience and I hope to speak to you soon.

Sincerely,
Robert Claesson
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Mahamudali Mawatha, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Such a disappointment to have to write this note. We were really looking forward to the Kurulubedda experience and we paid good money for it. It was our first wedding anniversary and from the photos we saw on the Kurulubedda website we were intrigued by the set up.

The mangrove forest, the elevated wooden walkway, and individual splash pool with each hut, seemed and actually are a true plus for this property.

Only to discover after our arrival that one of the staff was a true privacy invader. The guy who is employed as a chef, acted as our personal bodyguard, luggage porter, and a 24 on 7 security officer with us.
 
He kept following us around. The minute we set foot out of the bedroom there was no way he could leave us alone to enjoy the surroundings. The cherry on the cake was when at one point he instructed us to go and have dinner at the Jetwing Lighthouse "and then come back here!". Is this Alcatraz? He pushed himself too much and at many points he would stop infront of us staring in our eyes waiting for that extra tip. 

Before going to dinner at the Lighthouse he told us that his shift was about to end. When asking whether he could provide us with a torch to find our way back, he put our mind to rest by saying that the security guard at the entrance of Kurulubedda will be ushering us back to our villa.
But to our astonishment when we arrived back close to 11pm he rushed to our aid. Not wearing the work uniform and smelling of alcohol he insisted with the other staff that he wanted to take us to our room. For the 4th time in a span of few hours he expected another tip.

We were supposed to spend 2 nights here but after a series of other mishaps we cancelled the last night. After complaing with the General Manager he offered a honeymoon suite at the Jetwing Lighthouse. The behaviour of the chef was promptly addressed and the worker came to apologise before our departure.

A few notes worth mentioning about the Kurulubedda.

1. There is no signage promoting this property. Our Sri Lankan guide/driver had to stop several times to finally find this place. The property does not even have a name plate on the facade.

2. We were shocked in finding that the cleaning upon our arrival was not done properly, at least in the bathroom. In one of the drawers in the wardrobe situated in the bathroom we found a black lacy underwear surrounded by a shower of gecko droppings. Showed the photos to the General Manager who apologised and pleaded us not to put the photos online. 

3. The Kurulubedda property consists of only  2 villas. No internet, despite being advertised on booking.com that internet was included. We were never given a proper explanation of how the Kurulubedda works. In reality, one can either have breakfast and dinner in this property or else go to the Jetwing Lighthouse and enjoy all the buffet services, pool area etc free of charge. Transport to and fro the 2 properties is also provided free of charge by the company.

4. Many mosquitos around at the Kurulubedda. This is to be expected considering that the property is right next to a river. So be prepared and take all necessary measures. Gladly bedrooms are properly sealed with adequate pvc sheets and nice curtains. But this detail is somehow missing from the bathroom. Insects, mosquitos and geckos are free to roam. And if you forget to close the bathroom door, embrace yourself to a mosquito invasion.

5. On the second day the airconditioning was not working, actually emitting heat in the soaring temperatures.  After this episode, we insisted that we wanted to move out and go to the Jetwing Lighthouse. The General Manager was very understanding and knowing all the background to the previous events, offered his apology and a quick solution. This is a true example of how customer relations work. Well done, and thanks for this.

All in all I strongly believe that Kurulubedda has the potential of a true lovely experience should the little obvious hurdles be addressed.
title: Unique place but TERRIBLE experience
