text:
I went at the end of the winter season so I got no wind. Place and food were good, people onsite very customer oriented but people actually selling quite slow and unfriendly, little customer sense.
If no wind no much one can do there.
title: Low season and slow response

ownerResponse/text:
Hey, 

Thanks for the honest feedback. I will make it a point to personally ensure that we learn from this and get some more Lankan food on the table :) 

Dil
placeInfo/address: Dutch Bay Road Kudawa Road, Kalpitiya 61360 Sri Lanka
text:
Kite Lanka was awesome. Love the rustic setting, strong environmental theme, staff and of course the lagoon and kiteboarding. But pretty disappointed in the food.

As a vegetarian and expecting Sri Lankan food every night I only ever had my fave dahl and coconut sambal one night :( The rest of a mix of pretty basic western food every night ... salad bar, mashed potato and plain pasta.

Wish they could do Sri Lankan vegetarian dishes every night and keep it more authentic (like the resort). Love to see Dahl, Coconut Sambal and Kota Mollung for vegetarians. How about a tandoori oven and do rotis and pratah ! Would kill it !!!

Please ... I wanna come back
title: Bones

ownerResponse/text:
Hey, 

Thanks for all your feedback. I think it was a bit unfortunate as the entire place was busy and the last remaining would have been this garden view 'villa' room which is ideally for a family who needs 2 rooms. 

I am sorry that that office didnt find you a solution :( 

Regarding the hot water - in the future we hope all rooms will have warm water. The beach and the entire country is a mess due to pollution. We have made it a point to be a zero plastic hotel - in fact going a step further and focusing on Sustainability as well. 

I hope you do come again and I can assure you not just a room but show you the work we are doing regarding sustainability and making the world a cleaner and better place ;) 

Dil
placeInfo/address: Dutch Bay Road Kudawa Road, Kalpitiya 61360 Sri Lanka
text:
I spent around 7 days with friends in this hotel. The public places are beautiful, clean, and the stuff is incredible friendly! The food was healthy and delicious, the massages wonderful as well as the yoga classes in the deck facing the sunset.

The only con was that, even though I have paid a bit extra to have a private room, I got the ugliest room comparing to all my friends. I didn't even have a chair to put my clothes, and I was looking so forward to have an open air bathroom, which I didn't get, while all my friends did. This was the garden view room, which was directly connected to another room, so I had to share the porch with the neighbors, which was quite noisy if the neighbors stayed late. I asked twice to be changed to another room, and they promised that they would do that as soon as other guests would leave, however, they changed my neighbors but not me, which was very disappointing and I felt that they never cared about my requests.

Another con is that the room had cold water. It was very difficult and not so nice to have a shower in the morning or in the evening, as the water was quite chilly. Apparently, you need to book a superior room in order to have warm water.

And finally, the beach was extremely dirty. Bottles, plastic, fishing nets, ropes, dead fishes, clothes, etc decorated the beach in front of the hotel, which made me not wanting to touch the water at all. Pity as the water was nice, but the surroundings were not inviting at all.

However, all in all, I really liked my experience thanks to the wonderful staff, food and public places, but it was disappointing because of the dirty beach and the dark and ugly room received spite of my requests to be changed.
title: Nice, friendly hotel with good food, but with some issues

ownerResponse/text:
Thanks for the review. I dont think KSL might appeal to all clients. We do offer something unique, homely and definitely not a posh 5 star setup. We do offer a rustic, family like experience. We focus on sustainability to a big extent - most of which the programmes you dont see (maybe I need to make things in this regard more visible). 

In terms of the spot, we have Vella, Donkey, Puttalam, Kalpallady and the downwinder from Thalawila to KSL in the Summer. 

In Winter we have the flat water lagoon IN FRONT of KSL along with the beach. 

Either way depending on the season conditions change. 

But again, we understand that we cannot please everyone and the unique experience might not appeal to all :)

But stoked that you still enjoyed your stay. 

Dil
placeInfo/address: Dutch Bay Road Kudawa Road, Kalpitiya 61360 Sri Lanka
text:
I have mixed feelings about this place but unfortunately our experience was a disappointing. I don't like writing bad reviews but I look in TripAdvisor before booking my trip there and I wish someone would have told me all that.

I've been in other kitesurf camp and I wouldn't describe this one as a kite paradise. This is why:

- The lagoon isn't close to the camp. You have to do 10 minutes truck drive and there is only 1 trip on the morning, one to go and come back from lunch and one to go back to the camp at 5pm. That's mean it really feels like we have to respect a time table. You can also go there by tuck tuck but have to pay extra.

- The water of the lagoon isn't flat at all and very dark. The place is a bit crowed and it tends to get a bit boring to ride there if you are not learning or focusing on jumping. If you like flat and transparent blue water don't go there!

- The kitesurf trip proposed on the website don't really exist. Only Vela but it's only
2 days and 90€ per person. We asked for the day trips they proposed but everyone was giving us different answers and telling us wasn't really possible.

- The staff is nice but we, and other guests we talk to, felt a bit like if there we treating you more like friends than clients. The organization is quit messy and for the price we pay we can't feel than the staff is really there to please you. 

- We also felt than they were trying to get money from clients for as much things as they could and it didn't feel really nice.

- The food wasn't too good. Wasn't bad but nothing crazy. There is little choice and it feel like at school, they ring the bell and everybody
comes to serves themselves.

The good things:

- The camp itself is really nice. Very well taking care of and the bar as such a great atmosphere. It was probably the best part of the camp and the bar tenders were really nice. 

- The bungalow was nice, simple but clean and the bathroom was really beautiful.

- The downwind trip to Vela was really great.

90% of the people we met at the camp were from Europe so maybe the "excellent" reviews come from people who only kite there and haven't travel much because I think than if you compare that place with other "kitesurf paradise" it's pretty far from it. If you are in Sri Lanka for other things than kiting and just spend few days there it's ok but I wouldn't advise to come there to kite only during a week.
title: Overrated

ownerResponse/text:
Hi, 

Sorry to hear about your experience. I am trying to understand why your weren't aware that we preferred cash payment, its on our very first e mail communication. Bank transfer fee is beyond our control, banking from Europe to Sri Lanka has a high fee, usually from the sending parties bank. 

I have no idea who you are still, maybe mail us?

We even do an estimate to make life easier for guest on request. 

Our trucks do leave on time each time and as much as we like all to go on the first round to the lagoon, we cannot delay 20 others because you got late. 

We do ofcourse arrange tuk tuk's to take you at any other times, or a downwinder to the kite lagoon is also possible :) 

Oh well, perhaps we cannot please all. Sorry your not one of them. 

Dil
placeInfo/address: Dutch Bay Road Kudawa Road, Kalpitiya 61360 Sri Lanka
text:
Hard to tell but I have a mitigated feeling. It could be great but it does not make you an unforgettable experience. I have done many camps and this one is the on I like least.
Some individuals working there are great, the masseuse is the best I ever had, but I had the bad feeling of being a cash cow.

As a matter of fact they only take cash, which is unacceptable, or transfers at prohibiting rates.

Truck to go to the kite spot is not flexible on timing even if it was the first day of wind.

Food is average.

Will not get back there. I have done way better in kalpitiya.
title: Will not go back there

ownerResponse/text:
Hey, great to have you review our place. Just to add our side of the story to your points; 

1. Food, point taken, Sri Lankan food infused for all lunch time meals since 1st week January onwards 2016.  We might have 2 Sri Lankan nights a week for dinner but on the rest have more options for Sri Lankan side dishes. 

2. Our main season is from May to October & Mid December to End February. For the rest its true that we dont have large sizes (Max we use is 14M, we are a bit spoilt that we dont go kiting in lighter conditions). On all e mails, if the are coming in a low season we mention about the kites and sizes we have - in fact we sometimes advice not to come in our low months if its just for kite. 

I think you use the old Core 17 - the only 17. Sorry if it was not in good shape. We didnt want to be unfair by charging you for repair :) We want you to enjoy Kitesurfing. Maybe for the next season we will buy a few more 17/19M.

3. Tents dont leak, we have a roof above them. 

Dil
placeInfo/address: Dutch Bay Road Kudawa Road, Kalpitiya 61360 Sri Lanka
roomTip: I recommend the lagoon bungalows
text:
Pro:
- Awesome and extremely friendly and helpful staff
- Location: Only a walkable lagoon away from the beach
- Campstyle: The whole resort was basically a big outside area, the dinning was great and leading people to interact
- close to kite lagoon and downwinder directly to hotel is possible
- water and tea available the whole day for free

In between:
- Food: If there is Sri Lankan food it's excellent (not spicy). Unfortuately, there was only every third day one meal Sri Lankan food... 

Con:
- Rental at kite school: There's not enough kites of the sizes in low wind conditions, material is old (my bar broke without hard impact (I did not have to pay for it though)), some kites were very very old and not in good conditions any more
- Tents are not suitable for rainy weather conditions
title: I would go again, but...

ownerResponse/text:
Hi, 

Thanks for taking time for the review.

KSL is rustic, its a functional, no frills place and certainly not a big concrete structure with air conditioning to keep the place cool. So yes, we probably didn't appeal to you too much as we didn't have the frills you expected. 

The majority of the guest do however love this concept hence the reviews. 

For those reading this review, we have many staff who earn a decent pay, get their pensions schemes sorted out by us, all taxes are paid, licenses to sell beers, community cared for. These all cost and our pricing takes into account all these things. 

Dil
placeInfo/address: Dutch Bay Road Kudawa Road, Kalpitiya 61360 Sri Lanka
text:
a nice place indeed, but nothing outstanding. 

the rooms and tents are basic and for that quite expensive. 

there are dozens of similar kitsurfing places at the same beach that do not get a fraction of the tripadvisor coverage. 

we moved on to a beach hotel in walking distance whose ratings are not nearly as good, but that does offer much better value for the same amount of money. one starts to wonder where all these rave ratings are coming from...
title: price does not match quality

ownerResponse/text:
Hi, 

Thanks for the review. 

We have two reviews in the same period - September concerning the staff on the beach and instructors. 

We are having a meeting tomorrow to address this. 

I must admit, our Kiteschool Manager Anthony had to leave early in the season and we had a backup but this is no excuse. So once again sorry and if its any consolation I will be addressing this  tomorrow.  

The beach staff are key to ensure you have a good experience while kitesurfing and we have 5 of them there so they must assist at all times. 

Sorry once again, we will improve this. 

Dil
placeInfo/address: Dutch Bay Road Kudawa Road, Kalpitiya 61360 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Ask for a bugalow far from the beach bar. We had the bungalow lagoon 1 (don't take this one), it was noisy on the evening.
text:
It is definitely a very nice camp. Our lagoon bungalow was simple (in the good way) and really nice. There is a lot of attention to the details everywhere. Big thanks to Tequiri who welcomed us very well and to Hamid who has been really nice during the kite instruction with my wife. 

Surprisingly the issues are on the kite lessons and the Beach staff. We maybe had bad luck on the period but the staff was not supportive. The other instructors and staff were looking at every drop of the wind to cancel the lessons and push people to go back to the camp. It was really really clear that they didn’t want to be there !! The beach boys were pushing everyone to go back at the hotel. When you travel there for few days, you don’t want to be lock in the hotel all your afternoon just because the staff and instructors wants their afternoon off. The small drops of the wind looked like the perfect excuse – we spent our week to negotiate with the staff to have a kite lesson (for my wife) and to stay on the lagoon (for me as a kiter). It is not normal, the light wind was the excuse but definitely not the reason. 
And the camp has a staff of “beach boys” supposed to help people during the lessons. They were on complete vacation and didn’t want to put a foot in the water. Number of beginners on the camp were really complaining on that attitude from the staff. You could not expect the boat or a rescue if the manager was not forcing them to go (and the manager was not always around unfortunately). They were just looking at the students dragged in the middle of the lagoon and doing desperate and useless signs to be rescued - but they were not moving at all …  

In conclusion, it is a very nice camp and we were just a disappointed by the laziness and careless of the staff on the beach (except rare exceptions as Hamid). We had a nice stay but I am not sure we would come back or we would recommend it for those reasons.
title: Nice camp but average experience

ownerResponse/text:
Hey Marc, thanks for taking time to write a review. 

For the benefit of the readers; 

Its a full board price which includes all meals, tea/coffee around the clock and free use of a lot of stuff like bicycle, kayaks, sup, transport to lagoon, internet, uninterrupted power, rescue boats for kiters etc etc.

Food wise: We try to mix it around with Western and Local.  We do have an Ala Carte menu if you want to order spicy as well. 

Marc however correctly sums its up Kitesurfing Lanka is not a backpacker place. I presume he already knew this when we made the inquiry but still wanted to stay with us :)
placeInfo/address: Dutch Bay Road Kudawa Road, Kalpitiya 61360 Sri Lanka
roomTip: dont go for the tent closest to the bar if you want an early night
text:
We stayed for 3 nights in January... it was the first few nights of our trip and we were so excited when we finally arrived after a very long journey from the airport (im talking 3 buses and a 40km tuk tuk ride, 6 hrs in total!!)
There are many many good things to say about this place but to be honest it just wasnt what we were looking for, let me start with the positives:
- Dil and his team are great.. the staff and polite, hardworking and attentive
- The resort area looked very beautiful, palm trees dotted around, thatched cabanas, pretty flowers everywhere etc.
- The dolphin trip we will remember FOREVER! Forget spotting 3-4 of them as with most so called 'dolphin trips' , we must have seen at least 500-600 of them leaping out of the water in their pods.. just wonderful
- Very family friendly
- Seems to be trying hard to be genuinely eco-friendly and low impact which is great to see
- We did a scuba diving course with Beatriz from the local 'Epic encounters' dive school and it was a fantastic experience 

BUT....... this resort will not give you a taste of the real Sri Lanka

- We were in Sri Lanka as backpackers; interested in meeting local people, tasting real local food and experiencing the different, unique and wonderful things Sri Lanka has to offer. After arriving we quickly realized that the other clientele we basically all Russian, British or Aussie and were mostly interested in meeting other westerners and drinking at the bar in the evenings... not to say theres anything wrong with that.. but its just not what we were in Sri Lanka to do! In fact we were in the country to get away from being surrounded by loud westerners! :) 
- We found the food not particularly inspiring - it is served as a buffet style, and it has to be said there wasnt a lot of choice for vegetarians (my girlfriend is a veggie and she was disappointed by the meals)  We were hoping for some spice and some local curry dishes, however we were frequently disappointed as it was often basic western fair... chips / chicken / spaghetti bolognaise etc... which we found very un-exciting!!!
Granted its not easy for them to keep everyone happy considering there were familys there with young kids that probably wouldnt have enjoyed the spicy local cuisine

In fact one of the most enjoyable experiences during our stay was riding bicycles up to the main road and eating in a tiny local Kottu Roti shack where we made friends with the lovely guys working there who were so happy and appreciative for us stopping by for dinner (which cost 400R for both of us... under €3)

Finally I have to say that in our opinion Kitesurfing Lanka does not represent particularly great value for money.. we spent 3 weeks in the country travelling to many places staying in many cabanas, small hotels, guesthouses etc. where you can expect to pay 2500R-6000R per night for a double room (about €20-40) , however at Kitesurfing Lanka we paid €35 EACH per night to stay in a TENT with a thin camper mat for a bed
We paid full board and admittedly that was partly our fault for not changing to a cheaper option but the fact is, for the price of one night staying in a tent you can stay in a reasonable guesthouse with a/c for 4-5 days in the rest of the country!

To conclude.. Kitesurfing Lanka is a good resort and Im sure will be great for many people (particularly families and middle aged couples) but if you are a young independent type traveler who wants a genuine sri lankan experience, you might want to think again
title: Great for some, may not work for all types of traveller

ownerResponse/text:
Hey, 

Thanks for the candid review. 

Leo and I are indeed Kitesurfers and really enjoy running the business. Being Kitesurfers (and I must add those who studied business and hospitality), we came up with the concept of KSL and our offering which we clearly have stated on our website and e mail correspondence.

PRICE
This is what I see is the area you felt was a big negative of your stay. For those who do not know the background, Prices/ Pictures are also stated on the website and in our e mail correspondence so there are no surprises to our guests. 

Based on your review about price, I would like to state the following; 

1. The price includes all meals (Full Board, unlimited food). Tea/ Coffee and distilled water are available around the clock and is also included in the price. Meal includes Soups, Salads, Meat Items, Desserts. Price has been communicated to you prior.
2. You would not have ever experience power failures/ power cuts as we have a huge generator to ensure that the KSL camp has electricity 24/7. Not sure if others have it like this.
3. Free Internet.
4. Free transport to the lagoon. We have given guests the flexibility that if they want to go/return earlier/later for whatever reason, they simply let us know and we will work something out.
5. Use of a beach hut complete with Chairs, Hammocks, Drinks. 
6. Safety boat and staff on the beach to assist the KSL guests.
7. The only school to have emergency gear - spinals boards etc 

For the meals, we infuse Sri Lankan food approximately 2 times a week for lunch and 2 times a week for dinner. We have a professional Chef and we like to mix the menus around. We cater to kiters from all over the world. Sorry the food was not as spicy as you wished, maybe next time we do a dish for you a bit more spicy - all you had to do was request or state on the booking form when we ask for meal preferences that you prefer spicy food. 

All in all, your feedback is taken positively and we will look into how we can improve our value proposition to you. 

Hope to see you again.

Cheers,

Dilsiri Welikala
placeInfo/address: Dutch Bay Road Kudawa Road, Kalpitiya 61360 Sri Lanka
text:
My partner and I stayed here for three nights in a tent.  The first night in a tent was great but the novelty quickly wore out particularly based on the 70 Euro we were paying a night.  The food was good but there was no local dishes as we were told the guests didn't enjoy the local spicy food.  While we enjoyed our stay, we felt KSL had a hostel vibe targeted for the French that could have been anywhere in the world, you didn't feel like you were in Sri Lanka.  In addition KSL seemed to be run by the kite instructors and while the kiting facilities and activities were excellent, it was evident the actual running of the accommodation could be improved.  As for kiting the big lagoon is great for beginners as there is so much space however the wind can be quite gusty at times, the water is also brown so if you are looking for blue water you will need to pay for an island trip.
We moved to Kappalady Kitegarden after our stay here and much rather preferred our time at Kitegarden, although the kiting services provided at KSL were much better for beginners.

Pros
Nice facilities - hammocks and bean bags to relax
Excellent kiting facilities - kite repair shop
Good for beginners or those looking to learn to kite 

Cons
Shared bathroom for tents weren't great
Have to take a truck to the lagoon (morning and afternoon) so you are locked into a time if you want to kite.  You have the option to kite on the beach near KSL but you need to be experienced
Overpriced

Overall
While the facilities were great the actual accommodation was not worth the price.  If I had friends who needed to learn to kitesurf I would check in here for a few nights and do the island trip while they learnt.  Once they had the basics I would then be moving on to something that provided better value and freedom to kite
title: Kitesurfers trying to run a camp

ownerResponse/text:
Hey,

Few things to clear up; 

1. You arrived in February: The wind is perfect in the ocean which is right in front of our camp. You can simply walk out of the bungalow and kite :) . We are 15 minutes away from the flat water teaching lagoon - but we do provide free transport.

Sorry if you didnt sleep at night - I am sure it was a once off day where everyone in our camp wanted to socialize and got a bit loud. But your feedback is taken. 

Do come back and see the improvements yourself. If you are not happy this happy - I'd be more than happy to give you a refund :) 

:) 

Dil

Upon receiving your complaint, we immediately conducted a thorough investigation by reviewing the CCTV footage and questioning our Housekeeping staff. After careful examination, we found no evidence of any wrongdoing, and I want to assure you that all our staff members have been with us for over four years without any involvement in any incident of this nature. We also communicated the details of our investigation to your travel agent, ensuring transparency in addressing this issue. To further prevent such incidents, we have taken immediate action by replacing the batteries in all the safe lockers throughout the hotel.

placeInfo/address: Elkaduwa Road Meenawatte Estate, Kandy, Wattegama 20000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Simpson's Forest - Luxury Boutique Resort & Spa
roomTip: Attention aux vols dans cet hôtel, on se demande si le mauvais fonctionnement des security-boxes n'est pas organisé ...
text:
Nous avons séjourné dans cet hôtel pendant 2 nuits les 10 et 11 novembre 2024. L'hôtel est situé au milieu des plantations de thé et les chambres sont spacieuses et confortables rien à dire à ce sujet.
Le 10 novembre nous nous sommes installés tardivement dans nos chambres et nous avons constaté que les security-boxes ne fonctionnaient pas. Vu la qualité de l'hôtel et la confiance inspirée nous n'avons pas sollicité la réception à ce sujet et nous sommes allés diner en laissant nos affaires dans les chambres avec nos documents et argent dans nos sacs de voyage. Au retour du dîner nous avons constaté qu'une personne de l'hôtel était entrée dans nos chambres  pour préparer la literie. 
Au moment de régler notre facture (repas...) le lendemain nous avons constaté qu'il nous manquait de l'argent (Euros et LKR) dans nos portefeuilles. Aprés concertation avec mes amis et aucune dépense effectuée durant notre séjour à l'extérieur, nous avons malheureusement conclu que nous avions été victimes d'un vol assez conséquent. Le manager contacté  a pu constater  que les security-boxes ne fonctionnaient pas. Il s'est engagé à chercher le(s) coupable(s) évidemment sans succès...face à cette situation j'ai refusé de régler une partie des consommations du mini-bar.
En conclusion, si vous allez dans cet hôtel soyez très prudents et méfiez vous des sourires mielleux....
title: Séjour dans un lieu agréable gâché par un vol d'argent

text:
We stayed in this hotel with some friends and it was good. hotel location is beautiful and staff is trying to help in everyday. we got the bungalow of them and its beautiful and nice , however the biggest drawback is  that they have their common pool near the bungalow and it is very hard to have a good private stay with the day outing crowds. title: Good location and a property

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: No swimming pool.  Not recommended for elderly or disabled travellers.
text:
We stayed two nights at this hotel booked by Trailfinders.  On arrival late evening, the reception staff was one!  Although all staff were friendly, the accommodation is not suitable for disabled or elderly visitors.  It has no lift and stairs can be daunting for weak knees.  Our room was superior on the second floor.  It was cramped after opening suitcases.  We complained and we were moved to a more spacious room on first floor which was good.

The restaurant food (we ordered pizza) was good; but the breakfast is very poor and basic.  The choice was non-existence and being vegetarian we were limited to toasts!!!

Although located in the Fort area; in the vicinity of all places, there are certainly more pleasant hotels to choose from.  I would say this is a 2/3 * accommodation.
title: Our rating average, certainly not 4*

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don't fall for the lobster scam.
text: We enjoyed the hotel and the location can't be beat. We had two really great breakfasts there.  I didn't leave a higher rating  because of a bad experience we had at dinner. I had ordered a lobster and a waiter came out and told me that there was only one lobster. Left in the entire hotel, let's see would be willing to cut it in half for me. He told me that the remaining lobster was way too large for me to possibly eat by myself because it was 500 grams.  I agreed to half the lobster and was quite surprised when the dish came out, and it was the entire half of a lobster with three bites of tail meat. 99% shell. But they proceeded to charge me $55 for the entire lobster after insisting there was no way I could eat an entire lobster.  After only serving me half of it. I think it was a total scam. Someone else decided what I couldn't couldn't eat, and I had no idea how large 500 hundred grams might be. If I knew I was going to be charged for an entire lobster, I would have taken the whole thing, regardless of whether I could have eaten or not.But I certainly could have had six instead of three bites.
title: Great location and charming yet moderned.

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Make sure you are in a room at the front of the hotel away from the kitchen
text: The hotel is an old colonial building in the centre of Galle Fort, the rooms are well appointed and facilities reasonable. Half of the reception area seems to be given over to a jewellery store. There is a pleasant court yard to have breakfast and  drink. Now here is the big problem behind the hotel there is a building site and another hotel with a very noisy air con unit for what looks like an industrial freezer unit. This made it impossible to sleep to the point we had to be moved to another room, this was done very quickly and efficiently. The new room was near the front of the hotel the only problem here was that at 6:30am  the main kitchen switches on its fans which are just outside the window and  sounds like a light aircraft landing in your room.
title: Old Colonial But Noisy

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka

text:
Delicious cuisine, a fantastic atmosphere within the historic Galle Fort, although the service was somewhat lacking due to extended food wait times, and the cost of water was notably thrice the MRP.

placeInfo/address: 64, Peddlers Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:

Positives: fresh and good looking hotel, everything feels new. Best breakfast offering smoothie bowl and cappuccino. Great location in the city center 

Negatives: fairly small room and small queen size bed (small for two people). Compared to other hotels we stayed at in Sri Lanka the staff had a somewhat cold attitude, we did not feel that welcome.

 However at the same time we  consider its our  prime responsibility to express our deepest  apologies since we have not managed to fully satisfy your needs. Your comments have already been passed to the management team for immediate corrective action.

placeInfo/address: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street1: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,
roomTip: If you opt for a luxury room, request not to have 20c - request a balcony room.
text:
This stunningly located property has the potential to be an excellent hotel but unfortunately our experience was let down by being accommodated in a very poor room. We had been booked into a ‘Luxury’ category room, either twin beds or large king-sized. The web-site describes these rooms as being luxuriously appointed with balconies providing panoramic views and featuring writing desk and chair alongside photos of spacious rooms with beautiful soft furnishings. Our room was cramped, with two very short beds with thin, barracks style mattresses, a wardrobe, luggage table and small side table. Two very small windows looked over the car-park and were above the kitchen. Staff came and went until late at night and from early morning. Mini buses and cars started at 5:30am. What furniture and fittings there were, were broken, and tired. When we spoke to the duty manager, he  laughed (quite possibly with embarrassment) and suggested I complain to the hotel owners, not him - he gave me a complaints form. He did agree that the furniture was very poor, and in the case of a bedside lamp with exposed wires and gaffer tape, dangerous. No attempt was made to relocate us. We did spy other rooms, though open doors, and they were mostly as described on their website, although there are only 3 bedrooms with balconies - BE WARNED, if you want these, request ahead.
With the exception of the laughing manager, all the staff were extremely attentive and efficient. The food was very well prepared and imaginative - we were on HB and the four course menu offered an appetiser, a soup and two or three choices for the mains and desert. The a la carte menu had the usual international ‘light’ lunch fare and snacks - again, well cooked and presented. Breakfast is prepared to order and includes fresh juices, fresh fruit and an excellent assortment of cooked egg or ‘local’ SriLankan dishes.
Superb gardens and a lovely pool area are well tended and offer amazing views of the tea plantations and surrounding hills. It is well worth taking a hike for a few hours, through the adjacent estates.
title: Beautiful Location, Dreadful Room

ownerResponse/text:
Dear  Guest, 

Ayubowan from Amaya Resorts and Spas! 

Thank you very much for posting a review . we are deeply dismayed to learn that you did not have a memorable stay with us and  apologize for the  areas which did not meet your expectations.

Warmest Regards, 

Amaya Rersorts & Spas
placeInfo/address: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street1: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,
text:
We had three nights at the Langdale. 

Lovely looking hotel and beautiful setting/location but way out of its league as a 5 star property and as a ‘Small Luxury Hotel of the world’.

The main issue here was service....or lack of it. The staff aren’t trained and a number of mishaps occurred regularly. Lunch we waited nearly an hour and a half with only one other table present. Prior to lunch though we had to hunt someone down as they were non existent. They were removing entree plates and bringing out mains while others were still eating their entrees. Some of the mains weren’t as described on the menu (the same lunch/dinner menu for three days). Speaking of menus, the staff would knock on our door (or sometimes during breakfast) asking us to place our orders for dinner.....very inconvenient). The wine was non-existent. They had a total of ten bottles of white wine and slightly more red for the entire hotel. A wine delivery was supposed to be made but it never arrived. When we did order wine which came from the small wine fridge 15m away....it took forever. As the staff knew nothing about the wine, multiple times we had to inspect the wine fridge ourselves.

Other issues were the hotel itself is below standard. A pair of thongs/flip flops sat outside our room door for the entire stay. No iron/ironing board in the room. A weirdly placed fireplace in the lounge which on the back was stuffed with toilet rolls (safety risk when on?).

The bedroom was quite small which wasn’t a big deal but room 203 is on the front corner meaning you hear every guest arrive & depart at all hours. There were always five cars & vans parked down the side of the building under our bedroom window so it sounded like they were in our room. Not to mention the people associated with those vehicles standing outside chatting day & night. We could also hear all of the staff carrying on from their staff quarters down the drive. We also had to endure the clanging of pots & pans from the kitchen while cleaning every night. There’s also no air con.

Spending most of our time by the pool, staff asked once if we wanted a drink which we did. They never came back on any occasion and glasses/bottles sat there for 3-4 hours without being collected. In fact at times we brought it to them ourselves. If we wanted another drink we had to go & find someone.

The bathroom was dated & had no block out curtain meaning we had to hang a towel so the people loitering around outside didn’t get a show. Shower tiles were chipped and a strange blue liquid leaked down the shower wall.

When we wanted to speak with the manager we couldn’t as they were on holidays with no assistant manager to replace. We ended up contacting our tour company to follow up all the issues.

This is a lovely hotel in a beautiful spot but it needs to be reduced to 4 star & have its ‘Small Luxury Hotels of the World’ endorsement removed....& that is something we’ve already passed on.

The staff are lovely but just don’t have any training and that is the fault of Amaya and the manager of the property. Having stayed in a number of hotels/resorts before & after Langdale on this trip it is incredibly evident that Langdale Amaya falls way behind.
title: Very Disappointing

roomTip: Rooms in 1st floor have better views
text:
Pros - I stayed their one night in a Superior room on Full board basis. The Room was not much specious but very clean. WiFi is good. Meals are delicious & sufficient. Room service is perfect. Nice location, well maintained garden

Cons - TV is there, but no channels to watch (only 2 or 3). No varieties to select in the set menu. no chairs & table for in room dining. walls are thin & no soundproof. placeInfo/address: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street1: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,
text:
This is a great place for someone to get away from their busy lifestyle. 

Hotel charges are highly overrated by the company by having a "regular room rate" closer to Rs 40,000.00 a night. This is an old house converted to a hotel and added a spa. Certainly no comparison to a place like the Heritance Tea Factory that's close by which is a 5 star ⭐️ hotel and their regular room rate is the same. 
Of course travels are getting smarter so Booking.com Rate was around Rs 19,000.00 with taxes and they do offer local credit card promotions with about 50% off. I think room only or B&B needs to be around Rs 10,000.00 for a place like this max. 

The Good:
Very motivated staff willing to do what ever it takes to take care of the guest. We checked in late and the resident manager Imalka Thilakaratne was fantastic. She was very professional and clearly had the attitude to win customers for life. She never forgot to invite us back to the hotel and give her card asking us to call her if we needed help during our travels. 
- Beautiful garden around the hotel premises. Consistently we observed very hard working staff who was quick to greet us but to go back to the task that they were doing. 
- food was just right. From Bfast to lunch it was a right selection and the right amount of spices for our liking 
- servers were very kind/ accommodating.
- Location is very private and you don't see any of the small houses (at least not from our room as we were at the back of the building)

The bad. 
- Distance from the main city. A good 30 mins drive and not too much to do around the hotel. 
-  small rooms
- small bathroom. (shower Cubical was leaking in our bathroom)
- absolutely no place to keep your toiletry bag other than on the floor. 
- Rooms are not sound proof. You can hear people walking outside as well as inside the building 

Overall a at the right price certainly a good place to recommend. 

Thanks Imalka for going above and beyond!!!
title: Good B&B level hotel with excellent service.

placeInfo/address: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street1: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,
text:
Hotel is 20 minutes drive away from Nuwara Eliya. Not difficult to locate the hotel. Its in the small luxury hotel category and i wonder why? before going to the hotel i expected a lot and now i wonder why its in the luxury category. 
Hotel only has 13 rooms so that qualifies for the small but luxury thats a question mark. 
I expected the area to be very cold but climate change is happening every where we had to switch on the fan to sleep and we had a swim in the pool as well. there is not much chairs outside to sit. only two places. if two families take those chairs under the umbrellas then no one else can't stay outside. 

even the dining area is small, at once if all the guests come to dine then there is no place to sit. the day we stayed they had BBQ and it was kept outside. In the night its bit cold. All the food were cold and in the dark you cannot find what the food is. they have not kept name tags so i had to ask the chef what the dish is. 

the bar is so small and absolutely no place to sit as they have kept a pool table in the middle. so you cannot enjoy a drink in side. right next to the bar there are two rooms and good that people do not go to the bar if not its such disturbance to the guests in the those rooms. 

room amenities are pretty much the same as you get in other 4 star hotels. i cannot say its its luxury. thats what i don't understand. 

Apart from the fact that staff is very nice and friendly. we were given a plate of cookies in the evening and thats a nice touch.
title: Nice Location with beautiful view

placeInfo/address: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street1: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,
text:
Lovely premisses, beautiful views and staff are friendly, however the hotel needs some love. The rooms clean, however bathrooms felt dirty as they were very run down. Some powerpoints and the telly didn't work, I know what you are thinking the TV not working put who cares, we don't either but if its in the room it should be working.. (was for our son too) 
Sitting in the gardens in the evening was gorgeous, spa was cute and not too bad.
Dinner was okay.

All in all a pleasant stay with some changes this place could really be one for the books.

placeInfo/address: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street1: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,
text:
We arrived late (about 19:00) and checked into four rooms, one single, a double and two triples. The two triples were not bedded up with an extra bed, though, so we had to send the staff for two extra beds. Initially, three of us in a triple room was given a small suite in another part of the hotel than the others, but upon learning that the single occupant in the group was given a larger room, we requested a switch. In the end, we all ended up in the same wing, begging the question of why we weren't just placed there in the first place? The hotel has 13 rooms, about as many on staff and was only half full, so they weren't exactly overworked...

After unpacking, we went straight to the restaurant and ordered our meals. Despite being the only ones in the restaurant (again, with a staff of 4-5 waiters), the first meals - pasta bolognese for the kids - arrived after 45 minutes. The rest of the meals arrived one by one, with the last one - lobster and fish - arriving an hour and a half after placing the order! Ridiculous! By then, grandmom, who had ordered it, had gone to bed, fuming. At least they didn't charge us for it, but despite us telling them not to, they took the meal to her room, which only infuriated her even more.
As for the food itself, the bolognese and cottage pie were rather bland, but the rest of the food was fine without being world class. Pricey, though...

A tip to the hotel manager/staff: Most people do NOT like having a waiter standing right behind your back during the entire stay at the restaurant. A waiter can be attentive without being intrusive.

A second tip for the manager/staff: After having given us the menu cards, give us more than (literally!) five seconds to decide what we want.

A third tip for the manager/staff: Don't automatically serve 4-6 cakes to each guest at breakfast. No one is going to eat all of them, if they even like them. Such a waste!

Anyway, the rooms were fine, if a tad run down. This was easily the most expensive stay during our Sri Lanka trip, and one can't help wondering why they can't afford a handyman with a screwdriver to fasten loose fittings and a washcloth to wipe off mold from the windows?

Speaking of price vs. quality; of all the hotels we stayed at in Sri Lanka, the staff at this one were the least fluent in English. Some of them litterally didn't speak a word, and had to fetch the most fluent in the bunch every time. A great source of potential disasters...!

The best parts of the hotel were the absolutely stunning views and the gardens (if one can overlook the horse statue, which looks like an oversize clay figure from kindergarten). A big thumbs up to the gardeners; they've really managed to bring an immaculate English garden to life in the Sri Lankan hills! As for the rest of the staff; it's not that they are rude or unfriendly or lazy - quite the opposite! It's just that they are rather incompetent...

In the end, the stay is not worth the price.
title: Posh Fawlty Towers

placeInfo/address: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street1: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,
text:
This is a converted plantation house. Our room was large and comfortable overlooking the well tended gardens with lovely views of tea plantations and distant hills. A  nice touch was the (electric) fire provided in the room to ward of the chill evenings. The comfortable furnishings were in keeping with the age of the house. 
Unfortunately this hotel is hugely let down by its dinner service which , on the two nights we were there, was dreadful although the hotel was not full. You are asked to pre-select you food choices but despite this we were waiting over 1hr for our starters and also had a long wait for main and desert courses. The food when it eventually arrived was very good quality but by then your appetite has been spoiled. Other guests gave up completely and went to bed. The menu is very eclectic and in my view should be revised to better reflect local produce ( does anyone really want smoked salmon in Sri Lanka?) and possibly be easier to manage for the chef. A real shame.
title: A beautiful hotel let down by poor service.

placeInfo/address: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street1: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,
text:
The place is wonderful and makes a strong first impression. Gorgeous location and nicely appointed. The rooms are adequate, though a bit dated. However, the real problem is the service, which while very friendly brings Fawlty Towers to mind. It is little things, like ordering a gin and tonic and they have to go to the store to get the gin. Asking to play tennis on the great grass court and the hotel only having one old tennis ball, or having to ask 5 people for coffee at breakfast when you are the only person in the dining room.

It could be an magical place, and in some ways comes very close. It just needs some strong management.
title: Lovely location but a bit Fawlty Towers

placeInfo/address: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street1: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,
text:
This hotel is in a beautiful location. It's very peaceful and has fabulous views. But that's really the only good thing about it. It is certainly not 5-star - not even 4. 

Our room was cramped and the bathroom very dated. There really wasn't anything special or charming about it. 

There were so many things that could be improved to make the experience better: 

1. Communication
Reception staff were helpful but wouldn't go the extra mile. For example they advised that breakfast packs could be organized for our morning hike, but that we needed to call the kitchen from our room to order them. This resulted in misunderstanding ad the kitchen staffs English skills were limited. Would have been better if reception requested the packs. 
We also tried to visit the spa a few times but there was no one there and no number for them in the room. 

2. Refresh 
Bathrooms need updating. 
Towels are like cardboard
There is a nice lawn tennis court but only 1 very old, flat tennis ball so playing wasn't enjoyable. 

3. Breakfast
The best luxury hotels offer a simple, well presented, cold buffet of cereals, fruit and pastries plus an option of a hot dish such as eggs, pancakes, and a traditional option.  This would improve the experience and save so much wasted food that it provided to the table and not eaten. 

Overall our stay was average but we certainly see the potential in the property.  Needs some management investment.
title: Not worth the price

placeInfo/address: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka

The list of mistakes would be too long and it is really frustrating to even not ethem all down. placeInfo/address: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street1: 01, Radella, Avissawella - Hatton - Nuwara Eliya Hwy,
text:
We stayed at

We stayed here for 02 nights during July'16. Its a small hotel with 19 rooms. We booked a Luxury deluxe room and the room was very spacious with good views, the only drawback is the room doesn't have a balcony.
The property is very well maintained and also the amenities provided were of good quality.
The only drawback at this place was service. they don't have enough people to handle the guests thought the hotel was not fully occupied.
No buffets during the breakfast and dinner. Our stay was on half board basis, for which they had a set menu for dinner.
The hotel staff requested us to order our dinner from the set menu, which had 04 options in the main course and we ordered our dinner well in advance(02 hours before) and when we arrived the dining place, they made us to wait for another one hour, which is not acceptable.

If they could add few more staff, it would be a wonderful place to stay.
title: Small Hotel in a Exceelent Location

ownerResponse/text:
It was a pleasure having you stay at Sri Sharavi Beach Villas & Spa and thank you for sharing your feedback.

We are glad to hear you were well looked after by the team and enjoyed our 43 saltwater infinity pool and your stay in the Superior Deluxe Suite.

The current situation with the beach in front of our property is very unusual, and the change can happen unexpectedly and within a very short time period. It is a reflection of the extraordinary weather events that are occurring globally - and is beyond our control.  We are sorry on this occasion it was unusually different and hope it goes back to normal soon. As a result of your feedback we have come up with a temporary solution for our guests to continue to access the beach.

And we are so pleased to add - one day after we received your review, the beach has come back! That's how quickly the situation can change here. We wish we could add a photo to show you ... 

We are happy all other aspects of your stay were great and look forward to welcoming you back to Sri Sharavi for another stay soon.
placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Not got a beach
text:
We booked this resort after seeing it on several websites and thought it would be a perfect location.

The ocean front location and beach looked fantastic.

Through our travel agent we booked an Ocean deluxe suite that was not cheap ( probably £350/ 400 per night) we thought opening the doors in the morning and walking out onto the ocean facing balcony would be fantastic.

When we checked in we were shown to our suite, it was a fantastic room with vaulted ceiling and a full length wall of glass looking out to a rooftop garden and a small set of doors with a view of the ocean between 2 buildings.

When we checked with Kenny the manager to make sure we had the correct room it was , a deluxe suite has a partial sea view.  ( my fault I should have double checked before booking)

Still shell shocked from that and after unpacking we decided to go down to the beach and have a drink and relax.

We got to the bar ordered a drink and then walked to the beach and almost fell off the 12 foot high retaining wall and onto the rocks where the beach used to be.

THE BEACH HAS GONE, washed away, thousands of tonnes of sand has gone.

When I asked Kenny about the beach he shrugged his shoulders and said it used to be there but had been washed away but hopefully it will be washed back again, I said he needs an engineering project like the Jumeirah Palm to get the beach back.

We stayed here for 7 days, all the staff are great and very helpful. The 45 metre infinity pool was beautiful. The suite we had was lovely.

I could not fault the hotel nor its staff except that it is vastly overpriced (  + they add 10% service 18% VAT& 2.5% ) 30.5% to every thing, but to sell yourself as a beach resort you really do need to have a beach
title: Not a beach resort

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Nester,
Thank you for taking the time to write a review.   I am glad that overall you enjoyed the stay, yet there are some areas that we can improve on.  We as the owners take your suggestions seriously and have worked to make changes.  

For example, we have put in a ladder now so that it is easier to get to the beach.  If I may explain, our property is located on the section of the island that is turning and the ocean that you see in front of you, the next landmass is the south pole.  With the changing environment, we are seeing unpredictable conditions with the sea. The beach can change from day to day.  The cinnamon fence was put in place as a request from the tourist police and the health authorities during the time of Covid which we are working on removing. 

The last two years have been challenging.  We as the owners along with Lenora are working with the team tirelessly to manage the service.  We have gone through each of your details and made sure the staff are made aware of the highlighted points.  At Sri Sharavi our front of house team which includes the house butlers and waiters job rotate between housekeeping and serving our guests.

Again thank you for the feedback, it helps us to improve.
Sharlyn
placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Many people was disappointed with a room without windows
text:
Liked · The hotel tried to accommodate everything - upon request, samples for our room mats, brought a bowl of incense, everything was made without calling, with whatsapp, that's very convenient.
Cozy clean area, excellent service - the staff tries very hard.
Most of the dishes on the menu are delicious, the chicken quesadilla is excellent. Pizza is not )
Super comfortable beds and very cool sunbeds.
Great sea view from Ocean Rooms.
Pool is incredible, I've trained myself as in olympic pool

Disliked · I tried to find solitude and tranquility from the city. From the photos it looked like the same place. How surprised I was when I found a GIANT CONCRETE SKELETON of a HOTEL right in your face! Construction cranes are sticking out, work is going on, you can see it from anywhere in the hotel. Step out onto the balcony of your $600 room, you have the ocean in front of you, and a giant construction site on your right, enjoy. Sunset happens right behind this construction site. This is not the hotel's fault, but none of the reviews or photos show this. It is very sad.

The second huge minus is that the ocean destroyed the beach that you see in all the photos. The hotel ends with a fence. Do you think the hotel provided a descent to the sand below, put a ladder? No, guests who pay $600 for a room crawl, clinging to a protruding wire and jumping from a height of more than a meter. It should not be.

Third, we accidentally left a silver Tiffany bracelet in the pocket of our bathrobe, which we took to the laundry. The bracelet is gone! Nobody could find it, and it's in a hotel for $600! I don't think this is allowed.

Extremely unstable level of service and staff. They constantly covered us with a crumpled tablecloth, without even trying to smooth it out. Sometimes completely untrained guys with no experience appear in the role of waiters. They brought ice coffee, slapping a ball of ice cream into hot coffee and not putting ice (imagine). Yesterday an employee could clean the room, and today he suddenly (for himself) turns out to be a waiter (do you think he will understand the menu?).

During the day, finding someone in the pool area is an unrealistic task, everyone disappears and goes about their business.

If you want to use the toilet - every time you will go to your villa on the second floor. It seems a trifle, but terribly uncomfortable on the fifth day.

The hotel organized a surf lesson - it turned out that the instructor would be an ordinary tuk-tuk driver, you can i
title: MISLEADING photo and description - no beach (all the january) and construction site nearby =(

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for taking the time to leave a review and to bring to my attention your concerns. 

I recall greeting you when you arrived and introducing you to our Reservations Manager whom took over the check in process and showed you to your room. My apologies if you found my manner too businesslike. It was certainly not my intention nor the usual feedback I receive from our many guests. I was away from the villa throughout the duration of our stay here, which would explain why you did not see me again. Our office, however, was staffed.

Regarding your AC and wifi complaint,  I have spoken with the Reservations Manager whom checked you in and he was on duty throughout your stay. He said that you did not bring any internet or AC issues to his attention.   The property was full during your stay and the other guests, both in your villa and the other villas, did not complain about internet.   The room you stayed in had guests both before and after your stay and none of them complained about wifi service.  Sometimes there is an issue for guests with their mobile phones, rather than the wifi being the problem it is the internal hardware of the guest's phone that creates the issue.   Had you informed the front office someone most definitely would have looked into it for you.   Similarly regarding the AC, we have an electrician on staff and had he been alerted that you  wanted the swing direction and the temperature of the AC changed, he could have assisted you.   And as you pointed out, there were many staff available for you to raise the issues with, staff whom you also pointed out were asking if your stay was comfortable.
 
Regarding the villa layout, the common space is shared the same way that common space is shared in a hotel, only you need share it with two other rooms rather than all 14 rooms. There is an option to book the entire 3 bedroom villa and have exclusive use of the villa. As you were only 2 guests you chose the common sense route of booking one of our Suite rooms within the villa. The Suite is very spacious and has its own a daybed and a sofa and chair, plus a very large balcony with 2 sunbeds and a dining table and two chairs. Our booking.com and website description makes it very clear that the Ocean Signature Suite is a room and not the entire 3 bedroom villa. 

Regarding our breakfast, I respectfully take exception to your claim that the selection is poor and basic. There is a choice of 3 different types of Sri Lankan breakfast and 4 different types of Western style breakfast each day.  Each breakfast is accompanied by a daily fresh juice and a fresh fruit plate of 3 -4 different types of fruit.  A guest is always welcome to ask for additional fruit or for a different juice. 

Regarding your claim that our food prices are 3-4 times higher than elsewhere, I also respectfully disagree as that is simply not the case.  With respect to our portion size, our Chef monitors the situation and I can report that the majority of plates are returned to the kitchen empty, meaning that the guest has enjoyed the full meal.   

Your criticisms regarding the staff are not a usual criticism we receive.  Generally our staff are complimented for being friendly and professional, but your criticisms are noted and I shall address them with the staff.
placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
roomTip: put "DO NOT DISTURB" signs in the rooms and make staff to knock on the doors before entering
text:
General Manager at the reception (western woman) was not welcoming and friendly when we arrived. She meant business and was extremely cold! Zero smile, zero questions like: how are you? How long have you been around? How do you like island? First time in SL? Nothing! That didn't give us a good feeling. She's never been around when we wanted to discuss couple of issues like: poor internet connection, AC issues, lack of "do not disturb sign in the rooms", staff walking into the room without knocking! And Staff were walking around like it was their place. Don’t get me wrong but I’ve paid 370$/night for ocean view suit thinking we will have a bit of privacy….

ROOMS: There are only 12 rooms at this property. At some point, I’ve had a feeling there were more staff than customers. We were told that we will have two floor villa with the private living room (as you see on the property website). But nobody has mentioned that the living room is shared between 3 rooms!!!!!!!!!! So, you only get your room and the rest is shared with other guests and staff (which were hanging out there none stop! I don’t exaggerate but every time we were passing by staff were in the living room or kitchen trying to engage in the conversation!)

There was a serious issue with the AC (basically it’s right above your blowing ice cold air on your head), Internet reception in our villa was very poor. We only had reception in one corner of the room.

Staff were nice but OVER-POLITE! Every day I was approached minimum 20 times with the same question: ma’am how do you like your room? Everything ok in the room? Where you from ma’am?  And it always was the same set of questions, like a broken record.

HOTEL RESTAURANT Breakfast selection is very poor and basic (probably that’s why its included in the price) Juices were water down and fruit salads tiny (fruits cost almost nothing in Sri Lanka) Dinner or lunch is served either by the pool or your private room. Food price is 3-4 times more expensive than any other place in the area. I’ve tried fried rice, noodle, salads and soups. Portions were insanely huge! This didn’t even look elegant on the plate! Seriously you could easily feed 3 ppl with one portion

Service is slow and doesn’t match the property standards. Waiters speak poor English, on occasion they were coming to collect the order before bringing menu cards…. little things that make an overall experience
title: Beautiful property that left us bit disappointing

ownerResponse/text:
It is with dismay that I read your review from your visit here 5 months ago.

Regarding the design of your room I must respectfully disagree with you .  The room is filled with natural light during the day.  In the evening there are 6 ceiling lights plus a direct light on the dressing mirror.  The room is also designed so that guests may enjoy to the fullest extent possible being right on the beach.  The large bi-fold glass doors open onto a very spacious balcony.  An almost constant ocean breeze blows through the property and the open air rooms.  The AC unit is 25,000 BTUs and is more than adequate for the room of its proportion.   Guests, upon check in, are given the option of choosing to keep their large balcony doors closed during the day with the AC unit turned on, but I can say with confidence that the great majority of our guests insist on their doors open so that they can enjoy the breathtaking view, ocean breeze and sound of the waves. 

I have interviewed the on duty staff regarding your service complaint, as well as reviewed our housekeeping logs.  I have satisfied myself that your room was properly serviced each morning and each afternoon of your two night stay.  The service included  providing your room with two litres of fresh filtered drinking water in the morning and in the late afternoon.  The staff do recall your displeasure after your request for a green coconut to be cut off one of our trees for your consumption was denied.   The king coconuts that we give to guests for drinking are harvested from our farm property, so perhaps there was some miscommunication from the staff member as there is always ample drinking water as well as fresh king coconut water.

Regarding breakfast, I again must respectfully take issue with your assertion.  Our breakfast Menu suggests 3 different styles of breakfast – from the Sri Lankan breakfast there is a choice of 3 different mains and 3 different kinds of curries; from the Western breakfast there is a choice of having your eggs cooked 5 different ways and the eggs are served with potatoes, bacon or sausage and tomato/cucumber slices; and, from the Continental breakfast the choice is the standard continental fare of pancakes, toast or French toast plus curd and treacle.  All of our breakfasts include a fresh juice, a fresh fruit plate and coffee or tea.  The Extras Menu is for those persons with a very hearty morning appetite desiring more.
placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Ocean facing rooms are extremely hot during the day! beware!!!!
text:
It was quite hot in Srilanka in April and the room given to us had only 1 airconditioner, which means the room was hot all the time. Moreover, the room is badly structured and the dressing area has no light. I regretted missing these reviews on TA before my visit. They also had Alcohol license troubles when we visited so Alcohol wasn't served on the property. 
The stay wasn't bad but it wasn't luxurious either but the Service in the hotel is pathetic and One afternoon we faced trouble in fetching fresh water in the room. Also, the breakfast includes only limited options and for the extras, you have to pay this is a big turn off since in Srilanka food is relatively cheaper. 
The common areas are stunning but again due to bad service, we didn't enjoy it. 
The pool is excellent and so is the location.
My overall feeling was that I could have chosen a better resort as Mirissa is an excellent destination.
title: I would not recommend or rave this property. I expected more.......

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your review and for bringing your criticism to my attention.  I have taken the opportunity to review your guest bill as well as our CCTV footage from our restaurant.  And while it may have felt like over 1 hour for your food to arrive, as you had been up early for a 6 am whale watching tour, the wait was less than that.  You were seated at 10 am and left the restaurant at 11 a.m. after having eaten your meal.  What was unusual was that our kitchen was still serving breakfast to the other 4 tables at the restaurant when you arrived. Our breakfast hours are 7 - 10:30 am and our lunch hours start at 11:30 a.m.  Your order was for 4 lunch items, two of which required the deep fryer.  In an effort to meet our guests' needs we accommodated your order.  Certainly it should have been explained to you that the wait for your food would take longer than usual as the kitchen needed to prepare itself for lunch orders.   Regarding your service criticism, your point is well taken and I have reviewed the CCTV footage and proper guest service with the staff to ensure exemplary service going forward.  Again, I thank you for bringing this to my attention and I am glad that you otherwise enjoyed Sri Sharavi and the local dogs.
placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
text: Our experience here was ruined by the restaurant service where we sat and waited for one hour for our food while being the only table that needed to be served.  Drinks even came after the food.  Aside from dining, this resort is really pretty and the three dogs running around definitely brighten up people’s day!
title: beautiful resort but bad restaurant experience

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your review and your criticisms will be considered.
placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
text:
Yes, the heated pool was excellent, ocean villa suite was amazing but for that hefty price, there were so many other options as well. We were lazing out in the pool most of the times with the other guests as we all complained the same thing. The Ocean Villa Suite was too big to be installed with just one air cond unit! It was just too hot to stay in the room. and for me with a very young kid, it was a problem as he naps in the afternoon.

Dinner was good, but for breakfast i was given fruits that were not cut properly. Both days. I stayed in 7 other resorts in SL and never had this problem. Service wasn't great like how the rest mentioned, perhaps because it was easter break and the GM wasn't around.
title: Mixed about the property

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for taking the time to leave a review and to bring to my attention your criticisms.
I am glad that you enjoyed our vista and our swimming pool.
Regarding the room, you booked our entry level room.  The room size and photos are available for guests to view prior to booking.  At your check in our Assistant Manager offered you an upgrade at a discounted rate, but you preferred to stay in the room you booked.  The room does have a balcony, with a view out over our Villa courtyard, but not a sea view.
While I accept your criticism of your dining experience and our staff courtesy, I can say that the staff and I were surprised to hear of both.  You were given the courtesy each morning of a late breakfast, past the 10:30 a.m. cut off time.  The staff made sure to advise the kitchen that your wife has a food intolerance to both spice and to gluten, once you shared that information with them.  Requisite food accommodations were made for your wife then.  Your two beef tenderloin meals were consumed and I understand that when asked if you enjoyed your meals, that you answered in the affirmative.      
And while I was not on the property during your 2 night stay, both our Operations Manager and our Assistant Manager were present from 6 am - 11 pm.  We strive to maintain the balance of being "all seeing" with also giving our guests a relaxed ambiance.    I will certainly consider your suggestion that the on duty managers should be more visible to the guests.    And I have spoken with the Chef and our other managers to address your food concern.
placeInfo/address: Matara Road 153 Km Post, Kamburugamuwa, Matara 81750 Sri Lanka
text: Place very nice, by the sea. Beautiful swimming pool. Rooms a bit small, with no view, but clean and with all the comforts. Courtesy of the staff to improve. And the food... I ordered a tenderloin for 2 nights and the first night was too spicy, the second over cooked. And the reason was that the main chef was off and there was the second chef that just did not know how to cook it. Incredible for a 5 star. A lot to improve. The hotel manager was not present at all, more to avoid problems than to resolve them. Not the best we have found in Sri Lanka.
title: Food and service to improve

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Josephinely,

thank you for sharing your feedback of your visit at "Hiru Beach" Ayurveda Resort,

Your observations about the room and foods has been well noted and will be reviewed. It is our constant and sincere endeavor to provide the best of services to our guests at all times and feedbacks from our valued guests will help us to improve to the excellence.

We take our guests’ satisfaction very seriously and strive to improve every day by providing that quality customer service that our guests expect, so your feedback is of a great importance and I sincerely apologize that your experience was not to our usual standard.

We are pleased to mention that we maintain fair prices for the accommodation, food and services when compared with the other Ayurveda Resorts in the region,  which was also why you made a booking for our place. Please to remind you at  first consultation we spoke regarding some condition to follow but your bad behave make our clients distract. there is no arguments i am sure you this is not your type of wellness Resorts. We are following genuine Ayurveda & Wellness Panch karama Program with different type of body.  

We work hard on making our guests satisfied and their stay here memorable and we hope that despite some disappointments you have enjoyed your overall holiday and will be coming back our renewed and expanded hotel to evaluate our progress the next time you are in Sri Lanka..
placeInfo/address: Thalgahapitiya Road, Kosgoda 80570 Sri Lanka
text:
Location: beautiful, right by a deserted beach, beautiful sunset and relaxing environment.
Room: 201, old toilets, smell of old rooms in a tropical country, but all in all it is fine.
Garden: nice with a very small swimming pool.
Staff: the doctor for ayurveda was always available and listening. The massage staff was extremely competent and nice and warm. The cooking staff was also extremely nice and tried the best to accomodate. 
One manager was trying to help us with the wifi and found a solution as soon as he knew about the problem. 
The second manager mostly smiled all the time but complained about my behaviour to the travel agency in Europe without telling me directly what the problem was. I was craving coffee even if it seemed not recommended by ayurveda treatment. I explicitly asked the doctor after 5 days to be able to have one coffee in the morning and the doctor agreed. I then bought an instant coffee and put it close to the tea bar. This was reported as a disturbing behaviour to the guests and structure of the hotel to the travel agency. This was extremely annoying and dishonest as I was a quiet guest even though i explicitly did not want certain treatment and explained the reason. This reporting did break the trust between me and this manager. 
This leads to the worse part of the resort: 
I could not blame the staff but I believe the owner of the hotel tried to save money with the food. First was the portion of the meals, extremely small and this probably suit fat people who come to diet. secondly, until i complained a bit, the food was mediocre and even fruits bought and served were sometimes not fresh. Given the price of fruits and food in this wonderful country, it s a scandal to have such small, boring meals during two weeks. I have come to realize that this had nothing to do with ayurveda or diet, simply the owner saved money by giving the staff instructions to cook that few. 
I could not blame the staff because it was not tbeir fault.

Difficult to recommend or not recommend the resort. Each person has his own taste. I was not convinced about the treatments. 
I like the staff but do not really care about interacting with other guests. Should i ? I dont think so, i was not in a boot camp or religious sect. But it seems like it is the style of the resort to have everyone living together like a family. Simply not my style, i said hi and smiled but had nothing to share with other guests. I guess if you mix and mingle then it s the place for you.
title: Average hotel with great location and great staff

text:
A massive hotel which we initially disliked- the dining room resembles a cafe on the underground/ Gatwick with people barging around getting food. The feeling was industrial. The bar is huge and no atmosphere or people in it . The beach was lacking sun beds so there was the early morning dash for one ! The pool area suffered from an extraordinary design where the access was from inside the complex so you couldn’t lie in the gardens and just dip in 

However after a few days we appreciated the clean well appointed room , the gardens and loved the architectural tour of the hotel ( excellent) . The staff were all willing to help. We ended up going out to excellent local places for all our meals/ drinks to try and find something smaller and more attractive.
A real shame because with a few tweaks it could be lovely but we will not return.

text:
This hotel on a beautiful stretch of beach promises to be a deluxe signature hotel in the cinnamon group . Deluxe it’s not ! 
The entrance and the views from reception are full of promise but sadly that’s where it ends . It is a resort with spa, pools, kids club etc . This must be why it’s a signature hotel . Silly us thinking it meant exclusive and 5 star . Our beach side room was large and cool. Sadly the carpet under the bed was absolutely filthy. We could not understand how our feet were getting so dirty as we saw housekeeping cleaning the floors. Some
Of our towels had holes is them and were threadbare . 
By the pool the sun beds were stained and dirty . The parasols the same and had holes in them. Let’s move on to the dining read the literature they say 5 restaurants . That means 3 huge buffet restaurants all joined and one lovely seafood which was amazing one cafe . Dress code at night was never adhered too by the mostly Russian clientele. We did complain about that but the staff had trouble policing this . The breakfast buffet is very good . There seemed to be a lack of direction for the staff in general. It all seemed chaotic at best. If you like a large hotel then maybe this is for you . Sadly it was not for us ..
title: So much promise but came up lacking

text: PickMe App cannot be used to order taxis. Our vehicle was ambushed by more than 15 locals and the driver was beaten when we ordered a van back to Colombo via the PickMe app. The local gangs want us to use their taxis and tuk tuks which are very very expensive. We were terrified. Three of us travelled back, my 80 year old mother, and teenage daughter. We were luckily spotted by another relative who was also staying at the property and he saved us from this terrible quite frankly shocking incident  The hotel also encourages you to use their transport and local taxis which are very very expensive The Taj hotel and the Cinnamon Bentota hotel are all aware of this. Tourists want to pay a fair price but do not take us for fools. The hotels in this area are well aware of this gang culture. They fleece tourists once you are out of Colombo

text:
Beautiful Location, very nice well trained staff, good  service, nice swimming pool.
All of this was unfortunately negated by noisy motorised para gliders that constantly flew over the hotel garden and pools making relaxation impossible. I do hope for the sake of the hotel and staff that the management takes this seriously and finds a way to stop this. I have been returning to this hotel over and agin and will probably not visit anymore if this issue is not adressed,.
title: The good and the ugly
