placeInfo/address: Galle Rd Colombo-Galle-Hambantota-Wellawaya Highway, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
text:
Mixed experience about this hotel...
   I will start with the Good. The hotel architecture is breathtaking and to die for,  The sea food buffet was the best with ample amounts of fresh seafood for all 3 meals... The entertainment on weekends was great and wonderful to watch... Beach great. 
Coming to the negative-
       1. At the Check in, they asked for our ID and then few moments later asked if we had given it and could not locate it... at the end, sanity prevailed and they found it... the Check in Staff also mentioned they only handle 1 Check in at a time. And it was taking then forever. This maybe due to to the Reception and Check in Staff being very inexperienced and unable to handle their job properly. At this hotel, they were seriously under staffed as well, which is unacceptable for such an Amazing 5 star hotel. Please either employ experienced staff ,or else give the necessary training and shadowing they need to deliver the high paying Guest  what they came for.
      2. No welcome drink and towel was  given until it was reminded,  it was shocking for a so called 5 star hotel to miss these finer points, when lower star hotels do so much more...
      3. On the website we booked a Deluxe Sea view room,  but upon arrival were informed that direct sea view is not promised and there would be trees obstructing the view.. Therefore, we asked them to edit the website instead of deceiving the paying guests...
      4. It has 3 beautiful pools but the chemicals used were far too strong causing guests to see double, by evening...
         It is a beautiful hotel by far, but the management should look into all of the above in order to fulfill a truly 5 star worthy experience, as it is not a budget hotel, but instead I believe the highest luxury hotel in their chain,  and as we have visited many Cinnamon hotels, this is an honest review in order for improvement...
title: Room for improvement...

placeInfo/address: Galle Rd Colombo-Galle-Hambantota-Wellawaya Highway, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
text:
Hotel is a large, modern complex with a wide range of services. We stayed four nights after touring, in a beach access room. The room was very comfortable and well serviced, with all the equipment you might need including a bath as well as shower. The pools and grounds are lovely and loungers and towels are provided there and on the beach. Restaurant buffets for evening and breakfast provided a big selection of local and international food. Convenient for local town and restaurants.
Downsides were that there were corporate and private events taking place during our stay which meant some noise and the restaurant staff seemed to focus on those guests while disregarding those not part of that. At one breakfast when the corporate group departed the restaurant suddenly had absolutely no waiting staff, they just disappeared. A dinner service was due to end at 22.00 but we had our bill for signature shoved in front of us at 21.15 without asking because staff clearly wanted to clear for breakfast.
title: Beautiful resort hotel but not as good as it thinks

placeInfo/address: Galle Rd Colombo-Galle-Hambantota-Wellawaya Highway, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
text: This is undoubtedly the best hotel in terms of location and setting on Bentota Beach.  The rooms are spacious and luxurious, (we had a beach access luxury room)  although it could have had more plug and working usb points for phones etc. Disappointingly it only had one a la carte restaurant when the Taj 4 star hotel had 3. That said there are plenty of extremely reasonably priced restaurants nearby, with ample tuk tuk taxis just outside the door to take you there. The only downside to Bentota beach is that most hotels do not have sunbeds on the beach. (You can rent them from locals at a cost of 2500rupees/day for 2 plus an umbrella) The Cinnamon does have. but not enough, although they say they are expecting delivery of more. Unfortunately those they do have they allow to be saved by guests even if they don’t sit on them all day!  Apart from these issues, the staff are wonderful, friendly and helpful and I would not have hesitated in giving the hotel full marks if it wasn’t for these issues.
title: Wonderful hotel and a beautiful setting

roomTip: Oropax einpacken
text:
Wunderschöne Hotelanlage, entworfen von Bawa in den 60ern, einer der bekanntesten Architekten des Landes. Man spürt definitiv den Retroflair, der mit modernen Elementen wunderschön kombiniert wurde. Das Personal ist zum Großteil sehr, sehr freundlich, höflich und hilfsbereit. Ebenso ist die Sauberkeit der Zimmer 1A, das Frühstücksbuffet im lebhaften Restaurant riesig und schwer zu überbieten.
Leider war die letzte Nacht sehr kurz, da eine größere Party mit DJ und knalligen Beats die Anlage bis 2:00 Uhr Nachts wach gehalten hat und die Gäste dann ab 2:00 Uhr Nachts gut gelaunt und laut schnatternd durch die Anlage zu ihren Zimmern gepilgert sind. Gäste Management: null … blöd, wenn man um 6:00 Uhr raus muss, um eine Tour zu machen.
Am nächsten Tag ging es dann auch gleich weiter, ab 13.30 gab es eine Poolparty mitsamt abgesperrtem Bereich und brachial lauter Mucke, dazu viel zu basslastig (Tipp: unterer Dreh-Regler am Kanal)..  nun ja, vom Pool zum Strand geflohen, leider immer noch laut. Alles okay, wenn ich es vorher weiß oder informiert werde,  aber für ein fünf Sterne Hotel wahrhaftig nicht das Wahre. Im Urlaub will ich meistens meine Ruhe haben, oder ich such mir gezielt ein Party Hotel aus. Auch hier Gäste Management leider versagt. Beschwerde beim Auschecken wurde gepflegt überhört / weggelächt.
title: Laut

roomTip: If you have a problem find Hiroshana in the dining area. A great guy who gets things done.
text: My sister and I had stayed at Cinnamon at Habarana where the service was excellent. Unfortunately this was not the case with Cinnamon at Bentota. It seemed to be a lack of training as the staff seemed unaware of basic things like offering water and having cutlery on the table. I requested 4 times over 3 days to have my air conditioning turned down as it was too hot and I couldn't sleep at night. This was not addressed until my sister spole to Hiroshana in the dining area. It was fixed the same day. Having observed Hiroshana he went above and beyond to ensure the best service and management should be promoting him as to me he seemed the only person to get things done. So a huge thanks to Hiroshana. But the beach was absolutely beautiful. So long that it never felt crowded. But again there was an issue that there were only 20 sun beds for a hotel with 159 rooms. Poor management again. I am sure if Hiroshana got involved this could be addressed. A beautiful location but spoiled a little due to inadequate management.
title: Beautiful location. But poor mangement.

placeInfo/address: Galle Rd Colombo-Galle-Hambantota-Wellawaya Highway, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: It’s worth doing a river cruise through the mangroves
text: Large, comfortable rooms with big balconies overlooking the gardens and sea.  Air conditioning was tricky to adjust. The hotel covers a vast area so if you are unlucky enough to be allocated a room at the far end, it is quite a walk to the restaurants and other facilities. Being elderly and not terribly mobile, the long walks in the heat was something to dread each day! The majority of the hotel is open to the elements, so it is uncomfortably hot. I pity the poor staff on reception who have to stand for hours in that heat. The restaurant can only be described as chaotic, both at breakfast and dinner. We very rarely sat at a table that had full table settings, so we were forever asking for cutlery, napkins, glasses, condiments, etc. - which would take ages to get, and often only one at a time! So we had to resort to scavenging from other tables!! The food, while good, often ran out and was not replenished immediately. And I was shocked to see that the chefs  at the egg station were not wearing gloves - and I actually saw one of the cooks dip his finger into an egg mix to retrieve a piece of shell. Not very hygienic. I think I was more disappointed because the previous week we had stayed at the Habarana Village by Cinnamon and everything ran like clockwork and the staff were extremely efficient and well trained. The only saving grace in the restaurant was one of the supervisors named Niroshana, who I fear was fighting a losing battle. He was very professional and even tried to help out with a problem we had in one of our rooms. He went above and beyond - this man deserves a big promotion!!! The beach was gorgeous and the main reason we chose this hotel. But, bearing in mind the hotel has 159 rooms, there were only TWENTY beach beds with umbrellas, and some of those were broken. So we were not always lucky enough to get a sunbed. Pretty poor service considering the price of the rooms. All in all, I probably would not stay there again and I do wonder why there was such disparity between two hotels under the same management (Habarana and Bentota).
title: Disappointing

placeInfo/address: Galle Rd Colombo-Galle-Hambantota-Wellawaya Highway, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
text:
This hotel presents a mix of positives and negatives. At best, it can be considered a low-end 4-star hotel when compared to UK standards.

On the positive side, the hotel features a kids' club and a pleasant swimming pool.

However, there are notable negatives. The staff, in general, are inattentive and slow. Upon check-in, there was no welcome information, and the front desk handles only check-ins; all checkouts are managed elsewhere. Despite being 'upgraded' to a suite on the first night, it was situated right next to the train tracks, resulting in significant noise disturbance. I strongly advise against opting for such rooms. Our subsequent room had undergone renovation at some point, but the toilet emitted a mouldy smell.

Considering these factors, I won't be choosing to stay here again.
title: Average

roomTip: Check other properties in the area. They charge top of the line prices. But they dont deliver top notch service.
text:
Date visited - Dec 29th-Jan 2nd 2024 ( 33 people group)
Service, disaster at best.
Not sure where to start. We were little over 30 people from different parts of the USA. I put this family reunion together.
I have been going back and forth with the management to make sure everything went well. Dharaka (F&B Manager) was very responsive.  I didn't want my family members to point the finger at me. I owned 12 restaurants in New York City over 20 year span. Very demanding place with 45000 restaurants. I am very critical about service. Those things you can fix. Structure you cant.
First impression - When you enter they have drummers. After that its all downhill. Front desk is a disaster. They are 5 people to say Aubowan  ( Welcome). Nobody knows what their job is. It took one hour to check 11 people in. Higher management should travel to Mexico or the Caribbean to see how well 500  plus hotel rooms check people in.  We couldn't take it anymore & we went to have lunch. After lunch I had to come looking for them ( front desk) to see what's happening. There was one girl doing everything. Sorry, she is not trained. I know the name. But I would not mention it for her to get in trouble. Other people went through the same thing. Also they are not good with wheel chair accessibility. We had an older person in the group.

Restaurants - Food is off the chart. Chefs and the cooking staff knows what they are doing. Very impressive. I never had a bad meal.
Service - Its horrible. Almost every time we sat for a meal, we had  to ask for napkins, cutleries, glasses, water etc. Tables were never ready. Supervisor named Niroshan was working so hard to get things done. He was tired of telling wait staff what to do. Every time you look they were 5 waiters around the cappuccino machine. Again, these waiters were not trained. You have to give them dedicated tables. That way they are responsible for it and they can earn extra tips. I saw waiters have been pulled on every direction. Again its a management issue.
Only reason I am giving 2 stars for service because of Dharaka & Niroshan's effort. They were working very hard. Others were working hard too. But not efficient.

New Years Eve celebration - Below average. I was disappointed. Very small dance floor on the grass. It was not enough for the crowed. Band was OK. DJ played a good first set. After midnight he decided play music that everyone left the dance floor. Usually Sri Lankan NYE parties goes until 4am. We were done by 1am.

Property - Amazing location. Water on either side. Beach is amazing. Room service guys were really good.
I paid close to $3000 for 4 days for 2 rooms. Its not cheap. We left disappointed.
I dont think, any of our group will be back at Cinnamon Bentota.
title: Great property with bad service. Top notch food. Perfect location

placeInfo/address: Galle Rd Colombo-Galle-Hambantota-Wellawaya Highway, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Take their half board
text:
This hotel is beautiful - no doubts there. The architecture and the interiors are amazing. What I didn’t like and appreciate was their staff. Especially at the front desk. 
We checked in sometime around 5 pm and had to wait a long time, they were incredibly slow. Tried calling so many times to speak with the hotel staff but all phone numbers provided were unavailable. Same thing about check out experience. No air conditioner or even a fan - check in inside the ac lounge, check out inside another place- it’s a mess. Front desk staff roams around as if they have all the time in the world. Just had one request for twin beds - which weren’t entertained. Our rooms were 2321 and 2321 both quite far from the main dining area, beach and pool side because we were travelling with two senior citizens with mobility issues - no golf cart - nothing. 
Also near the pool / spa area it is so dimly lit that one might trip and fall down anytime. 
The best thing has to be their food, I was there celebrating my birthday - even clearly mentioned that couldn’t celebrate on the day because of other issues - no cake nothing were provided. 
Even though it’s a beautiful property I didn’t like their staff - they were quite nonchalant. Housekeeping was just about ok. The spa experience for my other three family members were excellent unfortunately I was assigned a male therapist for foot massage and head shoulder massage - I strongly feel he is an accountant who was given this job because there were less staff he didn’t know what the hell he was doing. I didn’t want to complain about someone but did leave a note with the manage to look into this pathetic service experience at the spa.
title: Just about ok
